Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: KGB_4
Reviews.Content: This was another return stay with to Travelodge â€“ this time for 4 nights. I would say it rated 3.5 stars not quiet 4 though. Check in was fine (though the attendant made the credit card pre-authorisation for the room charges hard to understand). The room was a standard room on the 12th floor. It was quiet, but you can hear others in the corridor if they are banging cases or doors. Otherwise I barely hear a thing. The room was a good size, with decent size bathroom and nice fluffy towels. Wish they would get rid of the shower curtains and install proper glass shower doors. Plenty of pressure and hot water. The bed was a little tired and saggy â€“ but slept fine on it. Decor is very plain with cheap, functional furniture. The bedspread was faded could have done with replacing. But to me these are superficial and didnâ€™t affect the quality of my stay. Location wise, I think itâ€™s the best part of town â€“ close to the CBD with a short walk to Elizabeth St or through Hyde park, a few blocks from Central station, and short walks to either Surrey Hills or Elizabeth Bay (and of course Darlinghurst if you want some night life). Museum station is only a block away too. It may not be flash, but I think Travelodge represents value for money, with many Sydney hotels charging over $200 per night â€“ I got a much cheaper deal. Iâ€™m sure if/when I return to Sydney, Iâ€™ll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay”
Reviews.Author: mrkennethlo
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying in the Travelodge Hotel Sydney, from the perspective of location, it is just two blocks away from the Hyde Park and Shopping Malls - which is good. Room was fairly clean and well maintained. But the room (with one double bed) I stayed this time is quite small, and uncomfortably small. I am just Asian and pretty "compact" in size, it can be imagined that if any stronger man and woman living there would be even worse. The air-conditioner is sort of not very effective and controllable. After all, I would recommend to all of you reading this comment if you are just looking for a roof to stay for the night, it is a fair and economic choice in Sydney. However if you are looking for a little bit more comfortable room, go somewhere else. One thing to add, if you are driving, you may considered parking on the street next to the Hotel, as it is free to park after dark. In considered that the Police Station is just next door, I parked there for 3 nights and no problem encountered at all. While if you are parking at the Hotel related parking cost you AUD25 and it took around 5 to 10 mins walk to that parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good inexpensive solution for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JohnZ05
Reviews.Content: Compared to the overpriced dumps one can find in Sydney, Travelodge Sydney was a very good alternative for a not so expensive stay (roughly 125 AUD if I remember well). First the location is really excellent, just south of Hyde Park and of easy access from the airport through the Airport link (3 min walk from Museum station). Second, my standard room was correct, clean and with the proper amenities you would ask for, a small kitchenette, some chairs, a fair number of storage spaces and an OK bathroom (quite on the small size though for both the room and the bathroom). Also very quiet location. A good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: Yeahman2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 19 days in March as we was over in Sydney on holiday from the UK. The location is great as you are in walkable distance from the city and there is a free bus that takes you to the harbour round the corner or you can walk within 20 mins. The rooms was reasonable size, very clean and the beds are comfy so you get a decent nights sleep. The staff were very helpful and could always help with any requests we had. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: AmyBerry20
Reviews.Content: Although travelodges are not supposed to be luxury this one was way overpriced for the conditions. Staff were friendly enough but the bed was ridiculously small and uncomfortable. The room was dirty with hairs on the bedding!! The hotel is quite far from main attractions - not walking distance. Luckily we were only here for one night but I was very disappointed with the price we paid for this it was very poor value for money wish we would have paid for one of he even more extortionate hotels but at least had a comfortable night.

Reviews.Title: “clean,tidy good value”
Reviews.Author: Ajs241
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights on business, ok sized rooms bit old but pleasant, good device,clean, Great gym and free, quiet at night close to Restaurants and transport Recommended would stay again good value

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: TracieMarlow
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I stayed for a week leading up to Easter. The standard room on the 12th floor was a good size and clean. The rooms were quiet which was great as the hotel was full. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. The hotel was a 20 mins walk to Darling Harbour and a little longer to the Opera House but that did not bother me. At night I did not feel concerned when walking back from Darling Harbour. The internet which is payable at reception is slow and there is often a long waiting line to use it at peak times. But that is the only downside to a good budget hotel in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: waddi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Febuary. Good value hotel by Sydney standards. Reasonable room, well equipped. Walking distance from Darling Harbour. Reception helpful. Beware prices in little convenience store across the road. Rather find the Coles supermarket a bit further away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and in good location”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in March and good value hotel in excellent location handy for visiting all parts of Sydney. Nice room on 17th floor with great views of city and coin operated laundry available on certain floors.Reception area gets very crowded some days with tour parties and special area needed to accomodate these groups.Local brewpub across street with cheap beer during "happy hour" and live music some nights. Short walk to train station,Paddys Market and Darling Harbour passing through Chinatown with many restaurants to choose from. Tip get all all day travel pass for about $20 from railway station which is valid for all buses, trains and ferries and go over to Manly beach and back into Darling Harbour using train to get to Circular Quay for ferries. For car hire nearby William Street has all usual companies on it but prior book on internet to get best rates-try Oodle.com -they were brilliant and we also used them in Cairns.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_WLG
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty basic hotel but they do it well. The check in staff were fantastic, I had problems with my booking (travel agents fault) and they fixed it up and dealt with it very promptly. The room is basic with a little kitchenette, large bathroom, flat screen TV, couch and comfortable bed so I really have no major complaints here. There is no restaurant for lunch/dinners and no room service which, for me was a tad annoying when travelling alone on business for 5 days but there are plenty of takeaway options around the hotel. They have a breakfast which is very no frills but OK. This hotel seems to be very popular with tour groups so get in early! Also allow time for check out if catching a flight in case you try and check out at the same time as a tour group. Wi-Fi was available in the rooms for a cost of $20 for 24hrs and was fast. Location is OK, across from Hyde Park and close to the colourful Oxford Street. It was only a 20min walk to Pitt Street Mall and an easy stroll to the Museum, Barracks and about 30min stroll to the Circular Quay. Overall, I prefer to be a bit more central but if the price is right (like it was in this case) I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in sydney”
Reviews.Author: GRAHAM W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January 2012 .This hotel was booked from England when we arrived we found the staff very helpfull the room was clean and the bathroom was clean plenty of hot water.overall we liked the hotel would recomend if you are on a budget better than some of the motels we stayed in.well pleased, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: showersingerr
Reviews.Content: Went there for conducting Incentive Tour..well let's say not much of impressive place for entertaining client. But I will consider staying personally. The good side was on the size of the room quite big. As for the toilet was very clean. Breakfast was basic and I consider the coffer was very bad. The downside was there was no free wifi which is quite essential for my work. Overall, expected. Not less and not more.

Reviews.Title: “No wiz-bang here, just a good solid hotel to sleep in.”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_Kwan
Reviews.Content: A well-known no-frills franchise hotel, the Sydney Travelodge on Wentworth Ave is close to World Square (5mins), George street cinemas, Chinatown (15 mins walk) & Darling Harbour is just a little further off. The hotel is situated next to the Philippines Consulate & is on the same block as 2 quiet pubs, perfect if you need to bring over your young Filipino bride & feeling thirsty after! Much in the same mould as the Mercure & Ibis. Very standardised & minimal fancy furniture made out of cheap melamine wood with imitation wood laminate, budget office carpet & simple bathrooms with small single sink & shower curtain. Although many room features are budget, the franchise name & familiarity is what you are really paying for. No maids or servants here. 51 cm TV has limited Foxtel & Fox Sports, no free movie channels. Table, 2x chairs, stocked mini-fridge, iron & wardrobe are in good condition as you would expect. No free Wi-Fi. Electronic safe. Staff were professional, check-in/check-out was no-nonsense & efficient with a smile. Plenty of secure parking within a block. Itâ€™s better eating all your meals near George St, plenty of cafÃ©â€™s, fast food options & atmosphere. Not located anywhere near any immediate clubs you will be able to avoid getting into a random brawl on your way back from dinner or enjoy a cigarette in peace, in other words its relatively safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Svea1
Reviews.Content: You don't get a better location than this in Sydney. If you're looking for a central hotel with good standard to a low price, this is the place. Clean, simple, polite.

Reviews.Title: “My regretful stay”
Reviews.Author: skiaie
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel by mistake and i really regret it. I went to Sydney on Business and this hotel is more kind of the low price tourist type of visitors as the guided tour are always in the lobby and talking to their groups, blocking the ways to the lifts!!! and making a lot of noise. People staying next to my room had no respect to others at all and I didn't get a good sleep. Talking on mobile phone in the hallway and talking loudly, banging the doors in the middle of the night. My "do not disturb sign" was stolen during the night so I woke up when the cleaner was trying to enter the room!!! and when I asked him to come back later to clean he never showed p and my room didn't get cleaned. There is no restaurant in the hotel and they are suggesting to use restaurants in other hotels nearby!! If you are tired and need food you have to call the moving menus which I actually found it cool as I could have Tony Roma's Ribs while watching My Kitchen rules on TV. The in room safe was not working at all, and giving error messages. One morning I left the tv remote on the bed and when I came back after the room was cleaned I found it under the sheet, which clearly shows the sheet was not changed and the cleaner was not even bother to look at the place while cleaning. I had my Shampoo dropped on the floor in the shower and when I came back it was still there. Not sure what kind of service they think they are providing, but I guess from the tourists point of view the hotel is cheap and they are coming to just get a night sleep and strt the next day exploring again.

Reviews.Title: “Just good”
Reviews.Author: Tim P
Reviews.Content: Value for money but nothing more. Good home base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Handy stopover but not the Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: margland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 4 blocks of most shopping and attractions. Rooms are a good size and come with iron and board, safe, microwave, sink,cutlery and crockery. One of the annoying habits is for the cleaning staff to turn off the master switch after they leave and this turns off the aircon. With the room facing the sun all day we could never get the room cool enough quickly. In addition there was a nose twitching smell in the lift area and passageways. The breakfast room is good but closes early morning. It would be nice to have a coffee there in the daytime rather than go out and find one. Having said all that, we would recommend the hotel as it is a good price for the location. Reception was excellent and their service was top class.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: MereldeBoer
Reviews.Content: Just good. Clean place for a good price on a great spot. Ideal for a city trip

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Ken M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights and were a bit concerned about variable reviews. Turned out to be nonsense. Good location near Hyde Park and easy walking distance to centre of Sydney. Room was very good -comfortable, decent size and facilities. Lift problem easily rectified by VERY friendly reception staff who were also very helpful with an awkward fax request. We were moving on after our stay and found the laundry facilities very useful and easy to use. All in all an impressive experience and my wife isn't easy to please. We did not use the breakfast facility so can't comment and my only complaint would be that internet access had to be paid for as in many other places. I always think hotel chains who do this are a bit miserly.

Reviews.Title: “Near Central Railway - First time visit”
Reviews.Author: Gaja
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this Hotel. We selected this Hotel as it is close to Central Railway station, where we were to depart early the next morning. We requested a room on a high floor and were not disappointed when we checked in to the top floor. The room was quite and cosy. The bathroom was on the small size, shower only. The bed was firm, and I got a good nightâ€™s sleep. Forget free internet, the charge was about $10 a hour! It was about a 20 minute walk to central station and 10 minutes to Chinatown for dinner at Mamakâ€™s. Breakfast was the standard buffet offerings, nothing stood out as anything special. We will be looking for something different on our next visit this end of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location not so great service”
Reviews.Author: Tino T
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a few friends in. Double room. We had arrived a few hours early (2pm check in is far too late) so we asked the lady at the counter if we could store our bags. She asked for the booking names with no smile or welcoming gesture (I've had a more personal service from an Automative phone service) The gentleman who took our bags was friendly enough. As we arrived back during Check in time the same lady who had 'greeted' us earlier had asked for my name as if she had never seen me before. We received this kind of service throught our whole stay. The cleaners were nice but when we had asked the cleaner if she could come back (as we were in at 10am during such an early turnover time) she had said she couldn't come back as she had nearly finished. Due to lack of any service and the laundry room being way up in the attic I've given this place a Two out of Five

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tupex
Reviews.Content: great welcome at reception. lovely guy Chris who remembered my name through out my stay, nice touch. Plenty of space to move round the room, nice having a sink in the room and having washing liquid and dish cloth provided for coffee cups. I was near the lifts and wasn't disturbed by noise although I always take ear plugs when I stay at hotels. 2 minutes from the museum train station, location fantastic. I will stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sepang
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel on 13.2.12. Checked in very fast; nice , polite , pleasant and smiling office girl. Room is tidy and clean with comfortable beds. We had one facing the backyard; no view but quiet at night. Locatin is good very near to China town where we had our yammy dinner. Plenty of taxi around. It costs us some $35.00 from the airport. Hoel does provide bus service to air-port with a fare of $14.00 p.p.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarySandyford
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a hotel for sightseeing and shopping in Sydney. It is beside Hyde Park and the bus stops for the buses to Bondi and the free CBD shuttle which runs every 10 minutes around the sights of Sydney. Would highly recommend this hotel. Staff very efficent and friendly and accommodating. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for business travellers and no consideration for early check-im”
Reviews.Author: Krajan99
Reviews.Content: While check-in is guaranteed at 2:00 pm, even if you arrive early about an hour, they make you wait (despite your having indicated arrival time) and immediately hand over a room to a guest who has arrived after yoyr bevore 2:00 pm. In short, it is arassment for a person who has reported earlier for check-in who is made to wait till 2:00 pm and room is immediately alloted to someone who arrives ater than you. I arrived at about 12:30 pm on 20 Feb 12 and was made to wait and omeone who arrived at 12:45 pm was alloted tge room immediately. This is highly irregular and the reception staff just does not botger about tge inconvenience caused. They make you fel like a beggar. For a business traveler, internet is available only on 15th floor and above. They say they cannot guarantee a room on these floors. I was a victim. Very indifferently they say internet is availabke in lobby on hourly basis. Business travellers suffer since they would like to use internet on tgrir laptops in their rooms. Hotel absolutely indifferent to cater to tge needs of their guests. I would never stay in this hotel again nor recommend this hotel to anyone in future.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Elsita72
Reviews.Content: Best location close to Central Train Station. Basic hotel, clean and well priced considering that it is located in the heart of the city. Service was good. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: LizzyLeeton
Reviews.Content: I would not have chosen this place to stay but had no option. It is a very basic hotel but seems busy with guests checking in and out at all times so I am assuming they sell a ot of their rooms based on their name. The rooms are very ordinary but clean and I had no complaints about the service. There are just so many other options around that are much better. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All the basics covered”
Reviews.Author: TheChairmanMeow
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight - central location if you are planning to visit Surry Hills or Chinatown as I was. Room and bathroom were nice and clean, but bed was rather firm. This is a pretty basic place so don't expect fripperies. But I think it was value for money and has a good central location. Be warned - check in and out has long queues & staff seem a bit frazzled.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Happyrichcouple_lol
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we didn't stay in circular quay area as it would have been too far from points of interest around town. Travelodge wentworth is within walking distance of everything around cetral. Rooms are clean, reasonable space, and beds are comfy enough. Service can be improved as they didnt replace the handtowels during our stay. If you want a room with a view this may not be the hotel for you. But for the price, convenience and quality, hard to beat this one.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug0809
Reviews.Content: Rooms small, pillows rock hard, airconditioning unit leaked leaving puddles of water and wet iron, "Extremely Noisy", would not recommend at all. Staff friendly and helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Bron L
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay if all you're wanting is a bed for the night. Good location with shuttle bus to the airport. Downsides: parking is a block away, lifts can be temperamental, no room service available, no mini bar, no fitness facility and rooms are quite small and stuffy. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No internet!”
Reviews.Author: scstar2000
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Travelodge Sydney on Wentworth, however, we sadly mistook this hotel for the Travelodge at Wynyard. We got off the train at the Wynyard hotel which looked very nice and modern. We were directed to the hotel on Wentworth which was not as nice. I couldn't believe that there was NO Internet in the hotel, not even a wired connection. There were two computers in the lobby that you paid for but the browser was antiquated and incredibly SLOW. The room was small and not very clean. The walls in the bedroom and bathroom was dirty and they only left us 2 towels for a triple room. When we went to call the front desk, we realized the phone wasn't set up to call downstairs. The A/C didn't work very well and despite being set at 17 degrees, it never even got close to that. The upside of the hotel was that it was only 2 blocks from the Museum train station.

Reviews.Title: “Barry & Pateena”
Reviews.Author: pateenas
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Travelodge, and we could not fault it,staff were very helpful as my husband had to call a Dr for me when I became very ill,the staff had a Dr to our room within five minutes they then checked on me for the next two days.Very clean,good location, We will be definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical modern city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: David_and_Rose
Reviews.Content: Found this a nice place to stay, even if not a lot of character. Typically clean modern hotel, nothing special one way or the other. Staff moderately helpful. Rooms smallish, comfy beds, very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “No hot shower and don't expect response or accountability from management”
Reviews.Author: Betty12k
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed for only one night and i am glad it was only for that short period. On our first and only night we soon discover we have only cold water for shower. I rang reception who told me to run the water for 10 - 15 minutes; still no hot water. she said she will leave note for hotel manager to look into it the next day and someone will be in contact first thing. next day we waited and when we went to check out, the girl at the counter seemed clueless when we asked why no one followed up this morning about hot water. the whole time we didn't get to speak to the manager as promised, no compensation and no sincere apology from anyone at the hotel. Extremely disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stopover for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: sa_countryfolk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I plus mum & dad stayed here while having a break and attending a wedding. The rooms were simple and clean, much like the Travelodge at Wynyard except no bath not that is was a problem. Bedding was good, although my experience of hotel pillows are they are almost always too thick, but that's just me. The staff were helpful although didn't really need them besides check in and out. The food in the bistro for breakfast, lunch and dinner was pretty good, especially considering the low price (compared to the other expensive restaurants around in the area, let alone on Circular Quay) and the drinks prices in the Leagues bar were comparable to those in Adelaide. This was my third stay in a Travelodge and haven't had a problem. Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Economic choice in expensive city”
Reviews.Author: patm82
Reviews.Content: Of course there are hotels much more central than this. But the location is still good. It's feasible to walk to Darling Harbour or Circular Quay. It takes a while, but you're there to see the city after all. Also, Museum train station is very close and the train takes you to the hot spots in no time. The room was ok, not much furniture in it, but clean. The bathroom was an accessible one, even though we did not ask for such. Therefore the shower had no border to stop the water. Unfamiliar, but not a big deal. Staff was helpful. We could by stamps from them and they organized an airport shuttle for us. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: ksjinaus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overrated. Stayed for just 1 night and that was enough! The room we were given was nothing like the one in the pictures. No sofa for starters. In face the room was that small there would have been room to put it anyway. The room was clean and tidy but very small. The location was good for us as it was reasonably close to central station and we were in transit. There are much better and cheaper alternatives in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in its classÂ I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: chrisjrn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge Sydney in late January 2012. Despite not having a guarantee of bedding configuration in the room booking, I got a double bed -- a bit on the hard side, but not uncomfortable at all. The air conditioning was good -- powerful, adjustable, and easy to use. There's also a separate in-room sink, which means that making tea or coffee doesn't involve filling a kettle from an unwieldy bathroom basin. All in all, pretty damn good for a 3.5 star hotel. The location is pretty good too -- it's basically a block and a half to Museum Station, which gets you access to the city train service, and also close to cafÃ©s in Surry Hills too. (Joe Black, just next door has excellent coffee too, do try it). Downsides -- the soundproofing isn't great (there's a fire brigade route on Goulburn St, right next door, so you may hear some emergency sirens every now and again), and the windows aren't huge. Otherwise, not much to go against it.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we thought....”
Reviews.Author: Jacinta3000
Reviews.Content: Those planning to stay at the Travelodge hotel in Wentworth Ave, Sydney, Australia will be disappointed. Upon arrival, we were told that our $160 room with a queen size bed that we'd booked online with Expedia wasn't available [$20 booking charge] and if we came back later that day, it may still not be available. My husband and I had to settle for a dingy room with 3 single beds. Not quite the romantic 2 night stay we had in mind! The dining room was never open. We had to double back to actually spot the hotel, they slugged us for parking in a parking station that was a good 5-10 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: BCNY100
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed in the Travelodge Sydney, it seemed like it would be a fine, low-range hotel, and it was definitely not suitable for vacation travelers. Location was fine, and the lobby was lovely, but the rooms were old and although clean, the fittings looked sort of dingy. When you ask for a King size bed, what you get is two twins pushed together. The bathroom was tiny, and worse than that, the shower had no door, just a curtain, so the floor was soaked after each shower. We didnt' even get a squeegee or anything to help clear it up, so the floor stayed wet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, economical hotel”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this property for New Year's 2011; it was a convenient location and units were clean, though it was no-frills and budget-type accomodation. Spouse ended up getting sick on the trip, and the front desk exceeded my expectations in helping me, including directing where the hospital was and calling taxis. Walking distance to Chinatown (small) and to the World Square Shopping Centre which has a large Cole Supermarket on the lower level and fast food eateries. There was a microwave and fridge in the unit which helped a lot during our trip. The bathroom we had did not have a tub, only a stand-up, wheelchair-accessible type shower. We arrived here via public transit from the airport and walked to the hotel from the train station to save money. However, please be forewarned that it was a bit of a longer walk than expected (10-15 minutes) and some of the streets had a steeper incline. It was a bit of a hassle wheeling our luggage in this manner and the train station also did not appear to have an elevator so we had to lug our baggage up several stairs to get to street level. (There was no ramp or elevator).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle5228
Reviews.Content: Firstly it was a very hot day and the air con wasn't working. We couldn't even adjust it. We each had 3 cool showers as it was very uncomfortable. We didn't complain as it was only 1 night. Secondly, the carpet had not been vacuumed. There were streamers under the beds and fluff etc. on the carpets. Makes one feel as if the cleaners just didn't care. The bathroom floor was partly clean but a very haphazard job. Not impressed with the floor. Finally on the morning of checking out I noticed the sign on the front desk saying $14.50 for breakfast so I said oh yes we'll all (3) have breakfast thanks. The girl said NO it was only $14.50 when you checked in but would cost us $19.50 each as we hadn't booked in advance. So, your restaurant lost money as we ate elsewhere. Overall disappointing. Lastly - I forgot to mention - we arrived early in the morning and checked in our bags for the day. I developed a migraine so left my husband and son and came back to the hotel early to lie down. They wouldn't let me have a room as I didn't have a credit card - my husband had it in his wallet. Even though my husband checked in on arrival they didn't take an impression of his credit card then (unknown to me). So I had to sit and wait for him & my son to return. Thank goodness for Nurofen!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JGBBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed over new year and considering how busy the hotel was the staff were very helpful. They coped efficiently with a fire alarm triggered in a neighbouring room keeping us informed by tannoy on what was happening. Our corner room had all the facilities you would expect and hotel laundry rooms were useful too. As other reviewers have mentioned very convenint location close to Museum station and within easy walking distance of China Town etc. We walked back from Mrs McQuaries point after the fireworks in less than 45mins.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, As Expected.”
Reviews.Author: mattjohnston23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year period so paid slightly more than you would normally expect for this type of hotel however expected this for the time of year and had no complaints. Basic clean rooms which contained everything we needed for a short city stay. Location is pretty good, only a 15 minute walk from Circular Quay, 10 minutes from Darling Harbour and and short walk round the corner to both the Monorail and Train stations. Staff ok although had no need to call on them for anything. The only slight complaint we had was the effectiveness of the air conditioning in one of the rooms which seemed to struggle slightly however this was a minor issue with what was otherwise and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: ejs88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special but what can you expect for the price? The location is great, close to the CBD, Circular Quay, Surry Hills and transport to everywhere else. The hotel room I had was fairly basic but was nice enough, very clean and had a kitchenette (but no room service per se). Reception were a little deceptive about the wireless assuring me I had a room with access to the internet - what they did not mention was that there was an extra fee to access the connection. I was also charged for a breakfast I never ate and when I questioned this was quite bluntly and repeatedly told I had in fact eaten breakfast (despite staying one night and checking out just before 7am). After making a phone call I was eventually able to sort this out with hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Rajendra51
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days, i.e. 1st and 2nd January, 2012, and enjoyed stay. It is a very good budget hotel in the heart of city. One can think to stay with family and enjoy. It is also approachable even by walk to the Sydney Opera House and Darling Harbour, where family can enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “High price bad value”
Reviews.Author: Fershtet
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is location. It is very central. The staff are very unhelpful. The service is very bad. We had to ask the reception for cleaning the room 5 o'clock in the afternoon. And they looked at us in a way that was not normal to ask for cleaning the room. Every day when they cleaned the room we found our clothes and telefon on the floor. Towels were wet and dirty in the bathroom and we had to take them to reception to have new ones. It was mug on the walls. And the floor was as dirty as before cleaning. It was just one elevator and one day one of them was out of orther and they asked us to use the step to go to 14 floor!!! because the needed the other one for theirselves.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and good value”
Reviews.Author: PoshRegan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Sept 2011, on my 3rd trip to Sydney, and this was my first time staying at a Travelodge. I found a very good deal on the hotel website, a discounted rate based on my extended stay. It is certainly worth looking out for deals like this, and it turned out to be very good value. The Travelodge's location is excellent, almost on top of Museum Station (part of the city circle Network) and very close to Hyde Park and the moving Anzac Memorial. You can also walk to Oxford Street, Darling Harbour and all major attractions easily. When I arrived the check in staff were very welcoming and asked if I wanted a map of the area. The reception area itself looked bright, open and welcoming, and I felt comfortable being there. My bedroom was clean (serviced every day) and well equipped, with a kitchenette (microwave, cutlery and sink), fridge, hairdryer, tea/coffee and TV, and had good overhead and bedside lighting. There was also a good amount of storage space for my case and clothing. The bathroom was also very neat and clean, and quite a reasonable size, with nice extra toiletries. The bed was comfortable and I had a good night's sleep. The room's decor was admittedly quite 'standard' and plain, but that is just to be expected from large chains like Travelodge. The hotel has a restaurant and as I understand it you can go there and add breakfast to your bill. However, this was not really an issue for me, as I like to have breakfast out when I'm on holiday; others may want to consider this though. There were 4 coin-op. internet kiosks which generally worked well, and the costs were not too bad for a quick email check. They also had printing facilites, which proved to be handy for printing my boarding pass. In addition, there was a self-service laundry which was operational each day, and vending machines/ice machines were foundon each level. All of this was very useful. One little gripe was the lifts; they often seemed to have a mind of their own and I would swipe and swipe my card and press where I wanted to go, with confusing results. Hopefully thishas now been sorted out. Overall, I had a pleasant stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: colin1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel over the New Year period. We booked it as at the time of booking it was the only rooms we could get in Sydney. We arrived at about 2:30pm. Got given a room to find a cleaner was in the room and the room was not ready. Back down to reception and they said they would get us another room. This took about 15 minutes and a nice touch was that they give coupons for a free breakfast to compensate for the wait. The room was a corner room. Bit of a strange shape but it was fine. Had a comfy bed, flat screen TV, microwave, fridge, sink area. Bathroom was OK and clean. The view was not to bad as well. In the past we have always booked the Travelodge Wynyard which has a better location but that hotel was fully booked. This location is not too bad though. About a 10 min walk from the Museum Station and quite close to Hyde Park. It was a pleasent walk down to the Opera house / Circular Quay area from the hotel. That was probably about a 30 or 40 minute walk. The free breakfast was nice as well with plenty to choose from and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, when you visit a city for the first time, you like to walk and see everything on foot. This Travelodge made walking the streets of Sydney very convenient. You could walk to the harbor in around 25 minutes at a very reasonable pace. You are also only a few blocks from china town and the bus station. We were able to walk for about 10 minutes to catch a bus to a rugby game. (Highly recommend - go Roosters). Breakfast was good every morning. I was part of a school group so can't comment on price. One negative is that they do seem to host a number of school groups so the small lobby was always busy and there was often teenagers around. One major complaint was their luggage storage room. We had to check out in the morning, but didn't leave until the afternoon. They had a small room behind the front desk to store luggage, buy anyone could walk into it at anytime. All of our bags got reshuffled while we were gone and we had a hard time finding one of our students bags. After some frantic searching and moving several bags around we were able to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Stimmo25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for a weekend in Sydney in January with another couple. The location is great just around the corner from Museum station (direct stop from airport). It is within easy walking distance of Chinatown, Darling Harbour, the shops and restaurants of Surry Hills and Oxford Street and the city shops. We walked to the Opera House via Hyde Park in about 20-25 minutes. There are also many bus stops within a block or 2 of the hotel. It was very good value at around $350 in total for 3 nights. The rooms were pretty basic but clean and comfortable and each room had a fridge, safe and kitchenette with a sink, some plates and cutlery and a microwave (a bottle opener would have been nice). We had twin single beds and our friends a double bed. My bed was a bit lumpy but everyone else said theirs was OK. I thought the area was quiet at night but one of our friends said she was kept awake by the outside noise. The bathrooms were a good size and clean, although it was hard to keep the whole floor from getting wet while showering due to a shortish shower curtain. The staff were friendly and helpful and our bags were stored on depature for a later flight without any problem. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as it seemed quite expensive, but there are many options nearby. There were some minor issues with the hotel such as no wi fi (pay kiosks for internet on ground floor), poor reception on our TV (our friends in the next room had very good reception) and the swipe card in the lift only working spasmodically, but overall I would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: vanialre
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 12noon, and were able to get into our room 2 hours early as it was cleaned and ready for us. I didn't notice any queues around the reception desk ( admittedly I was not around at the magic 2pm!! ) The reception team were polite and helpful. Check in ok! We were travelling with a baby so housekeeping brought a cot up for us. It was a fold up travel cot which my baby has trouble sleeping in so we padded it out with a cushion from the sofa and the extra pillows in the room. I do not see this as an issue, I have just included it as a hint for other families. The room was clean and tidy nothing fancy, definitely of the standard I would expect from Travelodge. The bed was a large double and was very comfy. Flat screen TV with semi decent programmes on. ( We were in from 7pm because of our son ) Bathroom was clean with plenty of towels, shower was a little dodgy but what hotel shower isn't?!?! Kitchette was ideal with a baby as we needed to sterilise bottles etc. Room OK!!! The hotel is in a great location, 5 minutes from museum station and 25 minute walk from harbour. We walked down each day even with a pushchair. We ate out 1 evening but because our son gets quite crabby if he's up past bedtime we used the Moving Menus service. I've never seen it before but basically there is a book of about 12 different restaurant menus. You decide what you want and ring the number on the menu book and your order is placed and delivered to your room. Obviously it's just like ordering take out but if you're in an unfamiliar city this is ideal. You pay for your food and the delivery charge to Moving Menus, this is an independent company and not run by Travelodge. It worked out well for us as it meant we could eat later in the evening after the baby was asleep. I would definitely recommend this hotel, we had no problems ( maybe as we didn't have unreal expectations of a Travelodge ) we were very happy with our stay and the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's a budget hotel, but what about the service??”
Reviews.Author: itravell3r
Reviews.Content: It is a very delayed review but better late than never. Stayed with them in 2009 for 3 nights. Toiletteries were not available on the first night (no soap, no towels and no toilet paper), though we didn't make a big fuss about it and just went down to reception to ask for them. The rooms were not made despite us putting the "Please make my room" sign at the door for 2 nights. Told the management but they didn't seem to care. Wrote them a complaint letter but did not get a response. Got a email survey which I have completed with no follow up on the issues I raised, put my phone number down for them to contact me and I didn't receive a call. Service was bad, staff were not rude but not attentive. The only plus was good location on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “OH DEAR!”
Reviews.Author: beyondblonde
Reviews.Content: What an experience. Check in and Check out was very quick and simple considering the amount of people that were around. Hotel seemed very popular with backpackers and tourists. BUT then we got to our room.. it was super tiny with the most uncomfortable double bed i have ever slept in.. If you enjoy springs and wood planks sticking into your back i would highly recommend staying here. Hotel levels were dirty and of the limited facilities offered none were working. This was marketed as a romantic get away for two but we couldnt even stand staying in the room, it was stuffy, small and uncomfortable OH YEAH and the air conditioner didnt work I would seriously recommend you spend an extra $50 and stay some where much nicer

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place to stay with good location.”
Reviews.Author: jddavids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we couldn't afford to stay at the nicer places with prime location. Having said that, the rooms were excellent and it is only a 25 minute walk to the Opera house. Highly recommend for a traveler on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: grater1
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed in this hotel. The hotel offers excellent value for money is you booked online. This time our room was very clean and had views out to the west of the city. Check in was a breeze and the staff were most helpful despite us having to make last minute changes. At all times the staff were very friendly and helpful and appeared calm even when dealing with rude and pushy guests. Breakfast was included in the price and it was you got what you pay for. It was all good basic breakfast options however the restaurant was noisy and a bit like feeding time at the zoo. We had breaky here once and then went to some of the great little cafes nearby that offer such great value for money. The location is great - a 10 minute walk to PItt Street Mall, just around the corner from the Museum station (drop off point if getting the train from the airport) and walking distance to the great restaurants of Surry Hills - Crown Street and Cleveland Street, plus the always exciting Oxford Street. Dollar for dollar this hotel represents some of the best value in Sydney. We will stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: LeonieLordHoweIsland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night before travelling overseas had a double and a triple room. Rooms adequate although triple room was cramped for 3 adults. Minimum facilities and no safe in double room was annoying. Check in was easy and staff assisted quickly with directions to required medical assiatance advising nearest location and suggesting use of local medical centre. Hotel is close to Museum station and chinatown. Certainly met our needs for a basic room for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible staff and pokey rooms”
Reviews.Author: WestyTweedValley
Reviews.Content: Of all the times I've stayed Travelodge properties in a number of cities, this was the worst. Check in was NOT allowed prior to 14:00 in any circumstance. The result of this inflexible attitude was long queues at 14:00 - of course. My room was (seriously) formerly a broom cupboard. Angled walls, long and narrow, it was tucked in a corner alongside the elevators. Every other Travelodge in every other city has been wonderful. But not this one. Not again at this property for me.

Reviews.Title: “Goood value for money”
Reviews.Author: WandR
Reviews.Content: Sydney hotels are expensive - so the cost of these rooms, in such a great location makes it worthwhile. Rooms are pretty standard but clean and comfortable enough. There's no gym or pool - and the bar fridge is empty so buy your own drinks and snacks - but I'm happy to stay here for short trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Ozmanian
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides great value for money. It is rated as a 3.5 star and more than lives up to this rating. Without being flash; it is clean, recently rennovated, well located and the staff are helpful and fiendly. I rate it as a 4/5 becuase it more than meets the requirements of a "budget" hotel. Overall it was better then an alleged 5 star hotel I stayed at in Sydney last month - which was twice the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hard mattress and poor service”
Reviews.Author: coldrock
Reviews.Content: The mattress is really bad. A lot of dust around the corners of the room. The cleaner was very rude when we left the room by nearly throwing beddings on us. The staff in reception was friendly but they are not considerate enough regarding Car park. I was locked out at night and haven't been given warning about it. I went all my way back to get another parking ticket at night by waking with my little boy. It's really not pleasant. The location is quite ok and close to China town.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Adam6750
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in this hotel, 27-30th December 2011. This hotel was great value for money, I was only after a bed to sleep as was going to be busy the entire time in Sydney, this was perfect for that, the location was great and the room was good value for money. There is a convenience store and a bottle store just across the road and if you walk to the end of Commonwealth street, there are buses and most importantly the Museum train station that can take you direct to the airport. I requested a taxi from the front desk and it was promptly there. The hotel also has a baggage facility at no cost for those that need to store bags for a later flight. Overall I was more than happy with this hotel and it was definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: charcharLA
Reviews.Content: Beds were clean, bathroom was clean. Only complaint was that they gave us 2 twin beds instead of a queen bed, which we booked through Expedia. Three nights' total was $270 for October 2010. You are able to walk to the bridge and opera house - it'll just be a 20 min walk. Super close to Chinatown - went there to find breakfast in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE ... your room type is not guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: PeteW60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 30th Dec 2011 to 2 Jan 2012 for a family reunion to see the Sydney New Years Eve fireworks. Three double rooms were booked in March 2011 and PAID IN FULL at that time. So imagine our disappointment when we turned up to be told that we had twin single rooms. At over 6 foot 6 tall I pointed out that this wasn't going to be comfortable but were told that the hotel was full and room allocations had been made 2 weeks before and were now "locked - no changes possible". The young woman on check-in immediately offered to call her Manager (I gained the impression that she had been having to deal with this all day and had already had enough !). The Manager gave us the same answer. We produced the original paperwork indicating that we had most definitely booked double rooms. The answer to this was "you booked through a third party site (they said Expedia but it was Hotels.com) and it's in the small print that you are just guaranteed a room ... not a particular type". I asked how they made the decision on who got the doubles and who didn't .... I would have thought that paying in full in March would have given us priority. She had no answer to this other than "you are welcome to find another hotel and I will refund your booking". At any other time I would have said yes but it would have been impossible to find an alternative in Sydney for NYE. So travellers beware .... unless you book direct with the hotel your room type is not guaranteed. The hotel itself is 3 star at best .... definitely not 4. Our particular room had poor cold water pressure (but the other 2 rooms were fine) and the aircon unit had leaked in the past and caused the wardrobe chipboard to blister (and smell). Location is the hotels best feature. Outside of NYE it probably isn't bad value at about A$150 per night but when they charge almost $900 for the 3 nights I have to score it as terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy A
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but thats about it! How they got a 4 star rating is unbelievable I would say 2.5 to 3 star rating. We had 3 different rooms within 12 hours due to not getting the bedding right the first 2 and the 3rd time we got what we paid for. The second room we stayed the night in and woke up to the air conditioner leaking all over the floor at 6am Christmas morning. The 3rd room we were in had no air conditioning working until the 4th day we were there for 6. Every day we had to ask for more towels, even though they had to make the beds every day we still had less towels than beds that they had to make. Intially everything looks clean but tired the bathroom was in need of a good scrub. The lobby is updated and the staff are very helpful. I would look carefully before booking this for more than 2 nights and compare it to other 4 star hotels which would easily beat this hotel on that rating.

Reviews.Title: “Close to most of the attractions, clean updated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: oldprune
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Hyde Park where Museum train station is located. If you are able, Darling Harbor is about 15 min.on foot. It is close to most of the attractions and Sydney is very much a "Walkable city". Room was clean, updated look -Kitchenette contains Iron Board, Iron, 3 sets of glasses, mugs, plates and bowls, forks, knives and spoons along with mini-refrig, mini-microwave oven and safe. Also instant cofee packets and tea provided. No heating element or pots - just hot water heater and Microwave. We were able to save bundle by eating simple breakfast - Cereals, milk, bread, juices. Also we had few dinners - cooked ham, mash potatoes, frozen mixed vegies! Cole is the nearest grocery store (3 blocks away, underground of Mall). It is costly to eat out - nothing less than $20! We stayed 4 nights over the Christmas and glad I did - I cancelled Y-Hotel and changed to this one because of the Kitchenette. Y-Hotel is only few block away, so is Marriott. The room is air-conditioned and quiet. We took Airport Shuttle for $14 per person that was very good also. Over all, I have no complaint - I would recommend this hotel to you all.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Esker4
Reviews.Content: If I'd known that wireless internet was only available on the 14th floor and higher (for a fee), I would not have stayed here, despite the good location and reasonable price (for Sydney CBD). I can see now that the information provided about internet access (coin-op kiosk in foyer) is correct, but I didn't really believe that there wasn't other internet access for those not staying on an "executive floor" (my stupid mistake). I was planning on doing some work from my laptop, sending and receiving documents, and I can see a good signal from my room and can even see a webpage telling me I can buy an internet access card at the front desk. Unfortunately, the front desk people (who are very nice) wouldn't sell me one because I am not staying on an approved floor for internet access. Another strange thing about this place is the elevator system. The fact that you have to swipe your key card to go up is probably for security, but if you are in the elevator and don't swipe the card in time and the elevator is called from an upper floor, up you go to that floor anyway. How is that secure? If you get in the elevator to go down and someone on an upper floor calls the elevator in the seconds before you push the button for the lobby floor, up you go. I try to be quick with card-swiping and button-pushing as soon as I get on the elevator, but I have spent a lot of time going up to floors I have no interest in visiting, especially since I hate all those people up there who can purchase expensive wireless internet access and I cannot. I was not impressed with the level of cleanliness of the bathroom when I checked in (floor had not been washed or swept), but the rooms are adequate in terms of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Purpose”
Reviews.Author: ruthfa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Hotel is in a good location within walking distance to the shops, restaurants and Darling Harbour. Still walk able but slightly further to circular quay. Cost of the internet was outrageous at $99 for a weeks access which we considered extortionate. Also note wifi is only available on some floors so if this is important to you check. On arrival we were given a room with a very small double bed (we are a couple). This was not really acceptable for a weeks stay. We complained and they apologised and moved us to a room with 2 singles (they do however have rooms with larger doubles). On check in you can buy breakfast vouchers for $14 per person per meal, its more expensive if you donâ€™t buy them on check in. The breakfast was adequate although it was a little like a canteen catering for alot of people. Room itself was fine. We had a microwave which we did not use. There was also a sink, a fridge and some plates (this is the advertised kitchenette) . Overall the hotel is fit for purpose.

Reviews.Title: “nice location and price - bedrock bed”
Reviews.Author: chowdog65
Reviews.Content: the travelodge near the train museum in sydney has a great location and for the price was a good deal. Pretty centrally located and there are convenience stores and restaurants in the vicinity. The bed left alot to be desired - it felt like a thin prison mattress on top on a piece of plywood - but we're not checking into this place for comfort. The weather there was fairly nice but I could tell the in-room air conditioner was struggling - on a hot day in sydney it's possible it might not be up to the task. The staff were reasonably helpful - they take a 50 AUD deposit for incidentals. Coin-operated internet access in the lobby and contrary to some prior reviews the room was clean if not spartan. All in all it did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “A 3* in Sydney. You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: archios
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a room only basis. It's your bog standard 3* travelodge, so you get what you pay for really. Location is on the edge of Haymarket, a shortish walk to the bars on George st. and the museum subway stop is a couple of minutes away which will take you up to Circular Quay. Room was clean and a decent size with a little kitchenette. Strong smell of cigarettes in the corridor outside but fortunately not in the room. Bed was quite hard & not massively comfortable and the bathroom was a wet room as showering constantly soaked the floor. For budget accommodation its absolutely fine for a short stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: peter_sue20
Reviews.Content: This is fairly basic accommodation at the south end of Hyde Park. The hotel is however located in a very interesting and multi cultural area featuring many types of restaurants and bars. There are a number of other hotels located nearby.George street is three blocks from the hotel. Most of Sydney's attractions are within walking distance and Museum train station is one block away. Our room was an OK size and contained a small fridge and a micro wave. House keeping was however a little hit and miss. The hotel has yet to fully embrace the 21st century as there is no wi fi available.

Reviews.Title: “i would stay at travelodge again.”
Reviews.Author: rockerette
Reviews.Content: we had an enjoyable stay .great location.the access cards for the lift was tricky to use every time.the restaurant was only open for breakfast but there was plenty of other places to get food nearby.otherwise it was clean and comfortable.good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: perc888
Reviews.Content: nearly always stay at the travelodge sydney as it is so conveniently located, comfortable & also has a kitchenette for inexpensive meals, also the buffet breakfast is good value

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AJH611
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. This is in a great location, close to Central Station or Museum Station as well as Chinatown and Darling Harbour only a 10 minute walk. The rooms were spacious, clean and well presented. Would stay here again next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: chris_langman
Reviews.Content: very good holiday at the travelodge. it was a nice and clean hotel. it is located in an ideal place, close to main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterop8
Reviews.Content: It's in a handy spot and the rooms are quite adequate and modern.It's more a budget hotel and is quite busy but the price is moderate and the restaurant not too expensive. A good place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: saf51
Reviews.Content: Less than 15 minutes Metro ride $15 from airport to Central Station & 15 minute walk from Central Station to Travelodge (uphill but not too bad with wheelie case). Shuttle bus direct to Travelodge from airport is also $15 single $28 return. Itâ€™s a 20 minute walk to Sydney harbour or 5 minutes by Metro from Central Station or Museum Station-both equal distance from hotel. We booked online about 2 months before visit & got a good deal at $125 night including full buffet breakfast. Our room was large & comfortable. No problem getting laundry done whenever we wanted-sufficient washing/drying machines. I can fully recommend this Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: si n
Reviews.Content: The reason I stay when travelling is only to sleep, I am out the rest of the time so I need to relax. This hotel is goos

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: KSTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November. The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from Museum Station at the southern end of Hyde Park. Very easy walk to hotel from station. We arrived early but were able to leave our bags tagged in a room near reception. Our room was on the 16th floor - your room key is required to use the lift which is a good security measure. Our room was very quiet, clean, had a very large shower with plenty of pressure and the bathroom had the usual soaps, shampoo and conditioner. The room was also equipped with TV, alarm clock, hair dryer, ironing board and iron, safe, microwave, fridge, jug, tea, coffee and milk. There was also a kitchen sink in the kitchenette area. The bed was very firm but we found it very comfortable. The only downside for us was the pillows were very very low (our friends who were visiting at the same time noted the same problem with pillows). We had booked via a deal on Wotif and breakfast was included in the rate of $125.00 per night. The breakfast room was fairly large with plenty of tables. It was a little noisy but you'd expect that with lots of travellers in there. There was an excellent choice of breakfast buffet - cereals, yogurt, pastries, croissants, toast, fruit bread as well as about 6 hot items - bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, potato gems, baked beans, spaghetti. Plenty of juice and coffee and tea. The hotel was an easy 10-15 minute walk to Darling Harbour and the train from Museum Station to Circular Quay took about 5 minutes. All in a great place which is relatively inexpensive for Sydney. The staff were helpful and friendly. We also left our bags after checking out as our flight didn't leave till late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: SarahJane0488
Reviews.Content: Try to get a package here - we stayed on a Groupon promotion that was $125/night including breakfast, late check-out, and a bottle of wine each night. When we arrived, the room was okay, but definitely on the small side and there was a dead cockroach on the carpet (no longer a surprise in Australia, so we just threw it out and didn't think much of it). The bed wasn't very comfy, but the room stayed very dark which was great for sleeping. The washroom was very small and poorly planned - no enclosure for the shower and a kiddie-cornered toilet behind the heavy door meant dark, slippery, hazard-filled nighttime washroom visits. Always plan lots of time to leave your room in this hotel - the elevators are INCREDIBLY SLOW, and even though we were halfway up (9th floor), we often had two or three elevators pass by which were completely full before we could squeeze into one (15 minutes or so). This happened each morning of the 4 nights we spent (between 7am-10am). Breakfast was okay, but I asked how much it would be if we didn't have the vouchers. I was shocked that the buffet is $19 per person. It's a very basic breakfast layout (for those from North America, anyway) with runny eggs and terrible coffee. If breakfast isn't included, save yourself the money and go up to one of the many cafes in the area (within 2 blocks). You'll get a better price for better food. Location is pretty decent - less than five minutes' walk to World Square, and same to Museum Station. It's a bit of a hike to Circular Quay (20 minutes or so), but if you follow Pitt Street, you can walk through the mall and there's plenty to see along the way. While the service was a little disappointing (we often had to wait at an unattended counter before we could enter the breakfast area), I was most frustrated that none of my wakeup calls worked. I checked after the first missed one, and the agent simply said they would ensure my future wakeup calls would be set. When I was checking out, I explained my situation, and this time the agent checked to make sure they were all logged correctly and explained my phone was probably switched off. It would have been helpful if the first person had suggested that, so that we wouldn't have been late and then extra-frustrated waiting for the elevator. Overall, a decent and clean hotel. However, you will need to be extremely proactive: don't rely on customer service and give plenty of time for getting on an elevator, checking-in, and checking-out (there were often really long queues).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for many and central located”
Reviews.Author: TrisIv
Reviews.Content: Good location, quite central and good connections with public transport. quick check in with one baby, rooms are big and the small kitchenette was great. bathroom just ok, but you don't spend so much time there anyway. overall to recommend if you don't want to spend a lot of money

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but getting a bit worn out”
Reviews.Author: Case_11
Reviews.Content: For its price, this is a pretty good hotel. While it's not close to anything in particular, it's not far from Sydney's main shopping and tourist areas either - it takes about 15 minutes to walk to Martin Place, David Jones and Paddington, and it's close to Museum Station and all the buses on Elizabeth and Oxford Streets (including the express bus to Bondi Beach). The rooms are OK sized, and have a microwave and kettle. All up, the hotel is good value, though I'd strongly recommend avoiding its breakfast as its much more expensive and not as nice as what's available in the cafes in the area. That said, the hotel is getting a bit worn out. As the hotel's windows don't open and the air conditioning system is weak but noisy, all the rooms tend to be stuffy, especially in summer. During my most recent stay the card readers in the lifts seemed a bit defective and my room looked worn. Like several of the other recent reviewers, I was allocated a room type I didn't want (a room with 3 single beds) as due to "availability" what I'd reserved (a room with a double bed) wasn't available, which was rather annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced; small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: This is a solid, functional hotel at the south end of Hyde Park. As such, it is on the edge of convenience if you are spending a lot of time in the CBD or the "tourist center" of the Rocks and Circular Quay. The rooms are small, but that probably is to be expected given the fact Sydney is Australia's most populous city. We purchased the buffet breakfast each morning. It included coffee, tea, juice, cold cereal, bread and pastries, spaghetti, baked beans, scrambled eggs, sausage, and bacon. While it seemed expensive by American standards because food is expensive in Sydney, it turned out to be a decent deal and a convenient place to eat breakfast each morning. The hotel was very busy all four nights we were there, but we could always find a table at breakfast. One advantage of the hotel is that it is an easy walk to Chinatown (if you like Asian food) and a two-block walk to Elizabeth Street where a free tourist shuttle runs to Circular Quay each day. There are four computers for use, and it costs $1/10 minutes for Internet. In summary, while the Travelodge can't (and isn't trying to) compete with fancier downtown hotels, it provides a solid value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Economy close to the city in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ZephyrCanberra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and were pleasantly surprised by the friendly and efficient staff, comfortable, clean rooms and great position of the hotel. One block from Sydney's Hyde Park, close to Museum Station and with access to 24 hour undercover parking it is a great spot for short trips to Sydney when all you need is a room at the end of the day. We didn't have breakfast in the restaurant as there is a small kitchen area with microwave, fridge and dishes which makes it easy to have a simple breakfast in your room. We had a few problems getting the hang of the swipe card in the lift, but it works if you are slow and careful. Worth it for the extra security.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, cramped room, dodgy lift...”
Reviews.Author: Keithsutt
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived in the hotel I could see problems, there was a queue of people waiting to speak to reception. The queue was managed by bollards. It took me ten minutes waiting to get served. The room (which I booked 10 days earlier) I was told had two single beds in it as the hotel was fully booked. I said OK as I can manage a single bed but I soon found out it was a narrow single bed and it was hard. Not happy about that! Also, the hotel had a system in the lift where you had to swipe your card in order to successfully push the button to get to your floor. This did not always work. I had to get a replacement card at one point because of this and I saw more than one guest stuck in the lift trying to get it to read their card so they could get to their room. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business and holiday”
Reviews.Author: CMN16
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Travelodge for holiday with a little business included. The location was great - within walking distance of the city's highlights yet away from the noise of the city. The room was of ample size, clean, and well serviced. The staff was friendly and helpful. You must swipe your room key to use the elevator - this was a good security measure.

Reviews.Title: “High priced budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerporirua
Reviews.Content: As my favourite Ibis on Pitt St was not available, I booked this hotel online to stay for 3 nights but arrived at 9:00am while a smelly and hot room was offered only at 2:15pm after bombarding the reception staff many times. The irony is that when approached on arrival, I was told that they will offer a room as soon as it was vacated and cleaned. So, I waited for an hour and was told that the rooms were not ready although I was watching at least 5 peoiple had checked out. So I left my luggage in their store room and went out to have a quick breakfast and returned to find to my dismay, that the rooms have been given out to others and hence, I had to wait till 2:15pm. Very unfriendly and rude front staff. The air-con was pumping out hot air and when confronted, it was fixed only on the next day. The linen were not changed every day but only once in 3 days. I had to fight it out to get them changed every day. The free breakfast had very limited spread and was not worth the deal. In all, it was not worth the money you pay. Search around for better hotels before deciding to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced backpackers”
Reviews.Author: edwin h
Reviews.Content: We had a poky little room with 3 single beds a fridge that could not keep anything cool let alone cold Dripping taps Air con that after 3 days had not cooled the room at all Never again will this chain get my money or my recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Well priced budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Bit off the beaten track,but good value for money at around 120 aud per night Very hard to find this in CBS sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: travelholicaussie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of 30 ladies to do the bridge climb. The hotel staff were lovely and the manager on duty (Michael I think?) went out of his way to organise a dinner in the hotel for 30 women on a sturday night with no prior booking! The rooms are pretty basic but clean. Would recommend staying here if you are looking for a clean, well priced room

Reviews.Title: “Even When you Check They Still Get it Wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: My daughter and two friends are currently at Equitana in Sydney. We spent a lot of time trying to get their accommodation right, and chose the Travelodge Sydney as they said they had a triple room, with 3 single beds. I actually rang the hotel to check the bedding configuration was as stated and was assured it was correct. After a horror start to their day, when Jetstar cancelled their flight, they finally made it to the hotel after 11pm at night - to find that their room was two singles and a pull out sofa bed! Luckily, one friend wasn't there, as the sofa bed wasn't even made up. What get me is that the hotel doesn't even see this is a problem. Yes, they made the bed up before the third person arrived the next day, but we booked early enough, and made it very clear in our booking, that we wanted 3 seperate beds! At the time we booked, we could have found a room with two singles and a sofa bed for less than we are paying at this hotel. A 1 bedroom apartment would have provided my daughter and her friends with this configuration and more room! Sure, the hotel is saying they are fixing things up as we bring them up, but my frustration is that they can not understand that their website is giving a false impression. Not only that, but I was told incorrect information when I booked. Yes, I may be fussy, but I am just fed up with the information we are given being incorrect, and that the hotels believe that the paying public should just put up with it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: LRoss00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option when staying in Sydney. The hotel is very centrally located walking distance to Hyde Park and the Mueseum train stop. The hotel is two train stops away from Circular Quay and the Sydney Bridge. Walking distance to Chinatown and a short bus trip to the Paddington market. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff were very pleasant. The only problem I noted was that our room air conditioner wasn't very effective. We had it on as high as possible and the room wasn't very cool. When running, the AC was pretty noisy too. Regardless of the AC issue, I would definitely stay here on future trips to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Sydney Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: DanielAndRachel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge for four days on our first trip to Sydney. We spent most of our time sightseeing, and the hotel is an easy 10-minute walk from the Sydney Harbour and The Rocks. It's also close to Darling Harbour, which has lots of good waterfront dining options and gives a different view of the city. There are several restaurants near the hotel, including some delicious Asian take-away places right next door. The Wynyard rail station is one block away, which makes it easy to get to the airport or anywhere else in Sydney. The rooms are small but reasonably updated and clean, and the staff was always friendly. Internet access at the hotel has a steep fee for in-room access, but there are plenty of cafes and restaurants with free Internet within 5-10 minutes walking distance (look for Unwired and CafeScreen locations). If you only need access briefly, there are coin-operated Internet kiosks in the lobby at reasonable short-term prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but beware their internet!”
Reviews.Author: julion m
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters largely to the backpacker market, and is good value considering its location near Hyde Park and Oxford St. The rooms are a bit dated but are reasonable size and quite comfortable and include a kitchenette for self catering. Theres a self-service laundry but the hotel also has laundry service. The restaurant is OK for the breakfast buffet. One surprise though considering the abundance of fresh fruit in Australia is that the fruit is all canned! Be sure to ask for a room away from the ends of the corridors, as those locations are VERY noisy. Thats's where the laundry is, and the fire doors which are constantly being opened and shut for some reason, and the cleaners' supply cupboards which are always being opened and shut and banged with service trolleys. As other reviewers have already warned, the hotel's internet service is basically a ripoff. Most rooms don't have internet connection, so you are forced to use the oh so very slooooooooooow and very expensive connection in the lobby. Then if you pay extra for the "internet package" on the top floor rooms you don't get a package at all! You just get the right to pay MORE just to use a service that has to be the slowest in Sydney. Most backpacker type hotels offer internet service for free but this one is determined to make it a profit centre it seems. I just wish they would give us what we pay for. Other than that the hotel is good value but personally I would look elsewhere next time because email and researching travel sites is important to me when I am on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AngelaD17
Reviews.Content: Living in Canberra means that I can get to Sydney cheaply by bus, so I visit more frequently than otherwise would be possible. I always stay at the Sydney Travelodge. The location is excellent, being within walking distance from Central train/bus station. Yes, I'm sure some other hotels offer more in terms of expensive fittings, bathroom requisites etc. but YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. I'm retired and live on a fixed income and this hotel is the best value I can find for my money. If all the rooms are upgraded to a more luxurious standard the price will go up and I wouldn't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Book direct to avoid disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Minerva22
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a 3rd party website and not direct with them so when I turned up at check in I was told that unfortunately due to this, my booking request (I booked a double room) was not guarenteed and I was allocated a triple room with 3 singles beds. Then I was told they were totally booked out so I could not be accommodated in another room. I've never been given a triple single bed room my whole life and I have been in many hotels. The room itself was fine and what you would expect for the reasonable price I paid for this room. For Sydney, it is ok. Buffet breakfast was decent with many different choices, as well as a coffee machine and proper hot chocolate machines which made a lot of little kids happy to go and make for themselves. Overall not terrible, but as this was for business, and I haven't slept in a single bed since I was 15, it was a bit of a let down to be told that there was nothing that could be done.
