Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: b16dnk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at end of holiday before flying home. Good greeting on arrival and staff very helpful with suggestions on restaurants. Room was clean and tidy, having read some of the reviews, I don;t really know what some people expect for the price. It was absolutely fine. Breakfast was fine with good choice of hit and choice of cereals fruit toast etc Location wise, turn left out of the main door and walk up Commonwealth St. At the top turn left and you will come to the Museum Metro Station where you can buy a daily pass for Metro, Buses and Ferries $20 and you can hop on or off as many times as you want. We used the ferry to go to Manley and round from Circular Key to Darling Harbour. If you want to get to Circular Key its just 2 stops away on the Metro. To get down to Darling Harbour just walk on past the metro station for about 15 minutes and you are there. Plenty of restaurants on Liverpool Street. We ate at Mamas (Italian) cheapest wine we had all week and a massive portion of Lasagne. We also ate at Dianthes (Pitt Street) Greek Restaurant - very authentic Greek food and highly recommended. Having only been there for 3 days we hardly scratched the surface of Sydney but what a great city. We did the Bridge Climb and Opera House Tour, both worthwhile but the cost of photos at the Opera House was excessive in my opinion. A great feature of the location of the hotel is the Schwarz brewery accross the road. Go and have a pint of Dr Schwarz you won't be disappointed. All in all very pleased with Travelodge Sydney and would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Small room, poor internet access”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0505
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a Groupon Australia deal. $125 for room, breakfast for 2 ($19 each value), & bottle of wine. (The $125 "deal" turned out to be the standard price for a room.) The room was very small, but adequate, clean, and had all the essentials we needed for an overnight stay. One of our 3 rooms had nonfunctional air conditioning for the night. Breakfast was way overpriced. Mushy eggs, canned fruit, nothing fresh. Internet access was available on 4 computers in the lobby at A$1 for 10 minutes (of time, not use) plus extra $ to print, and all printed pages were defective and not usable. The lobby was crowded, and service was slow. The hotel appeared to be in a questionable neighborhood as well, but we did not know the area. Best thing about this hotel was a small t nearby restaurant: Berta. See my review.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dated. A serious overhaul required.”
Reviews.Author: Danmoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights (without the kids). Booking and check in was efficient. The room was an 80's throw back. Very worn with pieces of laminate peeling and several cracked tiles. Paying for the location which was very convenient. First night people checked in to the room next door at 1.30 am. They slammed the door continually for 90 minutes. The hotel needs to invest in some quiet door closets. Happened again the next night after they has obviously returned from dinner at 11pm. I requested a room change for the remaining two nights and the lovely lady at the service desk happily obliged. The second room had pubic hair on the bathroom floor behind the door. Basic accommodation and overpriced. Did not eat in the restaurant. Could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but NOT if you want to use hotel wifi for internet!”
Reviews.Author: IanWriter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated next to Oxford Street. The rooms are unpretentious but comfortable and clean with small but adequate bathroom, a room safe, flat screen tv, and tiny kitchenette with fridge, microwave, and kettle. But internet access, so important these days to so many travellers, is another story. Before I booked this hotel I noticed from an earlier reviewer that wifi internet access is available only on the more that expensive "executive" upper floors. So, and for this reason only, I booked an executive room that came with an "internet package". The confirmation specified that my room came "with wireless internet access". Well guess what? When I checked in, I was told that the guarantee of "wireless access" was no more than a guarantee that wifi internet would be available -- at an additional price! Yep, for an extra 20 dollars a day you can get a "broadband" wifi connection. Unfortunately this broadband runs at last-century dial-up speeds -- i clocked it several times at a pathetic 0.28 mbps, which is frustratingly slow even for checking email and far to too slow for downloading files of any serious ("executive") size. There's just no excuse for any of this. There is no good reason why wifi should not be available throughout a hotel like this, rather than on a few floors. It's a simple, inexpensive installation -- kids' stuff, actually. There's no reason why a Travelodge in a modern city like Sydney should be unable to provide an internet connection with even a modest speed. And there is just NO excuse for selling a room with an "internet package" that turns out to be no package at all -- just one more sly, misleading attempt to fleece the guest.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Sydney, Location, Area, Environment, Culture.”
Reviews.Author: alok19862003
Reviews.Content: I was the one who stay in hotel a year ago. my stay was pleasant. i was the member of that group. i had inspect everything from reception to housekeeping. the housekeeping staff was awesome and helpful including HSK Manager, Supervisor, and other staff member. Njoyed my stay in hotel. was staying at different floors, rooms were clean and tidy, everyday, they changed my bed sheets, fill up all amenities, bathroom was clean. I personally suggest that hotel should allow free internet/Wi-fi to their customer so it will help to gain more business for them. would like to stay in same in my next trip in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visitors touring around Australia”
Reviews.Author: Whakapirau
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for my friend and me travelling around Australia - I was dreading 'living out of a case' but we had every facility necessary to make our stay in Sydney enjoyable. Our room was comfortable & clean and we could prepare meals if necessary. There were several guest laundries where we could do our washing and use the iron and ironing board in our room so we didn't look like contestants for the 'Miss Creased & Crumpled' competition. The staff, without exception, were helpful & friendly - nothing was too much trouble. The location is also a plus - easy walking distance to most of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no Internet Access”
Reviews.Author: drlowthi
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Sydney on a business trip and booked into the Travelodge as it is in a fantastic location and was really close to work. The hotel was nice and the staff were very friendly. The biggest gripe I had was the fact that they have a VERY outdated TV system that has a grainy picture and poor TV channels. This would have been ok if they had any sort of internet access in the hotel, how can a hotel targeted at businessmen offer no internet access these days. When I called reception to find out if there was any wifi I was told to use the coin operated machines in the lobby. Seriously guys you need to sort this out!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location!”
Reviews.Author: rob1959
Reviews.Content: Location is the key, walking distance to most of the major sights, and if you book early enough can be a bargain ( if there is such a thing in Sydney!). Quality is good for this type of budget hotel, rooms were huge with a little kitchenette area though you dont really need this in such a location. Staff were attentive and helpful. Take a walk to 'pado' (Paddington) district if you want to see some beautiful victorian houses and experience a bohemian culture, by way of a change to the usual iconic sights of Sydney ( but don't miss them all the same!)

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: richiejg
Reviews.Content: Very good budget hotel in a excellent location, 5 min train/bus to harbour/Circular quay (or 20 minutes walk to harbourside). Basic room but you still get microwave/washing up sink/fridge. Very clean, fairly modern and no major complaints. One small point was that the shower was rubbish, lack of water pressure, this might have been the room we were staying in though as the taps were slightly leaking.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Adrian G
Reviews.Content: The best value I could find within walking distance of the downtown core. Room was fairly small but clean and reasonably comfortable. I was disappointed to learn that internet is only available from 14floor and up - four internet connections available in the lobby @ $2 for 20 mins which seems average for this city. Buffet breakfast was average and overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: A simple room, but great location and value. Only a 5 to 10 minute walk to central train station but surprisingly close to attractions like macquarie Street, The National Museum and the restaurants andd shoppign along George Street. It is difficult to find anythign in this location and quality at a similar price. It was perfect for us to save a few dollars but still be walking distance to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryansg
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you want to check out the gay capital of Australia, since Oxford street is a short walk away. Otherwise, the bus stop nearby can bring you to the other attractions such as Circular Quay and Bondi Beach. There are also restaurants and cafes nearby within walking distance. The room was spacious, clean and looked new. It was sufficiently quiet, but the doors slam shut, and can be heard. Inside the room, there's a safe, fridge, kettle, microwave, iron and ironing board. There's also a laundry where you can wash and dry your clothes for $8. Check-in service was friendly and helpful. Downside is that there's no internet access but the neighbouring YWCA hotel has such a service, and there are also plenty of internet cafes in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A place to use as a base”
Reviews.Author: Sid_Fernwilter
Reviews.Content: I was in town on a business trip. This was the first time I had stayed here. It is in a pretty handy location. The room was adequate, clean and tidy. Breakfast was plentiful with a good variety of choices and quite nice tasting! It is ideal for people looking for a place that won't break the budget and is used primarily as a place to sleep after a busy day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Karl w
Reviews.Content: this hotel was clean and tidy food was great and would come back again

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kleintje78
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because I didn't want to stay in a hostel or B&B with shared bathrooms and because the price is great for what you get (room with sofa, kitchenette and bathroom) and the location for me was fine. It's a straight and easy 20 minute walk to the opera house and you're close to loads of shops, cafes and bars and a 2 minute walk to the train station. That said, it's an anonymous, no frills travelodge and if you're looking for a special touch or personalised service you won't find it here, but who cares when you're getting a clean, modern hotel in the middle of the city without having to spend a fortune. I had no problems checking in/out or with any of the staff, who were courteous and efficient. The rooms have very small windows which does make them feel quite dark. And, my room had two single beds and they are very, very thin. If you are not used to sleeping in a true single bed (I kept rolling out!) it's quite uncomfortable. Other than that, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: velazquinho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent, and even though the location is a bit far walking distance from the main attractions, it is better since you get to discover more of this great city. Do not miss to go out and dine at 'Spice I'm', it is just a couple minutes walk and the food will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Unlikely to stay again”
Reviews.Author: MichiMet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights and because we booked through another website and got a cheap rate, the hotel couldn't guarantee the bedding configuration we wanted, so we got a room with 2 single beds. Room is pretty small and the bathroom is TINY. As my friend was going to be staying with us for the last two nights, we asked to move rooms and we were put to a much lower floor, in a room where the air conditioning wasn't working so it was stifling hot and the beds seemed so old it was the kind of room you'd get in a hostel! Extremely bright light comes through the door also which made getting to sleep difficult. They only serve their breakfast until 9.30 which is very early to stop breakfast. However, the Vibe Hotel around the corner does excellent breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Tired; probably would look elsewhere next time.”
Reviews.Author: DoubleAK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here separately on two occasions (we each had business trips). The hotel is a bit tired and faded and the rooms are really dark. They are large in size, but pretty average. Our first trip was just one night, in and out, and it did the trick. Second trip was a bit longer, and was just a dingy, dull, dark room, not a place I'd want to spend much time in. Not bad value for the price, but you can find something a bit better in the same price range in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Velma2
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms, very friendly service, good location, not far to walk ton plenty of cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleasant in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: Self and wife stayed here a few months ago and our only 'complaint' was the very slow checkout. Management's comment was that they were reviewing their processes. On this occasion check was very quick so either they have been successful in this respect or we were there 'at the right time'. We would certainly stay here again - staff were very helpful, rooms clean and tidy and hotel very well located.

Reviews.Title: “loved the room but not all staff”
Reviews.Author: flashgreen5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 weeks, nicely located, loved the room, very spacious and clean and cleaning staff very friendly. Staff at reception were polite but with the exception of one. Think she could do with brushing up on her customer service skills as I believe she is letting the rest of the staff down.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed view of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffrocowboy
Reviews.Content: Overall this is at the value/budget end - think JetStar flight crew stay here, compared with Emirates staff who were at the Hilton Positives for my stay: This hotel is in a great spot, CBD very walkable and Oxford St area is very close. Room clean. Downsides for my stay: No in-room Internet access on lower floors (found this a very bizzare situation). Room size very small (stayed in 504) and odd layout with a long corridor. Colleague on same rate had a bigger room with a small sofa. I had no sofa. Twin beds only available - OK hotel was full first night and I was on an expedia booking. However on check-in was told I would be contacted if a queen-bedded room became available - of course no contact! and hotel was visibly much less busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: fviglion
Reviews.Content: I have been at Travelodge for 4 nights in July, for the last leg of my Australian holidays. The room was large, clean, with a large double bed and a sofa. The location is quite central, 5 minutes from Hyde Park, 15 from the Royal Gardens. To reach the Circular Quay (Harbour Bridge, Opera House) takes a bit longer, but you can catch either the free shuttle bus (route 555, runs from 9AM to 3.30PM during the weekdays, 5PM during the weekends) or the train at the Museum station (5 minutes). The staff has been friendly and helpful all along the stay, and there is a free baggage storage in case you check out in the morning and your flight/train leaves later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: Linzzy128
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice hotel, but not worth the cost. Rude people ruin a stay for me and I felt the staff was not friendly or helpful at all. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: watdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights (stay 4nights pay 3 deal) and found both the hotel and room to very clean and tidy. The front desk staff were attentive and helpful as were the cleaning staff' The room was quite large for a hotel style room with a hugh comfy bed - you almost need a map to find the other side !! Only negative was the bathroom was a bit on the small size especially the shower. If you are looking for a centrally located hotel close to Hyde Park or the CBD with buses & trains close by then give this a try .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: travelenthusiast006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July during Australia's winter. I was nervous at first because I heard that most hotels don't have heat. This hotel did, however, have heat. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. There was no bath, but that didn't matter to me. The staff was very friendly and helped with whatever we asked them. The lobby was classy. Breakfast was delicious- lots of options. No fresh fruit though, only canned fruit. The location was good. A 10 minute bus ride to the Circular Quay. The buildings around the hotel were older and looked cool. The locations felt very safe. All in all, great hotel. Will definitely recommend to friends if they're looking for a hotel in Sydney. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: andrewTaipei
Reviews.Content: The internet quality is very poor but expensive. The hotel even cheats us. They said that they provide internet on their website, but when we got into the hotel, we cannot used internet even we'd like to pay. We then want to move to the floor with internet, yet they said it is not possible. Then, we asked our travel agent's help, she argued with the hotel for us, the hotel turned to say that we can move to the floor with internet but should have to pay almot $20 per day. We then argue this for few days, we finally move to the one with internet without additional charge. However, my partiner checked in the same hotel at the same day, for the same period and paid lower fee than I, but he got the internet at the beginning. In the whole period we stayed, only a person called Amy helped us! I will not live in this hotel again. Other services are ok to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable stay in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: cbead
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be great value for a Sydney CBD hotel. Did get the room on a special deal via Hotelscombined for $105 a night, which for it's location and quality was a great price. Service was efficient, only lacking at check out time where scores of people trying to check out at once. A couple of requests were no trouble for the friendly and efficient staff during the stay. The room was spacious and well appointed. Location was perfect. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: canddsyd
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well positioned to sydneys attractions. Not flash but clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Insisting on being away from the elevators will fall on deaf ears”
Reviews.Author: BellaOlive
Reviews.Content: Currently surrounded by elevators and a plant room in room 1723 so if you are planning on staying here ask to avoid that room, not that it may help. When I did ask to be changed to another room away from elevators I was told it was because I booked online and that they were booked out, which is not the truth, a quick check online @ lastminute.com shows that they are still selling reduced rates rooms. The pay off I guess is that the view is quite good compared to others we have had this week. And the rate is not bad either, $105ish with a $50 deposit. But I would have sacrificed the view for a quiet room and a receptionist that didn't lie to me The room is in need of slight maintenance but it is practical and non fuss. Comfortable bed with no extra blanket which is a bummer as it is currently winter. The heater works though but is noisy. The shower is decent but you may want to bring your own shampoo and conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: DWD347
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel very centrally located for trains and close to many shops and amenities. Would definitely recommend this property. The only thing i we didn't like was there was no TV guide and the walls seemed quite thin. But all in all great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for couples on a budget who want a bit of comfort!”
Reviews.Author: PuffinRTW
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. Location was great for all the top spots in Sydney, just a walk or short train ride away. The most convenient thing was the guest laundry room and location, worst thing was overly expensive wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Georgian
Reviews.Content: Just what we needed. Close to to a train stop and the downtown area in general. Very convenient. Front desk staff was very helpful with any questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: FdScCrew
Reviews.Content: Was a good hotel which was quite near to Central Station, so was good for sightseeing. Thereâ€™s not much to do in the area at night and itâ€™s quite quiet so itâ€™s best to stay in groups as at times we felt slightly unsafe. We booked a twin room which was spacious, clean and had very good facilities including a microwave, kettle and sink. Service was good and you can leave luggage if your room isnâ€™t available. Only downside to the hotel is that is was quite busy with school groups, which were sometimes noisy but overall was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok but walls between rooms are very thin!”
Reviews.Author: traveljane_8
Reviews.Content: Layout of room was ok, bathroom was relatively clean but I did not have a good nights sleep after being woken up and kept awake by people in the room next to me! Staff were helpful and asked them to be quiet, which only lasted about ten mins unfortunately!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie04
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night, last minute~ and the hotel was nice~ room was very spacious and clean~ price very, reasonable~ and the location is not to far from city center~ about 8-10 drive to Sydney Harbour~ I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most uncomfortable bed EVER!”
Reviews.Author: OZZYJT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge on the 29th Aug and was given room 1309, take a note of this room number! you dont want it!. Ive stayed at plenty of Hotels around the world but I have never had a more uncomfortable sleep in my life. Its as though we were sleeping on the bottom half of an ensemble bed, it was hard, no spring what so ever. The pillows were like 2 sheets folded together, I used 3 pillows just to get my head off the mattress. The room was just a room and nothing fancy, the bathroom was a bit sad, I cant remember the last time I saw a shower curtain in a full size shower. We had a stardeal.com voucher, and for $125 it gave us a queen size room, breakfast for 2 and a bottle of wine. The breakfast was very average and the wine, well lets just say it will be good for cooking. The breakfast I think was $14.90 if you purchased it online, save your money and go up to oxford street to get a decent breakfast.. I dont know what was worse, the signs everywhere letting everyone know how to get a good night sleep, third point was to find a good bed! (ironic I know) or when I complained on check out the receptionist knew what i was talking about, because she said 'oh yeah i think I know the room you are talking about'. I bought 2 of the vouchers, and Im now selling one on ebay, sad when a hotel in your home city is so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: hops888
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was very nicely located, less than 10 mins to chinatown, or 5 mins to the World Trade shopping centre for supplies or the sky train. Staff are friendly and helpful. We stayed for 6 nights. Rooms are fairly standard and clean and what you expect from the Travelodge brand. Bathroom was a lovely wet room rather than a bath with a shower curtain. Few tips - try not to use the internet in the hotel lobby its way too expensive, go to the World trade centre in the lower ground floor. also the grocery shops nearby are way too expensive - $6 for a large packet of crisps, again go to the world Trade centre to the chemists there. Also please go to Bill Grangers restaurant for breakfast, its pricey a 10min walk but worth it. We didn't have any food in the restaurant or breakfast, but opposite the hotel there is a warehouse looking building, opposite that is a little cafe that made amazing breakfast as well and not as pricey as Bill Granger's, its hidden out of view and busy with friendly staff so give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: plexiglasshouse
Reviews.Content: RIGHT in the middle of the city. Exceptionally friendly staff. Really really enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: avanti32
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, so close to city, central station, coles for groceries, and most important,shops for shopping. Room, clean, kitchen with microwave and utensils, did miss not having a toaster and can opener,bed comfitable, warm, bathroom roomy, shower good. Reasonably spacious area. Service of room was no problem, staff at reception were helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GladJohn
Reviews.Content: Excellent price for a central Sydney hotel. Our room was small but perfectly formed, and in excellent condition. The staff were extremely helpful, particularly Amy on the front desk. Its not five star, but neither is the price. Has all the basics you need for a one or two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: agentgibbs
Reviews.Content: They seem to have had a refurb since we last stayed here four years ago and we were pleasantly surprised by the rooms. We had wanted a double and a twin,but we got two doubles. The large room had a sofa bed so our son slept on that and our daughter had the bed, and we had the other room. This was fine as it was only one night. One room had a disabled shower room,but the doors were standard size. It is in a convenient location. There are computers in the lobby. Internet is charged but is reasonable. The breakfast was OK but quite expensive. I would recommend this as a base for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “In downtown and good for a budget”
Reviews.Author: sswagner
Reviews.Content: I purchased 4 nights in the Travelodge well ahead of time in order to lock in the exchange rate with the American dollar. Arrival to the hotel was via the train from Sydney Airport to Museum Station. From there, it was a short walk on the edge of Hyde Park to the hotel. There was a room to leave my bag while I explored the city on the first day. Upon return to the hotel in early evening, I received the key for the 15th floor. There are several elevators to bring guests up to the room. These elevators also require the room key in order to access your floor. The only real problem I had during my stay was that they key sometimes did not swipe right in the elevator. This could be a problem if another guest on a different floor gets your elevator, because it will skip your floor or take you back down if someone from a lower floor calls for the elevator. The room itself was clean and quiet at night, which is helpful with that jet lag. Environmental controls were good, and there was a refrigerator and microwave in the room as well. There was nothing fancy to the hotel, and the breakfast is expensive, however it does have a good location in the city. Transportation options around the hotel are good, and the front desk was helpful with information. Computers were available in the lobby, however there was a charge to use them. They accepted credit cards or coins. Overall, it was a decent stay. I could easily recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “For those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: JuliaP_79
Reviews.Content: Stop 4 on my round the world trip. If you plan on spending lots of time in the hotel I wouldn't recommend, but to use as a base it was fine. The 'extras' were very expensive (such as minibar and wifi) but there are 2 supermarkets and a bottle shop round the corner. Location was good, in the central business district. They also had a thing called moving menus which we used. It was an ordering service for takeaway food from various restaurants in Sydney. There was a microwave in the room and a coin op laundry on one of the floors. Breakfast was also an extra. Despite being a bit pricey it was very nice if you like an English / Aussie cooked breakfast. I would avoid the airport shuttle. It's cheap for a reason. Run down minibus crammed full of people and suitcases. Took hotel advice on timing, and nearly missed my flight due to neverending number of stops along the way. Overall recommended if you want somewehere cheap clean and central to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Barneys040
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in July. Was on the 10th floor, but the room was a fair walk from the lift. The room was well appointed. Great shower pressure for water. The location of the hotel was great. Could walk to Oxford st & to the CBD. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone on a budget who is not expecting all the "Bells & Whistles". We paid $105 for the night on wotif which is extremely great value

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Emme76
Reviews.Content: We were under the impression that we would get a twin bed room, instead we had a queen bed and a couch. The couch was awful and caused back pain. I had to put the mattress on the floor in order to get some sleep. The room was not properly cleaned and the management was somewhat rude, when we complained. We also found a cockroach. On the bright side, the shower was really good. Overall, very disappointing and not a hotel I would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back.................”
Reviews.Author: QLDtraveller0
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in one of your suites for 7 weeks and I can speak with confidence when I say the room was very clean and comfortable. My original stay was for 3 weeks but had to extend it and the staff were always very helpfull and polite. As for the room staff, nothing was too much trouble for them. I would definately recommend the Travelodge to my friends and family. Thankyou for a most enjoyable stay..........Laraine P....QLD.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...Single Beds and an Ice Machine but no Bucket to Carry Ice”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Kenobi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay. The location is a bit far from the action, but the price was lower, so we got what we paid for. The service wasn't great. The ice machine had no containers to carry the ice, and when we asked the front desk about it, they acted like we were nuts. Breakfast was $18 each, so we skipped it. The room was clean, and the hotel was quiet. Good security. Oddly, they gave my husband and I a room with 2 twin beds. Apparently, your bed request is based on availability upon check-in. Hmm. Sure, we're silly yanks who like ice and sleeping in the same beds with our spouses, but it was odd to have the machine but nothing to carry it in and not reserve a room for a married couple. These weren't exactly problems, just little annoyances. Really, it was good enough, but quite forgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good breakfast, friendly and helpful receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: Bretcheng
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via my tour agency and I must say, it's a nice place to stay. Room is big, clean & comfy. The front desk is friendly and courteous. It's about 10-15 min walk to Chinatown, so it's not recommended for the elderly. Wifi is not available on certain levels too. That's just about my only gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: skishlee
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for four nights in mid-June while visiting Sydney for the State of Origin. I recommend booking on a Tuesday though the Travelodge website - if you select their "Chooseday" special you pick a free gift such as late check-out. We chose the 2 for 1 breakfast. Breakfast is $18 per person for an all-you-can-eat-buffet. I certainly wouldn't have had breakfast there if it wasn't for the special deal as there are plenty of great cafes to have breakfast at around Sydney, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. Our room was clean although I was disappointed that they continued to replace the towels despite us hanging them up as instructed by the hotel if you want to 'help the environment'. The only issue we had staying was the noisy neighbours who were arguing at 1am in the morning but there was nothing the hotel could have done to prevent that. The beds could have been softer too but we managed to get decent sleeps. Although not centrally located the hotel is close to the Museum train station and World Square monorail station. These two transportation options make it very easy (and cheap) to travel around the city and surrounding suburbs. You'll also find a pub across the road, as well as a mini-mart. The Pitt St Mall is a short walk away and includes small shops and a Coles. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetNZ7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during January. My partner and I had a standard room and to tell you the truth we were more than happy with it. The room was clean, bed comfy and bathroom more than adequate. The kitchenette had a fridge, toaster and kettle and every utensil you could need (have been stuck without can openers in other hotels!!). The room was cleaned daily and always to a high standard. In terms of location it was quite good. It was minutes away from Hyde Park and maybe a 30 minute walk to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour (always more fun on the way there than back!). The girls at the desk gave us a map and easy to follow directions to World Square where there is a supermarket. We also checked in a couple of hours early, and while our room wasn't ready, we were able to store our luggage for free. My only two gripes with the place have to do with pre-payment and checking out. When we checked in we were told that we had to pre-pay for our room. This was news to us (it wasn't on the Ts and Cs of our booking sheet) and really inconvenient as one of us were being paid later on during the week and counted on using that money to pay. The girl at reception told us we could use our Visa debit card and that would hold the money but not take it out. She shouldn't really be dishing out banking advice as she was wrong - the full amount (plus a credit card surcharge fee) was taken out and could have potentially left us in the lurch! If a place requires pre-payment they should really advertise it! The second gripe involves checking out - this took far too long. Considering their policy of pre-payment I can't really understand why the two/three girls on the front desk were taking so long! We nearly missed our airport shuttle! All in all it was a clean place in a good location! I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best budget accommodation in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: NasiG
Reviews.Content: Location: central to everything. Room price: great specials, excellent prices. Room: always clean, comfortable, spacious and quiet. Shower hot. Only 1 small complaint on recent stay, there was a very bad smell in the room on arrival. Not sure what it was but it did disappear after a day or so. Weird. Staff: always helpful and friendly. Breakfast: very good buffet selection however I would love to see grilled tomatoes and even sauteed mushrooms added to the selection. :) Please!!! :) I've stayed at Travelodge Sydney numerous times over the past 6 years and it never disappoints. There are so many wonderful restaurants, bars and cafe's only a few minutes away, you couldnt ask for a better location. My only suggestion for improvement would be to add a shower facility for use by those guests checking out in the morning and flying out at night. Just to freshen up and change clothes before going to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base for a Sydney Shopping Trip”
Reviews.Author: Leannebb
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I had a long girls weekend at Easter, and stayed at the Travelodge.It is very central and close to Paddys Market and China Town.There was no restaurant in the hotel.Buffet breakfast was available, but on check in they did not advise us if you prepay all your breakfasts you get a discount.We did manage to get the discount after overhearing someones else's conversation.We stayed 4 night and the room was well set up for 2 people. We caught taxis to get around and it was cheap to get into the city centre. As there was no restaurant in the hotel , we walked around the corner to the Crown Hotel which provided excellent bistro meals, pub and a gaming room.

Reviews.Title: “Average, Location not the best. Relocated”
Reviews.Author: doogiehowser_md
Reviews.Content: First time to Sydney, wasn't much to walk to in the location of the hotel. Room was average. Hotel seemed budget as. All this combined made us relocate to the Stamford in Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not nasty”
Reviews.Author: YunziesTravels
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge plies its trade in a scruffy part of town (by Sydney standards) but don't let that put you off. After nine days' backpacking I slung myself into a double room (No1532) with en-suite, TV, spot lighting and even a piece of modern art for good measure. True, that might not ring alarm bells at the Dorchester, but at $173 for two nights it was the best value accommodation on my whole trip. The room was quiet, warm and compared to other, more spartan hotels in this chain there were nice touches like a women's mag (for the latest on celebrity weight loss) and a small carton of milk in the fridge. Hardly Moet Chandon and lobster I know but after roughing it at hostels I acted like I had just been traversing the Sahara. The location is excellent - you'll be in town, or wading through garish iPod covers at Paddy's Markets, after a 10 minute walk. After checking out I threw my backpack in the luggage room at no extra charge for a spot of sight-seeing before my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff! Internet TOO EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: doglaw
Reviews.Content: The location and proximity to 2 subway lines was excellent. I could wander around CBD and the Rocks no problem. The room was great for me, with tv, table, couch, fridge and microwave. It was also very clean and safe. The breakfast was good but could be a tad cheaper. The Internet is astronomically priced, however. I would stay there again, no problem, but would keep food in the room and suss out better Internet connectivity. The staff were brilliant, all of them! .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Tifster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights in May 2011. Hotel is a couple of blocks south of Hyde Park in a relatively quieter area. Restaurants are a few blocks away and so is the metro station. We walked everywhere and while this hotel is not directly in the middle of all the tourist attractions, it's near enough and a good value for the money. We were able to check in early, so that was really nice. Our en suite room had 3 twin beds, a tv, tea and coffee facilities, a small fridge, a small sink (in addition to bathroom sink), and a microwave. It was exactly what we were looking for in our price range, around or under $100. There are two grocery stores nearby. There's also the Cook & Phillips public swimming pool nearby too; the 50m lap pool was great and it costs a little over $6 to get in. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't mind being a few blocks from the action and is looking for a fridge and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, not best location, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: ItzEddie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival into Sydney, very early in the morning we made a rather long journey to the Travelodge. We arrived about 8am, prior to our arrival we were advised they would endeavor to provide an early check-in, in hindsight this was an absolute load of rubbish as it did not even nearly occur as we checked in AFTER the scheduled check-in time. That was a whole 8 hours after arriving in Sydney before we could even freshen up and begin to enjoy our holiday in Sydney. The only advantage to this hotel in our whole 9 night stay was that we could leave our luggage there for 8 hours whilst we waited for our room. Upon finally getting access to our room we were disappointed. Obviously we had paid on the budget for an average room however I would say this room did not even meet the standard and it was poorly located right next to the elevators so whenever an elevator moved you could hear it, let alone the people! The kettle at its highest was terrible, the TV was average, there was no DVD Player so we decided to buy our own! The bathroom was neat but not really clean as we found hairs in the shower. Following on from this we went out for dinner as the hotel has a "restaurant" however it is only used for a ridiculously expensive buffet breakfast. We found returning to the hotel to be a very daunting task and is actually a nerve wracking experience as it appears to be down a dark alley. All in all our trip to Sydney was an amazing holiday, but this hotel in our opinion was absolutely shocking, cheap, but shocking.

Reviews.Title: “misleading advertising re restaurant facilities.”
Reviews.Author: 37seddon
Reviews.Content: Brochure states ".....restaurant and bar" Breakfast manager said there had been no restaurant for some years. For the bar I believe I had to ask for alcohol at reception. I did not bother.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: trickster9
Reviews.Content: Travelodge, so you know what to expect. Perfectly adequate for a city break. No problems. They gave us a room on the lowest florr as requested. Hotel is in a good location just south of Hyde Park. You can get the free 555 bus up to circular quay or walk it in 30-40 mins. Didn't use the breakfast facility. Bought stuff from Coles, World Square and had breakfast in room. There is a mini kitchen with micro wave. Paid $115 pn as we booked 5 nights. Satisfied all round.

Reviews.Title: “Typical travelodge, friendly staff, nice rooms, good price.”
Reviews.Author: jackinbox99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights earlier in the month. Price came in good, cheaper than other hotels which werre nearer to the bridge / centre. Its just a short walk from museem station and about 5mins walk from china town. Coles supermarket not far away and local corner shops. The hotel was nice and clean, we asked for a queen bed and got one. The room has small kitchen area which we made full use off. Bed was nice and big, big shower room (no bath). Staff were very polite and hotel was in good condition. All in all cant complain, nice comfortable place. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Biffster149
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel and coming from england was great due to location is soon found my way around again as most attraction are within 30 mins walk. Reception staff very helpful and happy, the rooms are ok alittle on the small side and small bathrooms to but as we only slept there they did the job. I would not hesitate to stay there on my next trip to australia and intrestinly the taxi driver from airport did not no were travelodge wentworth was how strange

Reviews.Title: “good value if you bring your own pillows”
Reviews.Author: peacex
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights in a triple room yet paid for 7 nights (i stayed in blue mountains for a night). indeed good value for 155per night. however, travelodge insisted that I would have to book 7 consecutive nights for that rate. service was ok but the receptionist couldn't even give us good directions to the sydney fish market (she only knew directions for the light rail/monorail, but we've got the multi3 pass and wanted to take the bus instead - in the end we took 501 from cnr of campbell & george st which required the last walking distance, took about 25mins). service would have been better if they would replace the tissuebox when it is running low. microwave with utensils were provided but having only a microwave is pretty much insufficient to cook a meal. we used it once to heat up some bread. the room was sufficient and relatively clean. the bed was ok and there were 2 pillows. 1 pillow was very high and hard while the other was extremely flat & thin... after 2 nights i had a bad stiff neck and till today it still hurts. i would suggest either bringing your pillow/cushion. the toilet was small but sufficient and clean. location wise it is pretty good. there is a coles 3 streets away (12mins walk) along goldburn in between pitt street and liverpool street. the musuem stop is just 1 street behind (5mins walk away) where you can get a train to circular quay (2 stops) or a bus from the bus stop outside the museum stop to bondi beach, paddington market, oxford street area (bus 380). if there is a need to walk to central, it is about a 15mins walk. another 15mins walk to chinatown & paddy's market.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better hostels!”
Reviews.Author: bunnybrisbane
Reviews.Content: For $140 I am not expecting 5 star luxury, but I am expecting clean accommodation. Basic does not bother me for a one nighter. But I cant tolerate dirty. And I can honestly say I have stayed in cleaner/nicer hostels. The room smelled of copper I dont know why. There was a layer of dust on every surface like it hadn't been wiped down in weeks. Also there was a loud noise that we could not figure out where it came from but was very annoying and we found it difficult to sleep. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value and more...”
Reviews.Author: lily0526
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Travelodge Darwin which is good place and value but not much in the aesthetic value. I wasn't expecting much with Travelodge Sydney but thought it would at least be dependable,clean and pleasant. I was surprised it is really good considering the good price I paid for it. You get more discount for staying 3 nights. The room was always clean, well kept and fairly modern with a good window view not usually seen lately in modern hotels. Service was good and prompt and I was given king sized bed even when listed as queen sized for the room I booked. Overall it offers really more for less, highly recommended. Added bonus was it is right in the same bldg as the Phil Consulate Office which was part of my trip's agenda so everything works out perfectly and it is ideally situated as walking distance to most of the city's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I remembered”
Reviews.Author: NickJDalton
Reviews.Content: I generally stay at Travelodge (mostly for the price), however, over time the rates have increased but the service hasn't. During renovations the couch has been removed room the bedrooms, which is disappointing. The aircon in the room wasn't fantastic (on a hot day it didn't provide much cool air). The hotel is in a fantastic location for Oxford St. There are a lot of tourist groups that use this hotel, making it almost impossible to check in when there are another 40+ people trying to do the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Stay - Amor's say Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: Jude1163
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Travelodge Sydney 2 nights. Booked two separate rooms, one for us and one for our 2 teenagers. Good move. Lucky enough to have scored the $99 per night per room deal on the Choosedays promotion. Great value. Couldnt fault the room and pleased that we got a normal room, plenty for 2 people. Bed was king (great) and quite a firm bed. Location was excellent (Taxi from Keith Urban at Entertainment Centre $7 - bargain) and within walking distance to shopping, Chinatown, Entertainment Centre etc. Bathrooms clean with decent shower pressure, and rooms included kitchenette (microwave, jug, sink etc - no toaster though) so if you wanted self catering would be bonus. No onsite parking but available a few minutes walk away at $22 per 24hours. Breakfast was pretty standard motel type at $18 each. Great pub a few minutes walk from motel on Goulburn Street (Cnr Goulburn and Pitt Sts) called Maloneys which had fantastic pub meals, suitable for families and lots of variety. Upon checking in on the afternoon of Thursday 14th April, I spoke to the Manager about the fact that parking was offsite parking (which I wasnt aware of) and she handled my questions in a highly professional manner. Her level of customer service was excellent. Although not really a huge fan of Travelodge motels in the past, would definitely return to this Travelodge as the motel is very quiet and even though you are in the City, is doesnt have the constant traffic noise of more expenisve motels closer to central. Would definitely recommend if looking for a good, standard, clean motel at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a convenient location and comfy room”
Reviews.Author: zodora
Reviews.Content: It was located just a short walk to Museum Train station and is also very walkable to anywhere.... Darling Harbour/Chinatown. Rooms are spacious and it certainly helps when it is equipped with a washing basin, utensils and a microwave as dining in Sydney is often over-priced. Staff are friendly and ever helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: thedoormouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge for one night on Thursday March 31st and we thought the room rate of $99 was really good value (by booking directly online with the Travelodge you can save $â€™s) Our special room rate also came with a couple of extra options to choose from; either a late checkout or a 2 for 1 breakfast. We opted for the breakfast deal which turned out to be a wise choice as the cost person is $18! While the buffet breakfast does offer a good variety, we felt it was a little overpriced. We were on the 13th floor and had a spacious, clean room with a comfy queen size bed and nice table with a couple of chairs. The room had a small kitchenette area with a sink, coffee/tea making facilities, microwave etc. The room also had an iron & ironing board, a good size TV and a safe. The bathroom while small was adequate and we were content. Soap, shampoo & conditioner were supplied as was a hairdryer. We had a lovely view of the city from our window and of course the hotel is situated in a great location. On arrival we walked from the train station to the Travelodge and on checking out, we hailed down a taxi from out the front in an instant. Overall we were impressed and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to being highly recommended, but two flaws.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: By and large I was very pleased with my stay here, EXCEPT for two things: Internet Service and the service they recommend for getting to the airport. While the latter is a minor annoyance, the former was a real problem. The internet service was beyond slow at times, to the point it was impossible to even read e-mail effectively. As for the service to the airport, they said it should only take 45 minutes to an hour, but it took over that. In both cases, the management should look to change with whom they operate. Having laid out the negatives, almost all other aspects of the stay were great. They are in a great location, close to the park so one can run in the morning, as well as downtown, the water, the theater, Chinatown, etc. The rooms were quite large by Sydney standards, and had facilities to keep fed (fridge, microwave, plates, etc.). Breakfast was quite reasonable with something for most anyone, though did not vary. The staff was great.. cheerful and helpful. (At times, however, they were understaffed for checking folks in/out during rush periods.) If they could fix the internet issue, that would easily have bumped them up to a four ro even higher since I suspect it is hard to beat the hotel when staying in Sydney for the price, what is in the rooms, and the room size. I could easily have stayed there with my family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: EasyTravel365
Reviews.Content: I reviewed a dozen or more Sydney hotels looking for best value and even sought the help of a travel agent in Australia. In the end I turned down the agent's recommendation for Sydney (after reading TripAdvisor reviews) and booked my own 4-night stay at Travelodge on Wentworth. I booked on a Tuesday and got 2 for 1 breakfasts included with the discounted price of $99 a night (down from $139 or 149). Some people staying there at the same time were paying $189 because they didn't book on line, on Tuesday. Our room was 504 ...corner of building with view of intersection and across rooftops -- much better than other sides of the hotel where our view would be the sides of other buildings. The location was very convenient, next to Chinatown and near connections for monorail, bus, and subway. There is more than one Travelodge in Sydney, so make sure you're looking at the one on Wentworth. Costs in Sydney are pretty high compared to USA prices -- Breakfasts are typically $18 - $25, and a lunch of hamburger and chips with drink can cost you $25 or more. The mircowave and mini-kitchen at Travelodge can cut your dining costs considerably. Transportation: Even though there are a lot of recommendations to buy the MyMultiPass tickets that give you travel on subway, bus, and ferry, we came out ahead by buying individual tickets as needed. By the way, the monorail is not part of the MultiPass package since monorail is privately owned. Here are the transportation prices we found in Mar 2011: 1. Monorail - $4.50 per person one way or $9.50 all day use - check the map you can get at your hotel or at the monorail station for the location of stops on this limited circular route. 2. Train - from the central train station to Blue Mountains (Katumba) we paid $11.50 round trip. In Katumba we walked to Echo Point to view the gorge and 3-sisters and caught the local trolly back to the train station in town for 2 bucks per person. So, we saved a lot of money compared to what the bus companies charge for this trip from Sydney to Blue Mountains ... compare our total of $13.50 each to the tour company prices. All of this was very easy and knowledgable people guided us along the way -- hotel desk, train station ticket agent, people on the train and train platform, and folks in Katumba. Risk was insignificant with the frequency of the train, etc. 3. Ferry - Trip to Manly Beach was only $13 each (approx). Even if you're not interested in the beach itself, you'll find the trip to the quaint beach town and the ferry ride worthwhile. 4. Airport Shuttle - $14 each from hotel -- probably can save a little by booking on line (maybe get price of $12). The train might be less but then you have to deal with dragging your luggage aboard and then getting from the train terminal to your flight terminal. If you're using the shuttle from airport to your hotel, be sure you ask inside the air terminal where to meet the shuttle. Ask two or more people to make sure you have it right. I only asked once and wound up waiting in the wrong place for over 30 minutes while the shuttle driver was looking for me at the blue wall named "The Meeting Place." 5. Taxi - The taxi from the dock where cruise lines arrive to Travelodge was $15 - well worth it to avoid dragging the bags onto the bus and then a couple blocks to the hotel. Just ask the guys managing bus traffic where to grab the cab. 6. Free Bus - There's a free bus that circles downtown Sydney. Frequency can vary, but you get to see a lot of local culture while waiting. Just find the bus stop signs that show 555 and watch for the green color city busses. No ticket required - just get on and ride. Board at front door only and exit either by front or side door. 7. The MultiPass tickets were $20-46, depending on the level of access ... so do the math. What to see ... 1. Aquarium - nice aquarium, pretty much the same as you'll find in most major aquariums around the world 2. Wild Life - Next to aquarium on harbor - Fair ... does include kangaroos and kuala up close 3. Maritime Museum ... very nice museum -- free with extra fee if you want to tour the ships 4. Paddy's Market - good Sydney experience, no entrance fee 5. Blue Mountains - nice train ride to Katumba, nice view of the mountains - similar to what you'll find in the USA Blue Ridge Mountains and Appalachian Mountains 6. Ferry Port ... be sure to allow time to see the street performers around the harbor where the ferries come in ... catch the 555 bus to and from the port 7. Victoria Station - central shopping area, very nice up scale mall in CBD ... ride the 555

Reviews.Title: “Value-for-money, friendly service, totally enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: msb00ty
Reviews.Content: This is a value-for-money with friendly service. My boyfriend and I stayed for a week. The room was spacious enough, with a self serviced kitchenette. I was especially impressed with the service of the staff when we had them check out the TV that was not working too well, almost on a daily basis. I thought the breakfast was a tad expensive at A$18 per head. The floor we were at had a washer & dryer, vending machine and ice machine, it was very good. The hotel was centrally located and we walked everywhere. It was a huge plus especially if you want to explore the city sights. Best: Location, Price and Service. Lest: breakfast too expensive. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and I will definitely stay here next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: KatyerFin
Reviews.Content: I would like to give this hotel better reviews but I was very dissapointed with the service. First of all I tried to look for a reasonable hotel with great location, breakfast and free wi-fi. From their home page I understood that breakfast was included and that they had internet in the lobby. I booked and enquired about the breakfast and they told us that breakfast was included. When we went for the breakfast, the lady there told us that one coupon is for 1 so we had only two coupons which meant that our room included only 1 free breakfast even though I booked it for two. They didn't tell us this in the reception so I was quite baffled. We only got the coupons as we checked in and they didn't even ask if we would like to buy breakfast for the other person. I have never been in a hotel which would offer free breakfast for only one person, when there is two staying. So we had one breakfast for two and the second morning we ate somewhere else. Also we learned that they had internet but it was chargeable and only in the lobby. We asked from the reception if they could tell us if there is a cafe which would have free wi-fi so that we could use our own laptop. They told us to go to a cafe nearby and we went there but they didn't have wi-fi and never even had one. They told us that there were plenty of places where you could use free wi-fi like around the Circular Quay. Other thing that bothered me was that when we checked in after an early flight they didn't take our phone number to give us a call if/when a room would have been ready. I mean we were quite tired after a long flight so I would have appreciated it a lot if they would have given us a bit of consideration and shown us that they are doing their best. I do understand if there is not any availability in the morning but little consideration would be nice when you have to wait for a room from 7 am till 2 pm. When cheking out we asked if they could call us a cab and they told us to go outside and wave. I was pretty surprised they didn't do that for us as they do it in many other hotels but luckily we didn't have to wait for long as it was early in the morning so there wasn't hardly any traffic and the cab seemed to be mostly free. First it just seemed a bit desperate. Otherwise the location was great, in walking distance to many attractions. During our stay there was also a free bus connection around the centre so that was very convenient. Our room was clean and big with small kitchenette and it was also quiet, couldn't hear any noises from the streets nor from the corridors. Breakfast was basic but filling.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, worth the price comparing to other CBD hotels”
Reviews.Author: PavelK2
Reviews.Content: What's nice: Located on the edge of the CBD, yet very close to Chinatown (5-7 min walk), Pitt St shopping (10 min walk) and Oxford St nightlife (3 min). Darling Harbour is a 15-20 min walk. Busy hotel, but helpful reception, self-service laundry facilities on-site, Central station proximity, Museum Station is two minutes walk and and is a direct link to the airport. What's not so so nice: Parking is very expensive, AU $22 per day. Room's window does not open. Door is not sound-proof, you here people returning from nightclubs at 4 am as if you were sleeping in the hall. Resume. Good value for money, as we've researched the CBD hotels a lot before the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Sydney nothing like UK Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: CCornfield
Reviews.Content: I expected this to be like a UK Travelodge but its much more like a good quality hotel. The room was large and well appointed with a small kitchenette with a microwave and a fridge ideal for keeping drinks cool. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom large with a great shower. The place was spotlessly clean. There is a complimentary in room safe. The hotel looks fairly new and as such is quite modern and not dated at all. The location is ideal for sightseeing. The harbour bridge and opera house are a short walk away through the city maybe 15mins through the center of town. Darling Harbour is around a 10 min walk past Chinatown which is maybe 4 mins away. The hotel sits right behind Hyde Park and very near Museam underground station, which is also the main bus route. Get on here for the bus to Bondi Beach which is maybe 25mins on the bus but worth seeing. There are plenty of places close by to eat but we walked to Darling Harbour each night of our stay and ate there, great restaurants and jumped in a Taxi to get back, cant remember the cost but not too expensive. Plenty to see and do in Sydney. If you want a clean, reasonably priced, well located place to sleep then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - handy location”
Reviews.Author: Nelly-Laur
Reviews.Content: I travelled recently to Sydney with my mother and we stayed in a twin room on the 4th floor for 3 nights. We arrived on the Saturday and had an earlyish night due to having a long day of travelling. We were woken by drunk people going into their rooms from the lifts through the night which was annoying but only had this problem on the Saturday night. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean, it wasn't a 5 star room but had everything we needed. The staff at the front counter are friendly and helpful and on the day of our checkout had no problem storing our bags in the safe room for a few hours. Another little issue we found were the lifts, you have to swipe your card before it will let you press your room button and the card swipe and lifts were very sensitive so sometimes it took some time before reaching the correct floor. Other than that I would definitly reccommend this place to stay as the location is also ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: CymroDyserth
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Wentworth is located adjacent to Hyde Park so access into the centre of Sydney is not a problem. Rooms are a decent size, especially if you have a corner room at the end of the corridors. Although rooms only have a microwave, kettle and fridge, it is possible to self cater and avoid the high cost of eating out in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: GraterDunedin
Reviews.Content: As other recent reviewers have commented this property is in a great location - short easy walking distance to the city, Hyde Park, China Town, Darling Harbour, the main attractions of the city and of course all the restaurants, pubs, clubs and shopping action on Oxford Street. Our room was clean, simply furnished with a comfy bed and a nice view out over Wentworth Avenue. The staff were always friendly and checking in and out was a breeze. We didn't use the restaurant for breakfast as there are so many great cafes near by - try Two Good Eggs on the corner of Goulburn and Brisbane Streets - great value for money, good coffee and great food. The rooms were also very quiet-- despite the barricades at the entrance going up for Mardi Gras weekend and the expected throng of people all night long after the parade our room was very quiet. Highly recommended for a value hotel in the heart of Sydney. We would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: IzzzyHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here - the breakfast was great although we just had it on the first morning. The location was perfect - in the middle of everything and allowed for easy access to the major sites and areas of sydney. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were very pleasant. I would say that the rooms were the same as a 4 star room - they were clean and had everything you needed for a very comfortable stay. The bathrooms were reasonably new and very clean as well. I would recommend people sty here.

Reviews.Title: “More than I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: BenandJo
Reviews.Content: After reasing reviews I was a bit worried and we arrived expecting very little. The hotel was very clean. The staff very very helpful. The rooms were modern and spotless. The location was excellent. This hotel is a budget hotel but with very good standards.

Reviews.Title: “For a 3 night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hird1
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Had to change room as water flooded from the shower out of the bathroom. Room change ok. Did not eat in the hotel as we found the breakfast expensive. Good location for exploring on foot. Would stay again depending on price!

Reviews.Title: “OZ-KIWI adventure”
Reviews.Author: pascalpierre
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge on Wentworth for 9 days. Great location and decent price. I got a very good deal on expedia.com for under $400.00! The hotel is spotless and very roomy. The kitchnette is basic but functional. The only drawback is the laundry. The washers do not wash clean... find another laundry instead. Anyway, I booked again from May 1st thru 7th..... Hope I won't be disappointed....I am looking froward to it because the plafe is really central, minutes away from Oxford Street and Central station. Go for it but look for specials on ZUJI.COM or EXPEDIA.COM...

Reviews.Title: “Smoky room smells spoilt our stay”
Reviews.Author: raindrop71
Reviews.Content: On the whole I thought this hotel was very good value for money for a 3 star hotel and suited our budget for a family of 4 requiring 2 rooms for 2 nights in Sydney. It is close to the CBD and Hyde Park and most of the facilities were good. However we rented interconnecting rooms and the room my teenage daughters were given should never have been rented out as it smelt so badly of smoke. The room had obviously been rented out to "professional smokers" as the smoke detector had been covered. Our room was ready at 1pm and as we had been up all night with flights we were very grateful to get into a room but the second room wasn't ready and when we went in at 2pm the odour removing machine was still on but quickly removed by staff as we arrived. I complained about the smell at Reception and they arranged for the machine to be placed in the room during the evening whilst we were out. The smell was quite bad the next day so again mentioned it at Reception and they said the odouriser would be placed in the room whilst my daughters were out. (not sure if this happened or not). I felt we were penalized as we are non-smokers and having to put up with someone's blatant lack of understanding of the hotel rules regarding smoking in rooms. I felt that the smell would improve but it didn't over the two days and in future I would refuse a room with this type of smell. Staff provided good customer service in a very busy work environment which seemed to have its fair share of annoying problems with room/lift cards not activating and the interconnecting door lock not working after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “great place in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Dacrow1970
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here back in May 2010 and we got a room with two twin beds. The hotel is clean and in the perfect place for us. We walked almost everywhere. It is really close to oxford street and all the good food and nightlife in the gay section of town. He walked to Darling harbour and Chinatown almost nightly. We bought a week subway pass and may have used it twice. The staff was very friendly and gave excellent advice. It rained all 9 nights we were there but we only slept there. It was a blast. I would definately recommend this hotel for anyone. It is centrally located, lots of great shopping . My only complaint was beds were overly firm.

Reviews.Title: “Fringe Area, Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SHVA
Reviews.Content: Understand the reviews that talk about switching rooms upon arrival. Same thing happened to us on check-in. Staff at the front desk apparently has to deal with the situation so often that they have a set patter to deal with guests. We did not get the room we booked and they claimed we had a request, no guarantee of room type. Decidedly unfriendly staff at check in and when asking directions. They spout patter, rather than listening to the question asked. That said, the room was OK; microwave, mini fridge, cutlery and crockery. At least the beds were firm. Bathroom was generally clean, but could benefit from a floor scrub. Previous guests trash still on the floor after two days. Neighborhood is OK if you walk toward the Museum stop, but if you take a wrong turn you end up in a less than desirable neighborhood. Expensive for what you get. Wonâ€™t be back.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more..”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel7519
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Travelodge hotel. On arrival, I was informed that I have been assigned a triple room with 3 single beds due to late reservation (which would not have been a problem except that my big physique does not tend to fit in a single bed). The problem was airconditioning system in the room which was making noise and I could not sleep properly. I did not complain either as I was alread\y informed that this was a late reservation. I had very busy next day and had to endure somehow through the day before I took flight back to Melbourne. May be it is that Sydney is a very costly place or my expectations from a reputed hotel chain were a bit high, I did not find experience very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: OscarChristchurch
Reviews.Content: Staff at reception pleasant, helpful and cooperative at check in and throughout our stay. Room comfortable and adequate for our needs. A pleasant surprise considering some of the negative reviews on here about this establishment. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value and what more could you want”
Reviews.Author: longhornkiwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok; it is close to the Museum Station (Liverpool south exit) but only open on weekdays, close to Hyde Park. It is a good location handy to everything you would need At certain times in the morning though it can be a little noisy. Rooms are small and contain a microwave and fridge. Didnâ€™t try the breakfast so cannot say.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother staying”
Reviews.Author: Debnrah
Reviews.Content: We arrived from a very long flight, and had booked our room months earlier, only to be told when we were checking in that our room had been DOWNgraded due to a Bonjovi concert. We got a pretty small shabby room with 2 single beds! The TV didnt work and no one turned up to fix it when we rang front reception. Staff were pretty stressed and not that friendly. When we challenged why are room was being changed at check in and why we hadnt been advised earlier, and we were basically told, that the hotel had the right to be able to change our room to accommodate reservations made on the day. We are both good income earners and over 50, we expect to be treated a bit better than that. We wont be staying again. It is a fair walk to the nearest station and a bit of a hill too.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila-Bob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in January 2011. The hotel is well-located just south of Hyde Park. The room was compact, clean and comfy and surprisingly quiet seeing as we were next to the lift. There is a fridge, microwave, kettle (teabags, coffee, sugar and milk supplied), sink/drainer, iron and ironing board. Wardrobe space is small. The bathroom is spotless with everything that is needed. No wi-fi but if you have a dongle you will cope. We didn't need frills and were happy with the price. We didn't opt for the breakfast or use the internet so can't comment on those. Oxford Street is round the corner and there is a supermarket plus a number of restaurants (we ate at Raquel's - a superb Spanish restaurant - dinner only). Look at the different sites (laterooms, lastminute, wotif) for the best deals as these vary.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Dawn2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge,Sydney from 31st Dec 2010 to 8th Jan 2011,the main purpose of our stay in Sydney during our trip was to see the New Years Eve fireworks and watch the 5th Ashes Test at the SCG. Both of which were fantastic !!. At first we thought that the hotel was a bit out of the way,but soon found that shops/bars/restaurants were all within a couple of mins walking distance and the fact that the local bars/restaurants are not right in the centre actually makes the prices alot more reasonable. The hotel is basic with nice sized rooms which are clean with good size bathroom and kitchenette area,no balconies and the windows don't open which means no fresh air in the rooms,but the AC worked fine.We used the rooms to sleep in,so they were totally adequate for our needs.Internet near reception costs $2 for 10 mins.We didnt't use the restaurant,breakfast was $18 per person. 5 min walk to Hyde Park and 15 min walk to Darling Harbour.This hotel was great four our needs,would we use again,Yes,if the price was right.The only real downfall was that there is no pool,which not many of the Sydney hotels seem to have,the Vibe hotel across the road has a rooftop pool but is alot more expensive.We enjoyed our stay with no complaints. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Just awful.”
Reviews.Author: Anu_Finland
Reviews.Content: Well, this isnÂ´t exactly a dream come true for a 3 star hotel... ;) The rooms are extremely small, and dated. We were 3 people in room, but everyday I had to call to get some towels enough for 3 people: they donÂ´t have a hand or face towels, just one small towel for each guest! And we got only two pieces although we were three people in the room...so had to call, every single day. Also had to call about the toilet paper couple of times. They didnÂ´t change the sheets unless you asked them to. And the breakfast...ohlalalaa...terrible! Just bad coffee or hot chocolate / tea from the machine (!), warm apple or orange juice, 1 type of toast bread, margarine and strawberry marmalade. 2 types of youghurt, 2 types of pastires ( dried out) and some warm dishes. Will never go back or recommend. The lobby is always crowded, so go early for the check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: von51
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel was how handy it was to most things, we could walk almost everywhere. Breakfast was good but it is a shame that they don't do other meals. Room was just okay, could have been cleaner and we were met when we arrived home with a credit card bill for damage we hadn't done. cost another phone call to sort it out. For the price overall it was okay and we would probably stay for a night if we were passing through Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel- Worst I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Immokk1
Reviews.Content: Location is okay and that is about the best to be said for this hotel. I have never been to a hotel (perhaps its just me) where they take a $50 deposit from your card before hand instead of simply a card swipe. Then we were offered no help with luggage nor directions to our room (large hotel). The room was small and our room contained only one very cheap looking table and two chairs. No other chairs, no dressing table, no small mirrors, only one bedside table, dimming lights instead of a little lamp each, light swtiches behind pillows, bathroom door almost touches toilet... I could go on. The air con didn't work well and was loud. In fact, everything seemed loud in particular the cleaners outside our room in the morning. The shower heads holder wouldn't hold it in place and it kept drooping, meaning the stream of water was aimed at the wall. On one day we returned to find our dirty towels had been removed and no clean towels left. On the next the bedside table pulled out and broken alarm clock was left on the floor. Rude service, brusque and unhelpful. I would never stay here. Not good prices for poor hotel. Pay a bit more and get somewhere better. I wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Request a room down a quit end. Door Sound proofing poor. But nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sleepy_Holidays
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Travelodge. I will be back but only in a room at the end of the corridor. The sound proofing on the doors was terrible. I could hear movement in the corridor, even people simply walking quietly to the rooms. Plus walking along the hallway myself I could people in the rooms quiet clearly. So not sure whether this was level 9. But it was really bad. Surprising considering the sound proofing on the windows was superb. Couldn't hear anything from the reasonably street below.
