Nor through the walls. That was excellent. So something to consider. A big plus considering it was only rated as a three and a half star. I have had five stars with worse sound proofing. Staff were superb. Efficient, pleasant to deal with, helpful in check in. Basically seemed to enjoy their jobs. A+ Value wise it was excellent value for money. I paid around the $150.00 in peak season so was very impressed. Mattress is very, very firm. So if this is to your liking good place to stay. Otherwise perhaps try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good Value for New Years”
Reviews.Author: wadestuff
Reviews.Content: Good location, but this is a two star hotel with four star hotel prices during the New Year period. With room rates at over $AU300 for a double during New Year, I don't think it is unreasonable to expect a reasonably sized clean room with a decent bed. The Travelodge Sydney failed to deliver on all counts. The bed was hard and uncomfortable, black mold in the shower and a tiny room with windows that don't open made this more of a prison cell than a hotel room. This was our first visit to Sydney and what a great destination but we will not be staying at the Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location but rooms not suitable for a couple.”
Reviews.Author: boros29
Reviews.Content: Very good location close to everything you need to see in Sydney. Rooms was fairly clean but planty of rubbish under the bed. We booked a double bed early November 2010 but when we arrived we were given twin beds, it was a pointless exercise complaining, we were told that "agoda" customers bookings of a double bed was not guranteed. Complained again the next day and was told that they could ring "agoda" and get me a refund, which means I would have had to spend a day looking for another hotel. Our days were fully planned so we made the best of a bad deal. The room did not reflect the money we paid. The room was very small, we had difficulties in fitting two suitcases. Some of the staff was friendly, opposite the hotel is a nice pub with cheap beer. The hotel is walking distance to all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: hdpxx
Reviews.Content: The location is a convenient walk to the city or to Museum subway station. Rooms are smallish, no view, no window to be opened. The aircon worked fine. Beds were good. Shower small but very functional. Car parking next door at Wilsons for a "discounted" $22/night (although Wilson offer $18/night on holidays we still had to pay $22). What angers me is that the hotel is charging $20 / 24hr of Internet and device. I can understand that parking in Sydney is pricey as it requires bricks and mortar and takes up physical space. To charge almost as much for internet should be a crime. Then they charge 1.5% 'bank charge' when paying by card. Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “great price for sydney”
Reviews.Author: coast2coast255060
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in sydney somewhere that is close to everything, not overpriced, clean and friendly - stay here. The rooms were large (for sydney), clean, had a microwave and sink (for the convenience of doing your own cooking), and a pleasant outlook. I was pleasantly surprised. Would stay here again. Check the official website for the hotel as it offered the best price.

Reviews.Title: “FINE ACCOMMODATION, VERY SLOW CHECK OUT”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with the accommodation which was clean and tidy. Perhaps a bit pricy but there was some kind of car race in Sydney at the time and accommodation was difficult to obtain. Our only complaint was the long line up to check out ..... the slowest checkout in any hotel I have been in. Not sure why the delay although the staff seemed to be working quickly although there seemed to be numerous processes they had to go through. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok, but bedding configurations are a problem”
Reviews.Author: Flight99
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney regularly for business and have two other hotels I usually use. They were both booked up, so I picked the Travelodge on the basis of location. Location is quite good, with easy walk to Central Station and some good Thai restaurants nearby. However, like many other reviewers here, I was disappointed with my bedding configuration. As a single traveller, I was given a room with three singles (when it seems there are also rooms with queens, or two singles and a sofa). On that basis alone, I wouldn't book this hotel again or recommend it to others, as I have not had problems at other Sydney hotels with getting my preferred bedding configuration. The beds were not very comfortable either. My room was clean, but had a view straight across the lane to another building. I think backpackers who want somewhere clean to stay after roughing it will like this, but there are other places that are better value for others.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money... not anymore!”
Reviews.Author: Tussi0710
Reviews.Content: Travelodge is perfectly locatedl, all rooms look the same, have kitchenttes with fridge, sink and microwavel.The beds are small, the bathrooms too. Internet is quite pricy and doesn't work well in most rooms. Parking available. We've been here many times (as what you got for what you paid was always ok), but this time room cleaning didn't work AT ALL. We also had our baby with us. Travelodge provided a cot, but unfortunately without a matress and without a blanket. For our next Sydney trip we definitvely have to find a new accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value but didnt enjoy my stay”
Reviews.Author: boredinsouthsea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights recently, arrived before the 1400 check in and deposited my luggage and went back to reception a couple of times to see if my room was ready. It wasnt which is fine and they knew I was sat there waiting but didnt bother to let me know when it was actually ready. I found every encounter I had with the reception staff to be a problem, they didnt seem interested in trying to help at all. The immediate answer to every question was "no, we are fully booked". I had requested a queen bed but my room had twin singles, after the first night I asked to change and the receptionist just said no without even checking availability. Room was quite close to the lifts which make a noise every time they arrive on the floor, this noise woke me a few times during the week, One night I was aware of someone else in my room, I was awake and watching TV, so I jumped up to find security had entered my room without knocking because someone in a neighbouring room had suggested that my alarm clock was constantly going off, which it wasnt. I suggested he should have knocked the door before letting himself in, especially as I was naked and he couldnt see why I was unhappy. Room was cleaned and restocked daily, although some hairs that were on the bathroom floor when I arrived were still there 7 days later when I checked out ! Good location, walking distance to everywhere but I just couldnt get on with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: HullVoyager
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for no frills city centre hotel. Very centrally placed for shopping and harbour areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....Will return on my next visit to Sydney!!!”
Reviews.Author: JayneAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights beginning of December. Great hotel and great price. Its central to everything. Musuem station a 5 mintue walk away (line to get to airport). Coles (supermarket) was 5 minutes walk away and about a 20minute walk to sydney harbour bridge and circular quay. The hotel itself was clean, bed was comfy, room was not noisy at all. There was also a microwave, fridge, cultery, table chairs. You also have to use your room key to use the lift and if you return late at night to get into the hotel itself, as a single female this was a added security. Some staff were a little rude on desk, but overall ok and you can store your luggage for free. Interent was $2 for 20minutes. They offer breakfast only but was $18 so didn't try it. I will be returning to sydney early next year and will be using this hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced studio in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: silvertravellerUk
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and had a comfortable queen bed, small table and chairs for eating, microwave, fridge and sink and minimal crockery and cutlery. Milk, tea and coffee were renewed every day. Like other TA members, we found the room quite noisy - but we always travel with earplugs! I have seen other reports which say that the reception staff were rude, particularly about early checkin. I saw someone hoping to check in after an early arrival - the receptionist apologised for this not being possible and offered to store the luggage - all very polite, no rudeness at all. The hotel is about four minutes walk from Museum Station which is on the same line as the airport, Central Station and Circular Quay so it was easy to get around and we felt safe returning at night. Buses also run close by. World Square Mall is about 4 minutes walk - go there to Coles rather than buying supplies at the very expensive convenience store across the street. There was a clothes washer and drier on our floor but they cost $4 each plus $4 for detergent which I thought was excessive. You can get a bag of laundry washed and dried at the laundry round the corner which might be cheaper. Internet access in the lobby was $2 for 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great for this price!”
Reviews.Author: Maddy_ska
Reviews.Content: Basic and small but nothing to complain about, if you are our all day anyway. Great central location, easy to find (train from the airport, get off at the Museum, 3 minutes walk and your there). There's a fridge and a microwave in your room, so you can reheat ready made meals, good for budget travellers like us. Some supermarkets are around so you donâ€™t have to spend a fortune on food. Walking distance from the harbours and other attractions (ok, our walking distance but 20 minutes is not so far away). Room cleaned daily and toileters replaced as you use them.

Reviews.Title: “Book well in advance to get good room rates”
Reviews.Author: housepartymusic
Reviews.Content: Our family of four including 2 children aged 9 and 10 stayed in the hotel for 7 nights. We booked through email to the hotel about 5 months prior. As our flight arrived at night, we informed the hotel beforehand that we would check in late and got confirmation on the number of persons staying in the room and the bed and sofa bed. When we reached the hotel and showed our reservation confirmation letter, we were promptly given a room on the highest floor with queen bed and a sofa bed. The room was not next to the lifts and it was high above the streets, so there was no sound disturbance during our stay. The room was small but this is understandable because it is a budget hotel and is centrally located. We did not find the room size to be a hindrance. We arranged the furniture to utilize space effectively such as moving the coffee table to the wall and place our luggage bags underneath and on top of the table, and to fold up the sofa bed during the day time. The sofa bed was handy and we did not find it to be too uncomfortable for sleeping. The main bed was average. The room has a wash basin and microwave oven for meal preparation. This was most useful for us as we would buy food and fruits and prepare our daily breakfast there. There was also the daily coffee and tea bags which we could have a cup of coffee during breakfast, afternoon breaks or even late night fix. The toilet was well planned to utilize the limited space well. Though there was no shower door, a bath curtain prevented water from the shower area to wet up the whole toilet. The toilet was equipped with a hair dryer too. There was hot and cold water but the hot water was not as consistent as we would like it to be. Many a time, the hot water dropped off leaving us too cold or came on stronger making us jumping out of the water. The hotel is about 8 minutes walk to the Museum train station, 15 minutes walk to the nearest Coles in World Trade Tower where we bought a lot of grocery, and 25 minutes walk to Chinatown. There is also a bus station on Liverpool street about 5 minutes from the hotel. The much talked about slope to the hotel is the slope up from the hotel entrance along Commonweath Street and the slope up along Liverpool Street to Museum station and a steep slope down Liverpool Street until the Central Business District. We walked the slopes many times but we did not pull any luggage bags with us so I am not sure if it was a problem with the luggage bags especially along Commonwealth Street. But there is an alternative path with less slope up to get to the Museum station that is to walk along Goulbourn Street. The slopes and because of the empty space at the nearby Hyde Park, there was always a strong cold wind to greet us when we did the slopes going to and fro the hotel. On the day we left, we checked out early before 10 am like the hotel required us and left our luggage with the hotel as our flight was late at night. There were ample taxis outside the hotel which we took to and fro the airport. The taxi fare was around A$30 one way. We did not take the airport shuttle bus (which cost A$12 per person (same price for adult and children) because the service finished by 8 pm and we could only exit the airport after that time on arrival. We did not take the train (which cost A$15 per person) because we did not want to walk the slopes with our luggage. Anyway, as there were 4 of us, it was cheaper for us to use the taxi. Food wise, we could walk to the CBD where the restaurants open until mid night and to Chinatown where economical food is available. The crowded lobby area for checking in and out did not turn into a problem for us during our stay. In conclusion, the hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to many places like mentioned above. If booked earlier, the room rates are reasonable as a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 star - good location”
Reviews.Author: ReenTraveller
Reviews.Content: Convinient location. Twin bed offered despite request for double/queen. They did offer to change after 3 nights (6 nights booked in total) but wanted 10am checkout and 2pm check-in again which wasn't good for us. Good breakfast (but tinned fruit). Housekeeping was poor to average (bedsheets were not straightened before pulling blankets on 4-5 days, room was not hoovered on any of the days, basin appeared clean 1-2 days, bathroom floor was not sweeped most days coffee cups weren't washed etc) Overall satisfied. You get what you pay for and the front desk was too quick to point this out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, standard quality”
Reviews.Author: OnZeeEdge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights. The location, quality and size of the room was quite good for the price. I like walking around Sydney, so everything was in easy reach. Bus stops aren't too far away if you want to get to Circular Quay quickly or make the trip out to Bondi. Breakfast was a buffet and looked pretty bad - I'm glad it wasn't included in the price. This place isn't the best for light sleepers - traffic and fairly thin walls (the guy next door was snoring like a champion). Ask for a high floor to solve the traffic problem, not sure what to do about snorers...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - If you want a queen bed, go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: rscoro
Reviews.Content: Having stayed a week prior in Travelodge Southbank in Melbourne, we thought we were plain sailing. However, despite the fact that the rooms are almost identical, this was a much more disappointing place to stay. First of all, the queen bed situation. It turns out, that even though the website suggests that if you ask for a queen bed, you'll get one, that in fact is contradicted by the fine print. No way of arguing with the staff when you arrive, and they only have twin beds left. Worse, than for us, was the older couple who arrived after us, who didn't get one either. Frankly, this should be in big, bold letters when you make the booking, as it's obviously a huge issue. And the staff are incredibly rude about the whole thing. It's almost impossible to get a park out the front to drop off your bags, and the parking building they use is miles away and pretty expensive. (Still, I suspect it's cheap for parking in the Sydney CBD). The rooms themselves were clean. Same shower issue as Travelodge in Melbourne where a shower will cover your bathroom floor in water. It's cheap compared to other places in Sydney, but be ware, that unlike Travelodge Southgate, you give up some important stuff, when you pay less here. We would have been better off paying a little bit more and actually enjoying ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Brixham1
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and check in was very quick. We had booked 2 double rooms but only one was available with a queen bed, the other room was a twin which was no problem for our son. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean. The only negative thing to be said was that our double bed was the most uncomfortable we had every slept on, but perhaps we were just unlucky. The location of the hotel is very handy for the Museum Street station.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed for the price”
Reviews.Author: invisigirl
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my 10 month old baby, and was looking for a well located hotel at a minimum cost, and after extensive research decided on the Travelodge. I submitted a request for a room with a couch, and on a high floor to help the baby sleep (street noise). Arriving at 1pm my requests were honoured and I was assisted by a lovely gentleman with my luggage up to my room. As porter services were not expected this was a welcome surprise (travelling alone with my son means lots of luggage for me). Our room was freshly renovated and a bigger size than I had expected. There was a cracked section of one tile in the kitchenette, however it didn't impact my stay. The bed was nice and firm, although it would be too hard if you like a soft bed - I sleep on a futon so I often find hotel beds in Australia too soft. It was well serviced each day of our 8 night stay, with one little quirk that I never knew if I would get 3, 4 or 5 teabags replenished into my supply. No problem as I had brought my own back ups ;-) The location was excellent, a short walk to world square (with a coles supermarket), Chinatown and all the city has to offer. Taxis were called for me on request (as I needed baby seat) and always came quickly, with the longest wait about 10 minutes on Melbourne Cup day. I got a few free breakfasts and they were great - I appreciated the offer of a take away coffee cup when my baby started crying so I could have my coffee in my room. On the morning of checkout I was confronted with a 20 metre long queue, and anticipated a long wait, however the front desk staff were efficient and everything was completed in 15 minutes. Overall, the Travelodge Sydney exceeded expectations - I found the staff to be courteous and efficient, and for the price I couldn't fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: harbrsl
Reviews.Content: i'd read about long check-in times and the possibility that i could only get a twin bed. when i arrived at 2pm, i not only got a double bed but i also asked for a room far from the elevator and was happily given one. the kitchenette was next to the door and i had a long hall to my bathroom and bedroom. this made it quieter than most rooms. the bed was comfortable but they didn't have extra pillows available in the room. i thought that odd. there was a table and chairs in the room. they were wooden so not super comfortable but it was nice to have the space for breakfast and sorting out my maps for the next day's activities. the location was fantastic. it was 3 short blocks to world square where there's a supermarket, cheap internet, discount bottle shop and a myriad restaurants/coffee shops. it was 1.5 blocks from museum train station so getting to them from the airport was easy. 5 blocks to chinatown. the waterfront was a long walk so i took the train from museum to circular quay - easy! really though, i have no complaints. i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “would come again!”
Reviews.Author: Nana81
Reviews.Content: Clean & spacey rooms, kitchenette with microwave, good selection for breakfast, Location is just 300m south of hyde park (museum stn) and 10min walk from main station, i.e. easy access to the airport by train (or alternatively airport shuttle bus). Walking to opera house in about 20min. No inhouse restaurant, but a small convenience store around the corner and The Vibe hotel (also pick up for organized tours) with its restaurant are just around the corner. I made a trip to the Blue Mountains and Manly and simply loved it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chintu229
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights in this hotel. the location was amazing as we very close to all the attractions & walking distance to darling harbour, george st,chinatown & amazing choice of restaurants. the hotel looks good from outside but inside it seemed a little run down. the bed was hardly enough for my wife & myself. i'm a 6 footer & the bed was quite uncomfortable for me. the toilets were spacious but need a lot of improvement as it looks very dated. the ac also was not very effective but luckily for us the weather was quite good in sydney when we had gone. the aircon unit was huge & ugly to look at in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RichardM186349
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by this hotel. I had booked a room with a Queen size bed only to find that I had been relegated to a single bed. What can you do about it? Nothing apparently as they dont gurantee anything at all. Makes you wonder what is the point in specifying what level of service you want. Maybe it would be better to just throw everyones details in a large bin and pull them out randomly. Oh and having arrived late in the day, it was good to find a hotel in this day and age that doesnt do any food at all (apart from a continental breakfast). Would I stay there again? Not on your life!

Reviews.Title: “great value, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: shoes77shoes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early October 2010 - couldn't have been happier with the hotel. Great position - just on the edge of Hyde Park and an easy 15/20 minute stroll to Circular Quay. Rooms were clean and spacious, with a kitchenette that included a microwave. Staff were very helpful - we got to the hotel at 7:30am after a 24 hour flight and they had a room ready for us even though they state on the website that check in is after 2pm. Safety deposit boxes are free, breakfast is good (and if you book on a Tuesday, you can get 'buy one get one free' on your breakfast) and there is a good selection of leaflets in the lobby area suggesting activities in and around Sydney. I intend to go back to Sydney and will most certainly book into this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: hateswork
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a long weekend. As has been previously mentioned good location and great simple budget accommodation. Good value for Sydney. We were unable to get a double bed though we were able to get connecting rooms. There was also no charge for a baby cot which was great. We used the car parking $22/day which was just down the road a easy to use. The only complaint is that the shower curtain does not really stop the water spilling out on the bathroom floor. Finally we found the staff to be frendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: cammy79
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate for this hotel on hotels.com. I think it was about US$70. For the price I was paying, of course I wasn't sure of what to expect. I know Travelodge in the US are more of motels and inns, but from the picture here it seemed like a big hotel. I didn't expect a 5 star hotel, but the hotel exceeded my expectations. I enjoyed my stay very much. Its not in the city center, but if you don't mind walking a few blocks, you'll get to the places where the shopping is easily , or you can take a taxi for a few dollars or the bus. The room was surprisingly big. We had 2 single beds, and there was a sofa with a coffee table too. The bathroom was a bit small, but decent enough. The only complain I have is when you take a shower, the water is everywhere in the bathroom, cause its just one level. There is no step or breaker from the shower to the rest of the bathroom. That was about the only problem. The room also had a microwave, a fridge, sink and kettle. So my sister loved that cause her daughter is very picky with food, so she got to heat up the food she brought for her. The hotel only has a breakfast area, but we didn't have breakfast there. My sister did, but she didn't like it. There is a coffee shop right across the hotel near the 24 hour mini mart where we would have our breakfast for less. They had a good selection of breakfast items, pancakes, sandwiches, yogurt, fruits. All kinds of things for a few dollars. And good coffee. There is no other restaurant in the hotel except the breakfast, so if you come back after a day of shopping without having dinner yet, make sure you grab some take out because it'll be hard to find food around the area at night. The coffee shop we go to closes at 5pm I think. There is a bar across the street, but we didn't go there. I would definitely go back to this hotel again if I'm on a budget and at Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Aussievacationer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with friends. The room had all expected accommodations (refrigerator, water boiler, hair dryer, tv, etc). The location was pretty good, within walking distance to many shops and restaurants and very close to Hyde Park. Internet was $24 for 3 days, but was spotty. There were always cabs outside, and you can take a shuttle to the airport if you let the front desk know a day ahead of time. All said, this room provided basic amenities, and was worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great little bargain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanaQueensland
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just on the outskirts of the CBD area in Sydney , and it was exceptional value. The rooms were newly renovated, spacious with comfy beds , white sparkling bathrooms and efficient reception staff. All you need for a terrific stay, the standard twin room we had booked had mini bar and sink, tea & coffee making facilies, and was tastefully decorated twin beds, table and chairs a sofa, and one comfy chair and a view of the street. The wonderful thing about all this was the price, I booked on the internet on the Virgin Blue hotel booking site and paid just $84 per night, a genuine bargain in Sydney. I am quite fussy with hotels, and I can recommend this great little hotel. its not 5 star, but it ticks all the right boxes for a pleasant stay and more spending money in your pocket

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely busy trying to see everything Sydney city has to offer”
Reviews.Author: SydneyLizzie
Reviews.Content: As I live in Sydney and had to use up our week before it expired, I decided to take myself and my 10 year old son into the city as we don't venture to the city so it was all an eyeopener for me as well. The hotel was a walk away from everything, we walked, caught buses and trains as well just for the fun of it. My son had never been to the Opera House or the Aquarium so they were highights. Our hotel had a microwave so if we didn't eat out, we 'd stop at Woolworths or Coles and buy frozen meals. Our towels were changed every other day and the room was always cleaned and tidied. The bed was a bit hard but all in all we had a great week and my son certainly caught up on all the touristy attractions Sydney has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money!”
Reviews.Author: FredADimitroff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early September, and was very pleased with my stay. The hotel itself was in a good location for the rates offered. I am a walking person and enjoyed the 10-15 minute walks to all the major points of interest. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and as other people have stated the beds could have been a bit softer. The service I got was excellent, anything I needed I got. All in all I was very pleased with ny stay here, and if there was one thing to knock it would be there lack of free wifi service. I guess being from America and getting free wifi everywhere I go, I almost expected it. But in the end I came to visit Sydney not use the Internet. So the Internet cafe in the lobby was sufficent enough. Plan to stay here whenever I am in Sydney and that will be a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamTravelator
Reviews.Content: Â£50 a night for a base in Sydney. Good location, clean room with good cleaners. Microwave and fridge to use. I stayed 4 nights and these were excellent facilities for me(however common in Australia). There are more better located hotels but you will be paying a high price. I loved the walk anyway. Want a good hotel with a good price in Sydney.....this will do the job. Lacks services but its what I would expect from this chain having used them in UK. Didnt bother me, was a base and thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kischrisgene
Reviews.Content: This hotel has alot of things going for it. It is only a 20-30 minutes walk from all the major sights and 10-20 minutes from major shopping and restaurant area. The hotel is across the street from a police station so i felt safe walking around at 03:00 am. They provide a map for you when you checkin in hold your luggage if you arrive early. It is conveniently located approx. 2 blocks from the train station. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean. They provided you with coffee and free cream in the refrigerator for you, which was a very nice suprise. The beds were a bit hard. They do serve breakfast for a price, we did not try it however. Only downside we had was the fact you had to use your hotel key in the elevator to go up to your room which was nice for security, if the keys worked half the time. But the keys would not work so you would end up riding the elevator for 15 minutes before either going to check your card or taking the stairs. And it wasn't only us we rode the elevator with many others having the same problem. But overall for being in Sydney (which is kinda expensive) the prices were competitive. I will definitely stay here again when i go back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rskblueyes
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning flying from the USA. The person at the front desk was pleasant and explained that check-in wasnt untill 2pm, but the room may be ready around 12:30pm. I was able to check my luggage until the room was ready. I arrived back at my hotel later in the day, and went to the room. The room was very basic, with furniture that appeared to by IKEA style from the 1980's. The bed was very uncomfortable. There was however a flat screen tv that had about 4 channels. The bathroom was large and had nice toiletries. There was limited free wifi in the lobby, and paid interent. The most positive aspect of this hotel is it's location. It is short walking distance to the musuem subway stop which is on the same line as the train to the airport. The hotel is very close to the start of Oxford street where there are resturants. You canwalk to the CBD and Chinatown in a matter of minutes as well. So if you want a great location and limited frills with a fair priced room, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DanTraveller74
Reviews.Content: Same as per Travelodge Melbourne. No frills but clean and conveniently located. 10 mins walk to town hall. Spacious rooms. Each room has a small fitted kitchen with microwave. But I realised this is quite common in Australia. Iron and iron board were available as well. In the building there must be a laundry at disposal of guests. I only saw it mentioned in the lift but didn't use it, therefore cannot really comment. Again, staff are not the most attentive guys in the world still helpful enough. Which in the end it's what I expect in these places. I stayed 5 nights, booked through expedia and paid 382 EUR for the 5 nights. Would say value for money. D.

Reviews.Title: “In - and out”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: I booked a double bed - I am 6ft 4 inches, after all. I got a twin, two rather small singles. I complained to reception, which only annoyed me more as I was told that they had to give the double rooms to other priority customers. Having already pre-paid my room, it appears that I was no longer a priority, so they could give me something I did not book. I found the Area Managers E mail, and E mailed her. An excellent response, well handled. If only the poor receptionist had the same powers to resolve customer complaints. So I was booked into another hotel - did not stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and best location”
Reviews.Author: Adrianaclopez
Reviews.Content: I didn't regret to stay at this hotel as we had a nice room s very near of downtown (it was 5 minutes walking from Hyde Park - Museum Station and 10 Minutes walking to Sydney Tower, etc). The personnel is nice and they are open to help you anytime!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: robjay2
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge is at a great location... minutes walk to the main rail station and not far from many major sights (1 block from Hyde Park). The rooms were nicely appointed. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very limited service”
Reviews.Author: Caltom67
Reviews.Content: Location is great walkable to most of the attractions and close to transit. Service is limited FYI the "available" internet is in the lobby and is coin operated so you cannot use your own laptop! Breakfast 6:30 to 9:30 cost 18.00 AUD and is the same everyday, bacon, sausage, srambled eggs, beans, pasta, pastries, juice and coffee. Staff at breakfast are really nice and just the best! House keeping was less than great I asked to have my room made up early in the day and still was not done till late afternoon after 2 requests. Room is basic but nice overall, the real issue is noise from other rooms you can hear everything said in the next room at 2 AM a drunk couple make sleeping an issue. Overall I would stay here again ONLY of it was a real cheap deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: murphy_sa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Travelodge for 4 nights in mid August. I found the location to be excellent, 10 mins walk to the centre of Chinatown with great cheap dining options and not far from both the Rocks and Darling Harbour areas. The room itself was basic and very clean, no frills or extras but couldn't really expect any for the price. I was a little surprised that there was no internet whatsoever in the rooms (paid or otherwise) but there is 3 or 4 computers in the reception area which are 2 dollars for 20 mins. Can't comment on the breakfast because I felt $18 was a bit pricey for brekkie so I went elsewhere. One additional point - I had made a mistake in my initial booking process (I had booked for the wrong month), the hotel were happy to give us the room at the original discounted rate that I had booked from Expedia, they really didn't have to so I was happy that they did this.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, convenient, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: sferd
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. Honestly, I was beginning to worry that we would not be able to find an affordable place to stay in Sydney. We booked directly from the hotel website--if you stay more than 3 days, you get a 30% discount. Just be VERY careful with your dates--you have to pre-pay and if you make a mistake (like I did) the hotel is reluctant to alter your booking. It all worked out and I was refunded the extra night when we checked in. This is a big hotel and very busy. When we arrived (about 10:30am) there was a line of people registering. No way to check in before 2pm. Very full luggage storage room. Our room was clean and on a high floor (17). Rooms have refrigerators, kettles, bowls, plates, glasses & silverware. It all seemed fine until I took off the pillowcases and got a look at the nasty, yellow pillows. I called and insisted on new pillows--really glad I did that. I agree with other posts that there is a lot of noise from the hallway & rooms next door. Luckily, we were near the end of a hall, so it wasn't too much of an issue. But, I would be wary of a room near the lift/elevator. Reception has lockboxes which are free to use and handy. The hotel charges a lot for little incidentals: laundry $4 washer/$4 dryer/$4 detergent, internet $6 hour. We never ate at the hotel. There are a lot of interesting restaurants & shops on nearby Oxford Street including 2 supermarkets where we picked up stuff for breakfast. The hotel is very convenient to public transportation--the Museum Station is only 2 blocks away and many buses go up/down nearby Elizabeth Street. We bought a weekly pass to the buses/trains/ferries for $41--best $$ we ever spent! As far as getting to/from the airport--I would recommend the Airport Shuttle. $24 for a round-trip ticket. As mentioned previously, there are a lot of steps at the rail stations and I certainly did not want to lug my luggage! Overall, I thought this was a good place to stay. Although, it was frustrating to be checking out with the airport shuttle waiting only to be told that we had watched three moves--2 of them 'adult.' WHAT??? I protested my innocence and finally left, but I am keeping an eye on my credit card bill to be sure no extra charges show up. Suggestions for Oxford Street & nearby: -Betty's Soup Kitchen ($10 soup & salad bar) -Iku (organic, vegetarian food) -Thai Me Up! (best Thai food I've had in a while, but I AM from NZ!) -Mad Mex (chain Mexican food, but cheap and delicious--on side street) -Priceline Pharmacy (VERY helpful chemist) -The Falconer--we didn't get a chance to eat here ourselves, but it has raves on Sydney dining sites. Open @ 7:30am for breakfast/also open for dinner. Cool atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: liondan22
Reviews.Content: There is pretty much nothing bad you can say about this place. Its basic with not many extras but if your just after a clean place to sleep while in Sydney then its spot on and fairly cheap. The breakfast buffet is decent enough for $18, but with so many cafes and restaurants around you could spend less going for a shirt walk into the city.

Reviews.Title: “ok, good location but couldn't get the room we'd booked, wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: gemmawinfield
Reviews.Content: BBooked hotel on expedia and requested a queen bed room- I know there is always the Ts and Cs text which says your room choice is not guaranteed but I guess you always presume if you book it early enough then you'll get the room you want. Anyway when we turned up they said they had no double bed rooms left so we'd have to have a room with 3 singles. Not impressed. They said this was the case for lots of guests. They weren't very apologetic and didn't offer any compensation or free breakfast or anything. The location was ok. Very close to museum train station but not as central as I would have liked. Room was ok, quiet small and bathroom was very dated, as was the TV etc Overall it was ok but I would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Stalag 13”
Reviews.Author: Perisphere
Reviews.Content: Talk about a long winded and regimented check in procedure; then repeated at check out!. You are forced to have your private ID details photocopied even with a credit card hold. You are given an indecipherable terms and conditions form to sign away your savings on. Many other so called 4 star hotels (and this is not one) have moved on to the new century.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, efficient friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mandbTasmania
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family group (with a one year old baby) in three different rooms on the 15th. floor, the rooms are reasonably sized with very good beds and pillows. One of the rooms had a problem with the airconditioner and upon reporting the problem it was fixed immediately. The only criticism is that the bathrooms seem to have no ventilation but apart from that we all thought (six of us) that this hotel was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: FieldofClothofGold
Reviews.Content: Great value; very comfortable bed; helpful staff; good room with a fridge and a microwave; great location near Museum station (easy to airport); close to restaurants etc in World square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Swansforever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Travelodge for the second time last weekend. We stayed 3 nights. The hotel is surprisingly good for the money that we paid. This time we had a basic room on the 16th floor. The room was reasonable size, very clean, with an excellent bed. There was also a small table and 2 chairs, flatscreen TV, small sink area with microwave, fridge and basic dishes and cutlery. The bathroom was clean with plenty of towels and a shower. There was no bath. Unfortunately the hair dryer did not work. The room was very warm even though it was freezing cold outside and this was not even using a heater. There was very little street noise. The location is fantastic. You can walk to everything but are just far enough away to not be bothered by traffic and chaos. My only criticism of this hotel was the breakfast, which we thought was below standard. We would have liked decent bread, fresh fruit, fresh milk and more choice of cereals. We did not check out the cooked food as we don't eat cooked breakfasts. If you don't want to eat at the hotel there are plenty of eating places close by. Overall we enjoyed our stay and thought it was excellent value and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel good location!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine_paul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last Saturday night booked directly thru website for $120 with free midday check out with NRMA membership. Arrived at 11pm to hotel & were told there were no queen rooms left. We got 2 single beds. Room also had a pull out sofa bed so for the price it is good value you could sleep 4 in one room. There was a microwave, kettle & sink in room which could be handy for guests. There was also a small dining table in the room. Room didnt have a view & we didnt check out any facilities. Parking is down the road in a public carpark you pay for it thru the hotel at $22 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: minibreakaholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge for 3 nights. Originally the trip was to meet up with my mum and spend the weekend in Sydney together (she travelled from WA, myself from central NSW). We booked a twin room through Sydnicity with a stay 2 nights, get the third free, so paid $300 for 3 nights. We ended up changing plans and my partner came with us, adding a third single bed to the room for $81. Not bad value at all! The hotel is clean, comfortable (low pillows though), and not that far from the CBD. It is further out than other hotels, but still not too far - 15 minutes walk to Darling Harbour at most. The bathroom is small, but it is all you need.

Reviews.Title: “Value for low money”
Reviews.Author: Lachanophobie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge in Sydney for 3 nights and booked via venere.com for only AUD 65 per night. A single room in a hostel is maybe 20 dollars less - but it's not worth saving the money. The hotel is conveniently located (not in the centre of the CBD, but still within walking distance, only 3 minutes to the mtr), clean and quiet. Rooms are quite spacious, have a lcd-tv, iron, iron board, aircon, etc. Real value for low money, the only thing I was missing was free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: itinerant2010
Reviews.Content: Modern comfortable room with a small kitchenette. The only place that we found that provide proper triple single beds. The bathroom was clean but small. Can be noisy at time when people next door talk loudly or children crying. There doesn't seem to be any reasonably priced eating places nearby and the stuff at the convenience store nearby is very expensive - some items have no prices.

Reviews.Title: “Have to pay for internet”
Reviews.Author: wilsonjing
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between Jan.4-8 Have to pay in internet, even the Starbucks in Sydney public computers are not good enough

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: kenbroo
Reviews.Content: if ever in sydney stay at the travelodge hotel, great staff, clean rooms, nice city

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MargandMike
Reviews.Content: Sydney is expensive, so this is good value for money. Good location, close to metro and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, Good location”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonnz
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 3night stay. Room was clean. Although not located near the waterfront it is well serviced by CityRail and a 10minute walk to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - great accommodation for those on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: siandawks
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently took a week's trip to Sydney. We wanted to spend less on accommodation and more on sight-seeing, so we decided to go for budget accommodation. We wanted somewhere affordable and simple, but still private and clean. We were worried about what we would get for the price we paid, so we booked 3 nights in the Travelodge, then 3 nights in a backpackers just in case one was bad. We were sorry we moved to the backpackers, because for the difference in price, the Travelodge was so much nicer. Such value for money, clean, quiet, and central without being in a dodgy area or around "backpacker" type people. Rooms were great! Kitchenette had a microwave, fridge, kettle, and sink - with cutlery and crockery, and coffee, tea and sugar, as well as a little carton of milk (everything gets topped up everyday and you can just call reception from your room to ask for more if you need). Room has a plasma screen tv, iron and ironing board. Bathroom was old style, but clean, with towels, hairdryer, soaps and shampoos. Room is serviced everyday, they even wash your dishes for you. There is a laundry and vending machines on certain floors, and internet access in the lobby. Security is great, you have to swipe your card to operate the lift to get to your floor. You hardly even notice any other people around you because the rooms are so quiet. It is immaculately clean, the staff are well-presented and helpful. We got a great rate through expedia.com.au, however the only problem with Expedia is that the room you have requested is not guaranteed. So we were given a room with two single beds instead of the queen bed which we had booked. It was not the end of the world though - definitely book through expedia.com.au to get a good rate, but perhaps just phone a fews days before you arrive to ask if they can confirm you will get the bed you asked for and make sure you check-in as early as they allow so you get first choice. We were so disappointed to have to leave the Travelodge, but could not stay longer because they were fully booked. Will not stay anywhere else in Sydney next time we visit. This place was really outstanding! An absolute winner for couples of any age looking for a quality place to stay in Sydney without paying ridiculous rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: oldmikeNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Second time at this hotel this time ge had a corner room with one complete wall of windows which provided a great view. Facilities at this hotel provide all anyone needs with a small kitchenette area in the room. The rooms are reasonably comfortable and had enough space for our 3 night stay. Booked a rate that included breakfast and both of us enjoyed the breakfast offerings that the hotel provides in its breakfast room. For future trips to Sydney would seriouslyconsider this hotel again as a place stay

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, price was right”
Reviews.Author: Tuuli
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in Travelodge Sydney. Location was very good for us, center Sydney, Oxford street shopping, Surry Hills resturants were all within walking distance. Room was good and clean, price we paid was very good for the quality of room. Used the washing machines and dryers on laundry rooms (2 AUD each) few times, very handy. Staff was friendly, except the man on night shift. We we wanted to check out very early and he was quite unhappy to serve us in the early hours. This little drawback did not ruin the stay, I would recommend the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location good value”
Reviews.Author: claguey1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights here, we were on the 15th floor which made it nice and quiet. The hotel itself is quite basic, there is a restaurant which is more of a cafeteria inasmuch you wont be served gourmet food, it is mainly (possibly only) used for breakfast which is served 6.30-9.30, breakfast costs $AU13.50 at check-in. We never had it so cant comment. The hotel seems to be frequented by backpackers and students, dont let this put you off though, it isnt a dump by any means. Check in and out was excellent, taking a couple of minutes each time, they also let you store your luggae in a secure room until you are ready for it. The rooms are clean and have all the regular facilities and a couple more including a microwave, kettle, fridge, iron and board, a litle sink area and tea/coffeee facilities. Rooms have a 32" LCD TV which has the usual TV channels, Free FOXTel sport channels and payTV Movies. The bed we had was a queen (UK King) and was quite comfortable, although the pillows came in 2 sizes: Thin or Huge! Plenty of lighting options and good blockout curtains, we thought it was still nightime at 9.30am, the room was pitch dark. The bathroom is very small, but the shower is great with hot water and good pressure at all times, toilet OK, and sink OK with a large mirror. The only problem we had was that out extractor fan in the bathroom didnt work, so it was very steamy which the wife moaned about because she couldnt see to put on her makeup! Location is good, only a 10 minute walk to George St, 3 minute walk to Museum railway station which is a direct link to the airport ($15 pp each way- train every 10mins with a 12 min journey to the airport). The hotel does offer a $12 airport shuttle, but the journey takes an hour with lots of stops, so we found the train a quicker option. Make sure you take comfortable shoes, i took some new ones and my feet were crippled after a couple of days with al the walking (we did lots). Tip: when you come out of the hotel turn RIGHT and walk along Goulbourn St, this takes you straight to George St, Chinatown and close to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel - needs better sound proofing though”
Reviews.Author: jules7706
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights before flying home to Europe. Hotel room was nicely decorated, nice to have a kettle, sink, microwave etc. I was happy with hotel location as needed to get to it from Central Station, booked the airport shuttle bus to avoid the journey with suitcase but it isn't too far if need be. The main problem I had with this hotel is that there doesn't seem to be adequate soundproofing - I could hear cleaners in nearby rooms almost like they were in my room and the person staying next door to me was talking quite loudly (not shouting but still I could make out individual words). Thankfully all went quiet around 1.30am when I was ready to go to sleep anyway. It's a nice budget hotel and perhaps I was unlucky with the room allocation but there should have been better sound insulation between rooms - for that reason I probably wouldn't stay again

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I spent 3 nights at the...”
Reviews.Author: jaydub919
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Travelodge Sydney in mid-June.Â  We were very happy with our stay and will definitely stay there again when we return to Sydney.Â  We arrived from the airport quite early in the morning.Â  We went to the hotel with plans to drop off our bags, as we were way ahead of scheduled check-in time.Â  When we arrived, Damien at the front desk was very friendly and helpful...and allowed us to check into our room way early.Â  After a 15 hour flight from LAX and a little over an hour of clearing customs & taking the train into town, this was awesome!Â  Damien proved to be helpful again later in our stay, helping us with making a local call to a tour company to make a reservation for us.Â  He really was an awesome employee and an asset to the hotel. The rooms were very clean and fairly modern.Â  Our room was quiet and the little mini-kitchen (microwave, mini-fridge, sink, and dishes) really made for more frugal dining in the evenings.Â  Pay-per-use internet was available near the restaurant and was fast & comparably priced to any other internet kiosk.Â  No complaints there. The location was great as well.Â  I short walk to Chinatown and even shorter walk to the Museum CityRail station.Â  We walked from Darling Harbor to the hotel several times without breaking a sweat. All in all, it was a good stay and I can definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: zcannonDC
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay at the Travelodge - first time visiting Sydney. The location was perfect to explore the city by foot, and conveniently adjacent to a train station. Rooms are basic, very clean. Overall, a very solid hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good location but no car park and internet”
Reviews.Author: Thanhtrungdao
Reviews.Content: If you rent the car and wish to find the car park then you have to expect to pay a high rate because there is no cheap rate parking station around and there are no access to internet at level 13th and below. However it still very cheap and clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: UkAnnabel
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here. Excellent value for money. Good location, about 20minutes easy walk to opera house/harbour. 5 minutes to nearest train station. Staff friendly and helpful. Able to do late night check-in. Room basic but clean, had kitchenette which was useful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieSTL1978
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel to stay at while exploring Sydney. While the rooms are pretty basic, they are clean and comfortable, as well as quite spacious. The hotel is in a good location to explore Sydney. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff......”
Reviews.Author: tamarikis6969
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tavelodge Wentwoth Ter, Sydney recently, we found it to more than suitable, the staff were wonderful, it is in a great location, handy to Central Railway Stn, Bus stops, Monorail, China Town/Paddy Markets and within an easy walking distance of Darling Harbour. Although the hotel does not have inhouse meals apart from Breakfast, we did not find this to be a problem, as there are any number of food outlets quiet handy and one of the local pubs serve a real delicous meal......we would stay there again. Regards, Lynne Coughlan

Reviews.Title: “a decent place to stay in a near-perfect location”
Reviews.Author: stanberg
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here for several nights in early June for about US$65/night. The room was very clean, but small and with a tiny kitchenette. I don't think you can find a better deal for a similar class hotel at a location as good as this one. We like to walk; from here we could walk pretty much anywhere we wanted: 15-20 mins to Botanical Gardens, 25-30 mins to Circular Quay, 5 mins to China Town, 10-15 mins to Darling Harbour. If you don't like walking that much, Museum train station is 5 mins away and the free 555 bus (green CBD shuttle) stops only two blocks away. All hotel extras are quite expensive: AU$1 for 10 mins of using their Internet kiosk, AU$18 for breakfast, AU$4 each for using a washer and drier (there are several laundry facilities on different floors). There's no WIFI, but you can find it for free at any McDonalds and in many Gloria Jean's cafes. There are two supermarkets, Coles and Woolworths, very close to the hotel. Coles at the World Square is open until midnight and (IMHO) has a better selection and more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Chuzz
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with a queen bed 6 months before but when we arrived we were given a room with wheelchair access with only a double bed. When we asked to be moved we were told that they were fully booked - in May?!! Eventually, after a long conversation we were given another room with a queen bed, the hotel was obviously not fully booked! The hotel is in a good position to walk to all the main sights as well as Central Station and the room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scurry_chicken
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Sydney is a great hotel for price and location. We got a great rate on hotels.ca and really didn't want anything fancy as we didn't plan on spending much time in the room. The location was ideal for public transportation as we took a few different buses and all got us very close to the hotel. The free 555 CBD bus is a real bonus and the bus stop is located a few short blocks away. The staff at the front desk were friendly and efficient. We were given our hotel room right away even though we arrived in the morning and were not expecting a room to be available. The room itself is basic but clean and comfortable. There was quite a bit of room for the two of us. The sink, plates and utensils provided is another bonus. The hotel is located a few short blocks from Chinatown and Hyde Park. The 15-20 minute walk to Circular Quay is great because thre is so much to see in downtown Sydney! We made sure to walk through beautiful Hyde Park on our way back to the hotel each night. World Square which is also a few blocks away is a great breakfast place for a quick bite to eat in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Room, Good Location, Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PUFCMatt
Reviews.Content: Booked a discount rate early with this hotel and had to ask for them to change my reservation to 7 days later due to the Ash Cloud cancelling our flight to Singapore. After being told no youve lost your money, I pleaded with them to have a heart and they changed our booking for no fee. Arrived very early in Sydney from Singapore, our bags were securely kept and we asked for our rooms to be ready asap. Got into our rooms about 1pm so was very tired and straight to bed. Hotel was clean, staff friendly and location pretty good with Museum station 1 block away and Central Station only a ten minute walk. Breakfast had plenty of choice (English, Pastrys, Cereals, Fruit, Yoghurts, Tea, Coffee, Hot Chocolate, Fresh Juice, Water) and we had this included in the price, not sure if I would have paid for it every day though as If i remember I thought it a bit pricey. Plenty of bars around, one right opposite the Hotel was friendly and an Irish bar just down the road on the right! Overall very happy and one of the best Hotels we stayed in during our 4 week trip

Reviews.Title: “everything is nice .”
Reviews.Author: ronmaskis99
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 5 nights in mid February 2010. Requested a queen size bed when made booking online, and we got exactly that upon check-in. We arrived at AM, their safe room. We tried our luck coming back at 1, and surprise, our room was ready. We got room 914. It was nice and spacious enough for two, with a sofa bed added as a bonusif !the water pressure is not enough. But apart from that, everything is nice,reception staff was helpful enough, and the housekeeping staff did a good job cleaning our room every day. Not to mention showing professionalism and class too, that is when my wife realized she had left her BlackBerry in the room a few hours after we had checked out, when we came back, they delivered it back to us at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Preference not Guaranteed, & booking not refundable”
Reviews.Author: IzzieB
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel trough expedia as my preferred hotel only had twin rooms available and as I had planned a short overseas trip for my husbands 40th birthday twin beds were out. I booked a standard room with a Queen bed and my card was charged instantly. On check in I was told they had no Queen bed rooms available and that we had a twin room. When I questioned this I was told my booking was non refundable and the front desk person showed me a laminated copy of the expedia booking page( obviously they do this all the time) with fine print highlighted stating special requests were not guaranteed until check in. I did find this to be very misleading, other hotels separate their rooms into queen and twin, I felt the way this hotel sells its rooms is very misleading, had I know I was actually booking a gamble on the type of room I was getting I would have stuck with my preferred hotel. We stayed 3 nights, our face flannels were never changed during our stay despite them being put on the floor in the shower with the towels for cleaning, there was hair under the sheets on both beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: datc_manchester
Reviews.Content: For a hotel this close into Sydney the prices that you can get a room for are great. The room had all the things we needed for a short stay and it's reasonably close to both Museum Street underground train and the monorail... which pretty much means you can get anywhere in the city without too much effort. We found the hotel itself to be modern and comfortable, if we had a complaint it would be that there was quite a bit of noise in the room we had from either aircon units or the lifts (not sure which but we were on a high floor) Overall it suited our budget and was better then expected

Reviews.Title: “just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: mariahzwind
Reviews.Content: for our needs this was just the ticket. We have stayed before and felt the same 3 ys ago, we needed a budget accommodation for ourselves a 4 yr old and a baby near city centre. We paid $105 a night plus $5 per night for the cot and $22 a day for parking... brought an air mattress and blanket for our 4yr old. Rooms have a small kitchenette with kettle, microwave, sink, sm fridge (smaller than a bar fridge), 3 mugs, 3 plates, 3 bowls, cutlery, tea and coffee w/ milk., Iron, ironing board, hair dryer. Close to Hyde park and Museum station. Parking is in an adjacent block. Lots of nearby eating on Oxford street. Secure room key reqired to acess floors. If you are showering in the evening you need to wait about five minutes for the hot water to come through but comes right away in the morning. TV. is LCD good size. Beds are okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Definately value for money”
Reviews.Author: JudyAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Travelodge, Wentworth Ave. Value for money I think its fantastic and the location was great... Only a short walk to the fantastic bus service or rail service. Handy to everything.... I was extremely happy with the service and thought the rooms were great. Clean tidy and the room service was good..When we got back to New Zealand I phoned the travel agency and told them that the should highly recommend this hotel for value for money..............Was a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “No frills - Good value - Beware of multiple twin beds”
Reviews.Author: DINC-ing
Reviews.Content: If all you need is a place to stay in Sydney, this place should suffice, especially if you're staying for multiple nights, as they seem to give fairly good discounts. My wife and I recently used this hotel to explore Sydney. Nothing about this place "impressed" us, except the price was right, especially in comparison to other comparable hotels. We found a special, including breakfast, for less than 100 per night. As food is not cheap in Australia, this ended up being a really good bargain. Pluses: Price, decent location - near Museum subway stop. Twenty minute walk to Circular Quay. Minuses: Breakfast - same thing every day. It got really old by the third day. I would not pay more than $8/pp extra for this breakfast, especially staying more than two nights. I am not implying you could get the same thing for $8 - no - but we could've picked up a danish or muffin and been just as happy after the second day of eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns and toast. The croissants were good, although a little on the hard side. And then they did offer cereal and milk. There was a coffee machine that offered all your hot beverages for FREE, but none of the beverages were that good. Beds - We found our queen bed to be hard with a low spring count. Beware of non-guaranteed choice of beds. If a larger bed is very important, consider paying an extra few bucks to guarantee your preference. We lucked out with a queen bed, but our traveling partners were given two twin beds and told that since they booked through an outside website, they were not guaranteed the choice and this was all they had left.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveGifford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in May 2010. Booked via hotels.com and got a deal for around Â£45 per night so very good price. Hotel around 10 mins walk to Central station which is what I was after (handy for airport trains) so I tend to stay in this part of Sydney. Room fitted with usual features, TV, fridge, aircon etc, very clean and quiet. Only minor niggles, no doubles where available so had a twin room and the shower was not contained separately (other than a curtain) so bathroom is more like a wet room but no real probs. Overall good and would definitely consider again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: morgansnan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge Wentworth in Sydney for 4 nights towards the end of March. The location is slightly out but there is a free bus which stops on Elizabeth (just one block away), which takes you right down to the ferry terminal. Alternatively you can take the train, the station is just 5 minutes walk away. You can stroll in Hyde Park, which is very pleasant. The hotel was clean, surprisingly quiet and the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was well equipped with a microwave, tea & coffee making facilities, a fridge, iron and ironing board. We booked on the internet on a Tuesday and got free breakfast for one person each day. We were given vouchers for this so ended up with free breakfasts for the 2 of us on 2 days of our stay. Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for reasonably priced accommodation with all the facilities you could want.

Reviews.Title: “No problem with this hotel - but not the most competitive price”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: The room (1518) I stayed in was perfectly fine - although the kitchenette is a piece of furniture with a small microwave and sink installed. The location is very good, very close to the inner CBD and Oxford Street. Probably my only reservation was the price - at $115 per night I have definitely stayed in better places - like the Meriton Apartments - for a similar price. Nevertheless - no grumbles - it is clean and the staff were friendly. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in Sydney city”
Reviews.Author: room_downstairs
Reviews.Content: Myself and family members stayed one night at Travelodge Wentworth Avenue recently - got a bargain rate on the website and so to be honest we weren't expecting much, but it turned out to be good value with all the basics you need. It's a street over from Elizabeth Street too so you don't have to walk far to get on the 555 shuttle around the city. We had a room on level 12, and there's 18 floors in total, so we were fairly high above street level and so noise wasn't an issue; you do hear a bit of noise in the corridors but there wasn't many people on my floor so it wasn't a problem for us (although if the hotel was full I think it would be noisy). What I liked was the fact that it comes with all the basic amenities if you want to make your own meals in the room - microwave, bar fridge, cutlery and crockery etc. If you're travelling on a budget this is so much more convenient than a hotel that simply has a restaurant. A toaster would have been really useful but I guess for fire alarm reasons they've chosen not to. It's clean, the bathroom is a decent size, and you get a desk and sofa which is handy for extra guests or if you've got work to do and want to spread out in the room. The staff are pretty good on the whole, and better than staff in some of the more upmarket hotels I've stayed in! Another great plus is the luggage storage facility - you just leave your bags and collect them when you're ready. It allowed us to go and do a few things and then get our bags when we wanted - no having to collect the bags by a certain time like other places. The only real negative was that the beds are as hard as a rock! I was so tired from all the travelling I'd done that I slept anyway but my family members really did not appreciate the hard beds. More comfortable beds are definitely needed. A couple of other minor complaints - the iron wasn't terribly good; didn't iron the clothes too well and looked like it needed replacing. One final gripe I had was the cost of laundry - $4 to wash, $4 to use the dryer. I thought this was ridiculous and so I didn't bother using the hotel's laundry facilities. Overall I'd recommend this hotel and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good , quite ,affordable base in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: highpointUK
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. The room though quite small had a kitchenette which was useful for making breakfast and snacks. The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. Felt it offered exellent vaule for money.

Reviews.Title: “Value to money”
Reviews.Author: TONY_TravelLover
Reviews.Content: We got the very good rate for staying over 3 nights. The hotel is just two blocks away from Hyde Park , about 10-15 minute walk to Chinatown and about 15-20 minute walk to Sydney Tower. The room is quite small but worth every dollar we paid. Staff are nice just a few are not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Congenial, cooperative staff at reception; room conveniently equipped as bedsit-efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Chelydra
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in transit for an early morning flight. It worked out well. We found both the staff and the facilities of this Travelodge noticeably better than those at the Travelodge, Wynyard (which has the advantage of a more central city location and the attendant convenience to tourist attractions towards Circular Quay). If you intend using public transport extensively for sightseeing, before you leave Sydney airport find out details about the various types and durations of TravelPass. We found the information counter at the end of the arrivals concourse often had a long queue. If you go downstairs where you buy train tickets, you can also obtain information from posters and from the ticket sellers. We found our TravelPass very useful, as it gave us unlimited access to regular trains, buses and ferries which covered everywhere that we wanted to go and saved us money in the process. Note that travelling to and from the airport terminals involved special fares (expensive given the short distances). Museum station and the Liverpool street exit are closest to the hotel; however, be prepared to lug your bags from the train platform to street level up several flights of stairs. There is no lift-elevator or escalators at this end. To walk to the hotel from the station (about 5-10 minutes), cross to the other side of Liverpool Street and walk up it with Hyde Park on your left, turn right at Commonwealth Street and walk down the slope. The hotel will be to your right at the confluence of Commonwealth, Goulburn and Wentworth streets. There is a ramp for wheeling up your bags. All the staff we dealt with at reception were especially pleasant, helpful, cooperative and obliging. If you would like a view, try for a room on floors 16 to 18. Quieter rooms are at the end of the corridor away from the lifts-elevators. Some floors have ice and vending machines, so avoid a room in the vicinity. Our room had a bar refrigerator, microwave oven and basic utensils for having simple meals in the room. (There was a Coles supermarket open till midnight in World Square at the corner of Liverpool and George streets.) Avoid convenience stores if you can; they overcharge â€” as everywhere.) The windows had single glazing, but we were high up so the noise of traffic and sirens did not bother us. The hotel lounge has a cafÃ© (closed when we were there) and, opposite, several computers providing Internet access based on payment for time used. A good place to eat in Chinatown is in an inconspicuous food court at the top-left of Dixon street (lined with restaurants and touts). It has numerous counters with a range of vendors serving various Asian cuisines, freshly cooked at very reasonable prices. You can eat there for several days and always have something quite different. Well worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena-Mary
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 16 night stay here. Booked through the Travelodge site on a Tuesday (Chooseday offer) and paid Aus$112.50 dollars per night bed and breakfast for 2. We had a large corner room on the 16th floor and the view was great. Room clean and comfortable with little kitchen area and large bathroom with lovely hot shower. Breakfasts were really nice and staff all helpful and friendly. Taxi's pull in all the time so airport transfers are no problem and cost around Aus$42. Location is really good just a couple of minutes from Hyde Park. We enjoyed walking to all the sights but Hotel is close to Museum Station, lots of bus routes and Monorail Station. All round excellent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good touristhotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeriLariviere
Reviews.Content: Travelodge is a clean, friendly and comfortable hotel right in the middle of the city! Trains,metro & busses are nearby. Good "value for money" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey18uk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have recently come back from a trip to Australia and spent 5 night at the Travelodge Wentworth Avenue. The location was great, really near Darling Harbour area, where there are great restaurants and shops. The travelodge itself was clean, tidy and we had breakfast included which was great value for money. we had booked the breakfast online when we booked, so no need to pay extra when we got there. The rooms were clean and modern, with a fridge and microwave. The only thing I would say I was missing was the fact there was no minibar or room service available. However, as we were in a city as magnificent as Sydney we were not in the hotel that much and there were so many cafes and bars near by. It was about a 25 minute walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House and 15 minutes to Darling Harbour. They do not have a car park, but are affiliated with a car park about 5 minutes walk away which costs $20 per day. If you are travelling on a budget then this hotel is perfect. Really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for reasonably priced downtown-area Sydney lodging”
Reviews.Author: Socal Flyer
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Sydney on Wentworth (one of three Travelodgeâ€™s in the central business area) is one of the most reasonably-priced central area hotels we found bookable on the internet, which was why we selected it for pre- and post-cruise stays in Sydney. As such it turned out to be a good choice for us, with recently updated interior and smallish but clean, quiet rooms which included microwave and small refrigerator. The hotel apparently caters to tour groups and short-stay tourists like us and the compact lobby area gets crowded at check in / check out time, but the front desk is well-staffed and they move things along nicely. If you arrive before rooms are available (common, as many international flights reach Sydney in the morning hours) they have a free baggage-check room to store your stuff while you explore downtown Sydney. Although they provide all the essentials, this is a fairly low-frills hotel. Internet access is available in the lobby for a charge via coin-operated terminals at $2AU for 20 minutes or Wi-Fi at $11.50AU for a 24 hour period but with a log-on time limit. No exercise facility, pool, etc. There is a dining facility serving full breakfast but closed thereafter. Breakfast may or may not be included and we got it on our first stay but not on the second, which I found confusing particularly since our first stay was at a 20% cheaper special rate, a situation for which no explanation was forthcoming. They do offer discounted breakfast vouchers but only if you purchase at check-in. There are many places to dine in the immediate vicinity; we had a nice dinner at the small & funky McQuarie hotel & pub directly across the street. Dining, BTW, is pricy in Australia, so be prepared. In terms of getting around, the hotel is located just a block outside the central business loop along which you can hop onto any of Sydneyâ€™s excellent bus routes. Particularly useful for exploring the downtown area is the â€œ555 lineâ€�, green buses which are free to ride and continually circle the central business loop in both directions. Also a short walk away is the Museum Railway Station, a stop for the train connecting downtown with the Sydney Airport, and if you are light on bags this is about the cheapest way to get to & from the airport. For the more conventionally bag-loaded tourist the second choice is an airport shuttle, with the most expensive (but most convenient) option being via taxi, which will run about $50AU to/from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely nothing to complain about-great value”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: The location is great, you can walk anywhere. The room was clean, the bed confortable, and the decoration was quite nice. The kitchenette was very useful. There was even tea bags. The staff was very friendly (I had read that this is not always the case). It was quiet. The internet system was great (downstairs in the lobby, you pay with coins).
