I didn't have breakfast at the restaurant so I don't know how that was. Really good value. I paid only 80$ a night so I can't complain. Even if I had paid more, I wouldn't complain. I didn't expect that much for such a low price. Lots of restaurants near by and the big IGA supermarket at the corner of Wentworth and Oxford is very useful. I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good base in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Yoga_Jade
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and we found it a perfect place to explore Sydney. Hotel is central, clean and rooms are spacious and comfortable. We had dinner in the hotel's restaurant two times and it was very nice and staff were friendly. We also found it to be very good value for money and we thought international phone calls were particularly inexpensive for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable option”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in March 2010. I paid $105 US per night. I have stayed here a number of times before and it remains a favourite place for me when Iâ€™m in Sydney. Itâ€™s clean, bright and the rooms are comfortable with a useful kitchenette area and all Fox Sports channels. There are also laundry facilities on some of the floors. Staff at reception are nearly always friendly and efficient. Breakfast and internet seem expensive, but there are plenty of cheap options in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, good value but rude staff member”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl0_2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week. I decided to book the Travelodge as you know what you are getting and I was right - the room was clean, I had a perfect nights sleep, the hotel is very near to Museum train stop and Hyde Park so very central, and the rooms even had microwaves in them and crockery so if you needed to you could heat up your own food. The only downside for me which is why I have service a three was the man who served me - not sure if he was the duty manager was quite abrupt when I checked in and I was quite tired and just wanted to get to my room and felt a little bit unwelcomed. But other than that - don't let that put you off as this is a very reasonably priced hotel - paid $109 for the room and if I had been with my husband it would have been a bargain! There's a great pasta shop down the road where I bought my dinner rather than going out and heated it up in the microwave - perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel, but watch the small print”
Reviews.Author: monty339
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Sydney was good value for money, clean and handy to everything. However even though we had requested (and prepaid for) a Queen size bed room, on arrival the room had 3 x single beds. When we queried this we were told that " because we had booked over the net there was no guarantee of requested requirements". It is in the small print. Suspect that because we had a special price ($131.00 per night) and the hotel was full, they were able to get a better rate for the Queen size room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location.”
Reviews.Author: PINELights
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here we were a bit aprehensive since we had already booked. We were pleasantly surprised. No thrills, but a comfy room and a good location if you are in Sydney for a few drinks and some sightseeing. Walking distance to nightlife and CBD. Will consider this hotel again for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanmorrison
Reviews.Content: We booked online and were pleased with their charge of $99 per night for the two of us in a queen bed. it is a very basic hotel but we were happy there and would go back again in a jiff. They also offer a wonderful smorgasbord breakfast for $15 per head but we got one breakfast thrown in for free each day when we booked so we only needed to buy breakfast for one which made it extremely cheap. We had a huge room, #407 which looked out over a busy intersection so there was always something to see. Other rooms would have had views of the concrete walls of the buildings opposite. The layout of our floor was on the back of the door and we could see that room #407 was bigger than all the other rooms on our floor. If the layout of the building is the same on each floor then ideally rooms #507, #607, #707 etc would all have the interesting view. There were 18 floors. The hotel was in a very good location quite near Hyde Park and the Museum subway station. Have a look at their pricing on their website but their prices seem to change almost on a daily basis. They have a Cheap Tuesday special for those that book on Tuesdays which is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GinaLisy
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, close to museum station, internet access, good sized rooms, friendly staff, security

Reviews.Title: “Beware no internet in most rooms and beds are thinny”
Reviews.Author: umanitek
Reviews.Content: World traveler, working for an airline, and i have been to hundreds of hotels in 42 countries.. This average looking 3 star hotel is perfectly located just south of Hyde Park, is very clean and the staff very proffessional and helpfull, all rooms are similar, and have kitchenttes wt thinny fridge, sink and microwave. Bathhrooms are quite smaller then usual. The bed are less then 3 feet wide and 6 feet long. So as small as the smallest beds in Europe. U can ask for 1 queen size bed in advance, but their is no garantee your will get it. The biggest complaint i have is that MOST ROOMS DO NOT HAVE INTERNET ACCESS. And those who do have it cost $40aus more plus the internet fee witch is $22 a day. The rooms are also not better in any other way.Yet the hotel web site says their is internet. So beware. I would not recommend this hotel unless you dont care about bed size or internet acces. Otherwise its a nice run of the mill 3 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: cmbal
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality of the rooms and unbeatable location. Internet connection only in executive rooms. The kitchenette is very useful!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great value”
Reviews.Author: D0cBr0wn
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on the Travelodge website, book 3 or more nights for only $115 a night. Considering the quality of the room and the hotel location, this is sensational value. The queen bed was very comfortable, clean and shiny bathroom, LCD TV with a few Foxtel channels was excellent. Added bonus was the bar fridge (without the hinderance of minibar items), a microwave with crockery and utensils, and a table with two chairs. Quite roomy even though it appeared I had one of the smallest rooms (located in the NE corner). Staff at reception were very pleasant and helpful. Both check-in and check-out were very speedy. Really nothing negative to say at all. Will be staying here again at the end of March. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a bargain. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: monkey_zulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 6 nights in mid February 2010. Requested a queen size bed when made booking online, and we got exactly that upon check-in. We arrived at 8AM, were told we had to wait until 2PM to check in, but were able to leave our luggage in their safe room. We tried our luck coming back at 1, and surprise, our room was ready. We got room 914. It was nice and spacious enough for two, with a sofa bed added as a bonus! The only pet peeve is the shower head which kept tumbling down if the water pressure is not enough. But apart from that, everything is nice, especially considering the AUD115 per night deal we got. (Sydney is an expensive city!) The reception staff was helpful enough, and the housekeeping staff did a good job cleaning our room every day. Not to mention showing professionalism and class too, that is when my wife realized she had left her BlackBerry in the room a few hours after we had checked out, when we came back, they delivered it back to us at the lobby. Happy as Larry!

Reviews.Title: “Good value tourism industry”
Reviews.Author: FiftyNiner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located centrally close to the CBD and Chinatown in Sydney, close to the Sydney central Railway station, and Hyde Park. I stayed there in november 2009. My overall impression of the hotel is favorable, I liked it. But there were some negative points. Everything is modern, spacious and absolutely spotlessly clean. The staff are helpful and friendly. But the place is so sterile and impersonal, and the staff attitude, even if they are friendly and helpful, also feels impersonal. This is efficient tourism industry at its height. But, due to the price and and for all its other positive points, it is really quite possible to live with this. It is just so irritating that there is so little they need to do to make it feel less clinical and this isn't done. But, that said, it is an excellent place to stay. The room was fresh and spacious, and has absolutely everything you need, large bathroom with a good shower and lots of towels. Small well equipped kitchenette with fridge, microwave, kettle, and dishes, cups and cutlery. And a nice table, dining table height. So perfect for getting your own breakfast, that you'd really have wanted a toaster, but there wasn't one. It's almost like a mini apartment, nice to relax in after a day of sightseeing. And it just a little bit off the traffic so it is relatively quiet. There were guest laundries on some of the floors. Very convenient. The downside was that there was no way to book the laundry, and many people wanted to use them, so you had to waste time waiting to use it and checking from time to time. There is a breakfast restaurant, that has all the feeling of a school or staff canteen, it even makes the same noise. And the breakfast is rather expensive. It comes cheaper if you by breakfast vouchers for your whole stay when you check in. However, it is a good cooked breakfast, although at an industrial scale, with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, juice, coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “No Faults At All For Travelodge Sydney”
Reviews.Author: travellingdeane
Reviews.Content: After backpacking and staying in hostels I decided to spend my last six days in the Australia at a hotel and chose the Travelodge. The hotel is in a good location (close to Hyde Park and 15min walk to Opera House) and close to the station I was coming in from. The women who checked me in was friendly and helped me book the airport shuffle on my departure date. The room was nice with a double bed all for myself and had enough space for me and my bags, and the bathroom had a walk in shower too! I will definitely stay here again when I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay for a week”
Reviews.Author: jeve4
Reviews.Content: Very positive surprised about the standard of this hotel. Though many backpackers, it was in no way a "backpacker low profile" hotel Very comfortable with kitchinette which is ideal for a longer stay in Sydney. Also service was excellent. A place to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Jellybeanz33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sydney for 3 days during New Years Eve, and chose this hotel as had stayed there previously 5 years ago and knew it had a good location and was a reasonable price. Its a modern Travelodge, and although not your 5 star hotel its very comfortable, rooms are large and clean and is in a good spot. I was also pleased to see that the room have a kitchette bit with a kettle, fridge, sink etc which came in very handy. Its in a quieter location so you don't hear the noisy traffic and would definately recommend it as a good base to friends. Would def stay in there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Well Located....”
Reviews.Author: Austin-Powers63
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms on a 2 night liesure trip to Sydney and had no complaints about our choice of Travelodge Sydney. When booking accomodation we always ask ourselves what are we going for? and how long are we likely to stay in the hotel?. On this occassion we had all day/evening activities planned and were looking for a comfortable bed in a well located hotel that represented value with a large booking. We are not tight budget travellers by any means and stay in hotels of varying standards depending on commonsense needs. Travelodge Sydney ticked all the boxes and we were more than happy with our choice The rooms were a good standard size, very clean and no one in our party had any complaint about the comfort of the beds. The aircon system was a little noisy/rattly in our room but otherwise worked well making the room pleasantly comfortable despite the extreme heat outside on this visit. (We sorted it by adjusting the fan speed) Sound insulation was no problem and the only noise during the night was from the usual rowdy guests in the hallways returning from a night out. This is a "hotel hazard" no matter where you stay and was accepted. The curtains do a great job of blocking out the light and helped add to a good night's sleep. Bathroom was fine. Yes, as mentioned by others, the shower is more like a slightly recessed area set into the floor and if you are big on water volume then the bathroom floor does become wet. On the flipside, I guess this arrangement is designed to assist guests with limited mobility to get into the shower. Hot water was no issue on the 11th floor during this visit. The room has a microwave and small fridge. Drinks and snacks etc are obtained from vending machines in the hallway. For our way of thinking, a far better option than an expensive mini bar rip off. The front desk service was excellent for us. Speedy and friendly check in and out. Breakfast was included in our rate (which was a great price for a Sydney hotel). Quality of the food and service in the dining room was very good. Overnight car parking was no great inconvenience as it was only a short block away. There is ample hassle-free kerbside parking in the street alongside the front of the hotel which is appreciated when dropping off/loading luggage etc. The hotel is very well located. A short walk to to the inner city features and a short stroll from Museum Rail Station. Importantly for us, it was an easy walk to Central to catch buses to the SCG To sum up. Typical Travelodge. Doesn't pretend to be 4 or 5 Star and doesn't charge like some hotels in Sydney who pretend they are of a higher standard. If you are a really discerning and demanding traveller who expects the very best then simply don't stay here. It's not what you're after. If you are looking for decent, comfortable and good value accomodation then Travelodge Sydney is recomended. As with all reviews, it's all subjective and based on our experience with the hotel matched to our expectations.Will we stay again.... Absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Sydney and stayed at the Travelodge and was very pleased with my stay. I was given a corner room which was very quiet and comfortable. The room was very clean, the A/C worked well and the twin beds were very comfortable. The only problem was the beds had rollers and were not secured to the walls and would move slightly during sleeping. No big deal though. The bathroom was clean had plenty of hot water (shower only -no tub) The maid service was so quick -no sooner would I leave and the room was done by the time I would return from a quick bite for breakfast. The location is great -Just steps from chinatown and the CBD. The hotel breakfast was just so-so and I would not recommend it. All in all I would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Decobroad
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is in a great position: just a couple of minutes walk to Hyde Park and Museum Station. I booked on a Tuesday Chooseday so got a good deal ($99) and had no problem checking in; though they forgot to give me my free book (I got it the next day). The room was small but not tiny and more than adequate for my requirements. The decor is modern hotel and seems quite fresh. I liked the touch of the soft orange suede pillows in the light coffee coloured room which was equipped with a new tv, a microwave, small sink, small fridge and a hot water jug. There's no mini-bar, but vending machines on each floor and microwave meals available from reception. No room service, but you can order in from local restaurants and charge it to your room. The bathroom was shower only, clean and well configured. I am a light sleeper and slept reasonably well. I was undisturbed by noise from other rooms but it could have been a quiet night. I received a free breakfast with my Tuesday booking and it was very good. There was a wide range of food (good bacon!) and the dining room was pleasant with tables being cleared on a regular basis. I was pleased by the feel of this hotel and enjoyed the pared back services. It would enable a traveller with the money to afford a good room in Sydney but not the money to enjoy the high life, to stay in a good spot. I will definitely be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: jamlou
Reviews.Content: We made a bad decisison to stay at this travelodge! Granted the location is good for the price, its everything else the hotel ffers which is shocking!!!! The stay are very rude and unhelpful, the air-con is poor at best, for a reason unknown to anyone at the hotel the kitchen was always closed meaning if you wanted a meal you would have to go else where. the hotel bar was also never open, we stayed for 1 week which proved to be not as cheap as first thought, as if you require internet excess (which we did) it cost $100 dollars for a week!!! Very exspensive if you ask me! My advise is stay at the "vibe hotel" around the corner they have a pool/spa/gym and the hotel kitchen serves excellent food at a very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: MooeyWirral
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what Travelodge is all about. Clean, relatively comfortable place to lay your head- and no more really. But then you don't really need any more than that when you are staying in Sydney for a few days do you? The reception staff could probably be replaced by robots, the atmosphere was cold and unfriendly, but the rooms were spacious, clean modern and fairly comfy. The location is pretty good. You can walk to Darling Harbour in 10 minutes and to Circular Quay and the Rocks will take you 30 minutes. It's close to Hyde Park so that is a pleasant detour for your walk to Circular Quay. Chinatown is close by for places to eat. We hadn't booked direct with Travelodge and booked through another website, so when we checked in they said they couldn't give us a double room as our boooking was only a 'request' rather than a reservation. We had to take a twin room. This happened to us twice as we stayed in this hotel on 2 occasions throughout December. However, as soon as a double came free they did switch us- so it wasn't a big deal really. Enjoyed the space as it happened!! Although we didn;t have a bad experience here particularly, I wouldn't exactly recommend this hotel, as I bet there are loads just like it in Sydney that might be a bit nicer that you could take a chance on.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: OS9999
Reviews.Content: (+) Good location. 3mins to Museum sta. 10mins to Townhall sta. Room is big enough to me. Price is quite cheap. Room itself is fine ( not so fabulous but much better than I imagined from room price). (-) No internet access in my room (it may be up to room. Cheapest room doesn't have wireless and wired internet access) . 3 charged PC available (actually there are 4. but 1 was out of order when I was there) . But there seems to be hot-spot within 5 mins outside. Bath room suits the cheap room price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and functional for the price”
Reviews.Author: 888travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights just before Xmas with our 5 year old daughter. We had flown in on an overnight flight (like most flights) but had to wait about 3 hours until 11.30am to check in. We sat in Hyde Park for a while which was nice. We were lucky to be 'upgraded' to a triple room - we had booked twin beds and a sofa bed but ended up in a triple which was great as we only paid Â£41 per night (no breakfast). Room was basic but ok. Beds were on castors so had a habit of moving when you sat down on them. Bathroom was essentially a wet area with no separate shower cubicle and even though there was a curtain, the floor continually flooded. Handy kitchenette for reheating food and making drinks. Ice cube machine and laundry was on our floor. Tips: Sydney is very expensive for food - the City Convenience shops are extortionately priced. 7-11 is not cheap either. We shopped for food basics at Woolworths supermarket - downstairs at Town Hall station and Coles supermarket (World Square). We got takeaway pasta from a shop on the corner of Elizabeth Street/Hyde Park - that was handy as we could eat in the room and microwave the leftovers! There is a free bus (the 555 I think) which goes in a circular route down to Circular Quay. The nearest stop is on Elizabeth St at the front of the old Mark Foy dept. store. Again, can recommend this if you are travelling with young children. Another tip - if you are in Sydney on a Sunday, there is a Family Funday Travel Ticket for A$2.50 per person for families travelling on buses/trains/ferries. This is great value. All in all, hotel was no frills but ok. You don't go to Sydney to sit in hotel rooms anyway - location is a little out of the way but good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: della123
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our hotel room - it was very clean and modern surroundings. The room maids were excellent and washed our pots, even though this was not expected. The staff were curteous and well informed. The location is excellent, slightly away from the hustle and bustle but within easy reach to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: alexwookw
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights for AUD 105 altogether. It was very cheap to me, as the rates are even cheaper than Sydney backpackers!!! Friendly receptionist although it was real busy during the check in/out time in Travelodge. The room is real nice and given that I paid such little amount, I have no complaint about the space. Overall, the hotel is real good value and would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cofmy, Clean, No Frills Hotel for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Paulavetta
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Travelodge Sydney for 5 nights and had an excellent time. The check-in process was hassle-free and the staff even let us check in early. Our room was decorated simply but had a very relaxed and functional feel. The linens were clean and the room was spacious with a writing desk by the wall. The property is extremely well maintained. One day we even saw the window cleaner outside of our room (on the 12th floor) scraping away grime and dirt. Since we declined breakfast ($18 AUD per day for a full buffet) we utilized our kitchenette a lot. The kitchenette contained bowls, plates, silverware, microwave, refrigerator and practically everything else you would need for a meal. The only thing that bugged me was that the room only came with 1 face towel even though there were 2 guests. Every morning we had to call for an additional face towel however that was only a small inconvenience as the staff were extremely prompt and helpful. The hotel is located in the beautiful Hyde Park area of Sydney. Walking at night was not a problem. Although there were not many sights to see in that neighborhood it was only a short walk in either direction to almost any attraction. I highly recommend the Travelodge Sydney for budget travelers who want a comfortable and clean place to stay and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent clean hotel, little to complain about”
Reviews.Author: MrMatthew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neither something to rave about, nor has anything major to complain about. The staff are generally capable, and not too rude (which is a little above average for Sydney). The rooms are simply furnished, not too small and quite clean. The bathroom was clean. Given that I paid $154 for 3 night on wotif.com, this was excellent value for this location in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaosc
Reviews.Content: Overall a good modern and renovated city hotel which meets the city hotel standards based on the price they asked for. However, the so called valet carpark is just a random carpark nearby for $20/night. We walked over 1 street to the other side of the building and see the big sign saying $10/day all day parking. Anyway we decided not bother with car since it's right in the middle of city. Our room had 2 beds and a sofabed with small sink and microwave like an extra. No views of course with all those surrounding buildings. We had problem with the air-con in the room, apparently it was known to be not working properly but they never warn us until we questioned them, took 2 days for the service man to come and looked at it. Tissue roll wasn't changed that was a bit disappointing. Overall an average but great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the T-lodge”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Gaffer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now, great location, top value for money, great rooms, comfortable & clean, what more could you want! Highly recommended..

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern and excellent service, would come back again”
Reviews.Author: moudles24
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner found the stay at this hotel very enjoyable and especially for what we paid, the hotel was of an excellent standard, the room was very clean, modern amd the staff were very friendly especially Kisa who works in the day, her manner was very pleasant and she was always happy to help. We would recommend having the breakfast as we found their was a good choice of food, quality was good and very good value. Me and my partner wil be coming back to sydney next year and will definatley be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience of my life, so far!”
Reviews.Author: Celster1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and it's clean. The best part is the kitchenette available with plates, cups and utensiles so you can go to Coles (the supermarket) and buy a few things to put in the fridge and some frozen food you can microwave. It is walking distance to all main attraction and 2 blocks from the main street (Elizabeth) where you can take the free bus to Circular Quay as well as other buses like the 380 or 333 to Bondi Beach. The hotel is also close walking distance to Paddy's market where you can buy lots of gifts for a margin of the price you'll find anywhere else from there walk towards Darling Harbor which is beautiful during the day and at night. Two places I recommend there are the Chinese Garden of Friendship ($6) to get in it's beautiful and calming - beware of the wondering lizard (so harmless - just don't step on them) also stay and have tea and lunch (I recommend the snack sampler) about $12. I also recommend the wildlife park but you have to go early 9am and go straight to the Koala center because at 9:30am you can start taking pictures with the Koalas $20 for 1 and $10 for each additional (if you plan on going to Featherdale Park you can take pictures for free). Ok, back to the hotel. The negatives: The breakfast buffet is $18 which I find expensive since I don't eat much but in their defense it's the average price around Sydney and the staff is a bit unfriendly. When you approach them they have that 'oh what now?' look. I spent very little time at the hotel so my only concern was seeing as much as possible while in Sydney. If you require advise feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel dont miss out!!”
Reviews.Author: red0ne77
Reviews.Content: In have stayed in many hotels in Sydney and other worldwide cities but this Travelodge is simply one of the best. In terms of value for money location and amenities it simply cant be beaten. I booked via Expedia and paid hostel prices for 4 star hotel luxuries. If you are planning a trip to Sydney, do not miss out on this excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: supermumotagoNZ
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 18th floor which was plenty big enough and after a full day of shopping and site seeing it was nice to return to find clean towels and a tidy room. The reception staff were FANTASTIC and nothing was a problem no mater what time of the day even when we would return very late from dinner and were needing fresh towels for the morning. One lady at reception by the name of Rachel even went to the trouble of looking up on websites and writing down which train and bus number (even the times they left ) that we needed to catch, to get to the DFO so we could do some serious retail therapy. (Great place by the way) The hotel is a 3 min walk to the Museum train station and Hyde Park and a 10 min walk to Darling Harbour and China Town. We would soooooooo stay at this hotel again because it is so close to everything and most of all the fantastic service we received.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldCityGlobeTrtr
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to the Central Station. Room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and”
Reviews.Author: andycali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Travelodge for 3 nights and were really satisfied with the accommodation. The rooms were clean and appeared to have been recently renovated with Flat screen TVs. The staff at the lobby were friendly and very resourceful with any questions we had about Sydney. A wide variety of travelers from all over the world were staying at this hotel including backpackers, young couples, families and older couples. Location wise, this hotel is a few blocks away from Museum station which is connected via rail to the airport and other central locations in Sydney. It is also well connected to buses that run to most of the sightseeing spots in the city. The hotel also organized a shuttle service back to the airport for us which was more economical than taking the train.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: dieselfish43
Reviews.Content: i traveled with a friend and on arrival was given a double room, this was immediately changed to a twin by understanding staff.The rooms where clean and tidy and serviced every day, the staff where extremely helpfull and the breakfast was reasonably priced with choices to please almost everyone The hotel is very close to Museum station and only 10 minutes walk to Central station, all things considered very good value for money, i would recommend it to travellers looking for good value in Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinEssex
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge was 'OK', in every sense. Room small but ok, service ok, location ok. Nothing special and fair enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: Angie_Paul
Reviews.Content: Trailfinders booked this hotel for us, and to be honest id'd probably shop around abit if we had to go back to Sydney. The hotel was quite basic, the staff member who booked us in was not overly friendly, we had to ask about.... booking breakfast ( having read a special offer board on the check in desk), about where we were in Sydney and could we have a map, what room number we were in, what time we could check in, if we could leave our bags.... looking back i can't belive i didn't say anything! Ive never been to a hotel where i had to drag the answers out of the desk staff! On arriving at 11 our room wasn't ready so we left our bags and went back an hour later where another staff member dealt with us and she immediatley gave us our room keys. (she was much friendlier!!) The room was ok, it was very spacious, had a microwave and a fridge! It was certainly clean but just a little tired, same with the bathroom. Breakfast? Very over rated! We paid for it on booking in as this gave us $6 off each, which was good as i wouldnt have paid full price for it! They did have hot items but the only decent thing on offer was the coffee... which was fab! (we found out a day or two in theres a great place 20m's away where you can have a fresh hot breakfast for the same price! Doh!!) The location is ok, quite near a tube station, takes a while to get orientated, but its a bit of a slog if you wanted to walk to the harbour, which is ok if the weathers mild! We paid $336 for 4 nights, not sure if this is good value or not, but hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Anguslass
Reviews.Content: I thought that this hotel was great. It was very reasonably priced. It was central - within easy walking distance of the main train station and everything else. Staff were very helpful when it came to booking in and out, and the airport shuttle bus. Room had a kitchen area, including microwave, sink, fridge, dishes etc, and was close enough to a local supermarket to take advantage of these. Although the little corner shop across the road is extortionate, so avoid it at all costs. Would love to go back again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mel-Kiwi_NZ
Reviews.Content: Booked through expedia.com, so got a super cheap rate for this room. Got a nice corner room quite high up in the hotel. Because of the arrangement of our room (quite a long corridor from the door to the bedroom), we never heard anything that was happening in the hallway. The bathroom was comfortably sized, and although the bed was only a double, not a queen as we had requested, it was still really very comfortable! Nothing fancy, but really, you're only in it to sleep and change most of the time anyyway! Location wise, it was great, only a couple of minutes walk to Museum station, less than 10 minutes from Central and only 20 minutes walk to Circular Quay. Its location near Museum Station made it easy to get the train to and from the airport. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Palmc
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Sydney early morning and had to wait till lunch time to get into room which was fair enough. Hotel very busy with people coming and going all the time. Rooms very comfortable - microwave and fridge in room. Washing machine and dryer on landing. We had the buffet breakfast every day. My husband's only complaint would be that they only served scrambled eggs (not fried, poached) and after five days he was rather sick of scrambled eggs. But hotel couldn't be faulted and receptionists all very helpful. About a mile to walk to the harbour but only minutes from China Town and not much further to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Okavango
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and very well located close to the city center. The hotel was renovated recently. The internet rate was very good. I would go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: J2J1P
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. After reading all of the other reviews, we decided to try this place out and we are glad that we did. The staff was very helpful and we did not have any issues at all with the room. Our request for a specific room was granted and they were very nice about giving us our room a little early. After flying from the US, being able to go to our room right away was a very nice and unexpected touch. The room was very clean and the towels were changed every day. Our only issue was with the shower, the water wasn't always consistent. Several times we had to get out of the flow because it would change to really hot or really cold for a minute or so. Other than that we didn't have any issues. The kitchenette was a nice touch too. We were able to save a lot of money by keeping leftovers and buying some snacks at the stores in town. The hotel is also in a nice location, easy walk from the Museum station. When you arrive, book the shuttle service back to the airport, it is cheaper than paying the station fee from the subway and it is nice to have door to door service. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok option for a low budget in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: loubob07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in July. We were happy with the location, although you were about 10 minutes from most things...but you were close enough to see the sights. Our room was recently refurbished, and just felt like a normal, budget hotel. It was relatively clean, the bathroom was small but functional & there was a kettle and microwave. We didn't really have any problems or major complaints during our stay there.....for the price we paid, it was by far the best option in Sydney. Staff were ok, some more helpful than others, and we found the breakfast to be overpriced - so eat elsewhere!! If we returned to Sydney, we would most probably like to stay near the harbour, but if you're on a tight budget this is a good option, just so long as you don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - good price”
Reviews.Author: kuyajojo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. From here you can walk to many attractions within Sydney like Darling harbor, Pitt St. for shopping, St. Mary's cathedral. I initially requested for a queen bed, but they ran out and gave me a room with two twin beds. The room was clean and has enough space for my luggage. While I waited for my friend to pick me up the next day, I was able to leave my luggages at the hotel while I walked around and explore the city. There are few restaurants and a convenient store across the street from the hotel. If you are on a budget and want a comfortable yet clean room, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Russ1470
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated two minutes walk from Hyde park which leads you straight to the Opera House and harbour area. The rooms are large with a small kitchen area consisting of a microwave fridge and kettle. The hotel is in the Surrey Hills district which is great for eating out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's Best Bargain”
Reviews.Author: 99dadeo
Reviews.Content: Sydney is an expensive city to visit -- except for the travelodge. The front desk was friendly. The rooms were very clean and quiet. They were properly cleaned each day. The amenities were of a high calibre. The hotel is located close to major attractions, the subway was easily accessible. What a great place at a great price. You cannot find better for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place with wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: AnuGK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Trvaleodge for 4 days during out Sydney trip. I would say I am totally satisfied. We stayed in Queensize bed room with our 3 year kid. Cab driver charged us $52 from Airport to Hotel. Better is book Airport shuttle for to and for which is $12 or $13 per head. They are very punctual and on time. This shuttle might take 40-50 minutes to reach Airport from hotel. Things I liked about the place : -> Its neat and tidy , room is little small but ok. -> People at reception are very polite, helpful and knowledgeable about the tourist places to visit. -> Has Iron, Coffee maker, sugar , teat and coffee, Microwave and Refrigerator with Milk supply. If you finish the milk house keeping will replenish it!! -> Neat and tidy restroom with shower, if kid is not used to shower bath ask for some big vessel/mug at reception. -> Bed was soft and neat and the room has good view. We stayed at 16th floor. -> A small table is provided at corner which proved helpful during dining at room -> Kitchenette has cutlery required for 3 people with forks, knife, spoons , plates, bowls, mugs etc. -> Bathroom soap, shampoo, plenty of towels were provided. -> We booked through booking.com and took the deal with breakfast. The best price for this hotel on Booking.com was just -4 days of our stay. Hence I cancelled the booking and rebooked through booking.com -> Breakfast was good like any other European hotels ( excluding fresh fruits) which include scrambled eggs, becan, spaghetti , potato gems, three types of bread, all kinds of jams, butter, apple juice, Orange juice, yogurt, 3 types of cereals , croissant, pastry and tinned fruits. -> Nearest station is Musuem station 7 min. walk Our 3 day stay in Sydney : 1) First day we used Sydney explorer bus and saw Chinese garden, Opera house, Botanical garden 2) Second day spent half day at Manly beach went by ferry evening during sunset crossed Harbor bridge 3) At darling harbor saw Australian wild life and spiral fountain Since we went with kid I took electrical Rice cooker to cook rice for him. India and Australia has same voltage power. Hence we needed only adapter to convert Indian shape plug to Australian shape plug. Overall a good comfortable stay at Travelodge

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Rawiri
Reviews.Content: Check the internet before travel, cleaner rooms with actual self catering facilities ARE available for same rate.

Reviews.Title: “It's a travelodge - it does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: shibbly
Reviews.Content: Exactly what youâ€™d expect. Clean, comfortable and cheap. About 45 mins from Opera House but still quite central and it is near the Museum train station. It's quite new and well equipped. One bad thing was that the wireless was ridiculously expensive, but otherwise highly recommend as a base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but is a bit out of the way from the main tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Jcp744
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel off a flight from Perth,WA First impressions: spacious but busy, appeared to be a popular hotel for people going nighclubbing. The rooms were spacious and clean, good choice of tv channels, but apart from that noth much to say, no pool/gym facilities. A good but basic hotel to explore Sydney from

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: travellingbrit99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a brilliant location, close enough to access the cities main attractions on foot, but just far enough away to be quiet! The hotel is beautifully presented, has obviously been re-furbished recently and done to a high standard. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they had all the answers to our questions and always had a smile on their faces! There is a restaurant just around the corner, which is advertised in the hotel, where you can get good food and drink in nice surroundings. Can't fault this hotel at all, and the city of Sydney is amazing, overall an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: Shan3106
Reviews.Content: I was very unhappy with the service at this hotel. The accommodation was fine enough as I wasn't expecting too much because of the cost of the room. However, the bedding was dirty and covered with hair. In addition I was charged $24 AUD for a phone call that I was told would cost me 80 cents. I had actually called the front desk, provided them with the number I was planning on calling and they then confirmed that it would only cost the 80 cents. When I went to check out I was told of the outrageous price and that I must have been re-directed to another number and that's why I was charged. They would not do a thing for me. They told me the number that was dialed, which I didn't call and they still made me pay for it. They had already taken a $50 deposit from me when I checked in so there was nothing I could do other than pay the $24 bill that I did not create. I was brushed off as just another customer and was very dissapointed as to how they handled the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Little_Lebowski
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for a week, and were very happy with the hotel. We were going to stay in a backpackers hostel just out of the city, but then found this hotel on offer, which worked out near enough the same price! No other could come close to matching the price. The location is very good, close to the Museum station, so getting around is not a problem. The area itself is nice enough, near Hyde Park and within walking distance to the city centre and other attractions. The room was clean and spacious, the bed comfy. Good sized bathroom, although the design of the shower means you get most of the floor wet! The staff were extremely friendly, happy to answer any queries and doing their best to assist you in any way (such as trying, unsuccesfully, to track down a tin opener for me!). Free breakfast ($12/day) and/or wi-fi would have been nice, but for the price I can't really complain. All-in-all, a very pleasurable stay, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended to you all”
Reviews.Author: EnderbyIslandRabbits
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 4 nights on the 17th floor and found Travelodge tops!! The bathroom had towels, floor mat and face cloths. We also had a large shower with a retractable clothes line!! Hair dryer, iron and board along with coat hangers came in handy. Plenty of mirrors was great. We always came back to a lovely clean room and towels changed if we so wanted. The air con was awesome!! Loved how the lights above the bed were able to be turned down. The small kitchen was ideal but you need to bring a sharp knife along if your needing one. Rest rooms are available next to the front desk!! Its very easy few minutes walk to the buses and train station (Museum) (The airport train goes to this stop!!). Darling habour, city center and Circular quarry are easy walking distances away. I highly recommend you take the train or bus to Bondi Junction for shopping, inside and outside of westfield mall!! Supermarkets (coles) are around, just look down walkways!! We felt very safe walking around at ALL times. Internet cafes are also very close by if your not wanting to use the computers on site. $17 per adult got you a day pass on buses, trains and ferries but not the monorail as thats owned privately. If your wanting a nice place to stay, central to everything, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “nice budget hotel,excellent front desk staff, and very busy”
Reviews.Author: travelpro5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights so got a 5 night special deal. It was a lot cheaper than anywhere else we looked at. Good clean basic hotel with the added benefit of a kitchenette facility. Walkable distance from city centre. Only thing we didnt get was the requested at time of booking double room instead they only had a twin. Very busy hotel, and supermarket was only three blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: SterreS
Reviews.Content: Location is good, room is okay and clean, bed is fine. Bathroom is fair enough. It was only cold in the room and the heater did not work properly. There is a weird ventilation system (windows can not be opened) that makes some noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: dhendrick
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent tried to steer us into some fancier places but they were priced way beyond our budget. This hotel is at the south end of Hyde Park, close enough to downtown for walking to the main attractions. I'd recommend it as an affordable base for exploring Sydney. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value option”
Reviews.Author: Auld_Hippo
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Sydney does everything right for a budget hotel..... All the basics are covered and more: - Spacious rooms with decent size bed, sofa and kitchenette - Cleaned daily and toiletries provided - Great location for sights and transport - Friendly service - Good vending machines and self-service laundry Only thing wrong was the internet access..... Extremely expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected- with a few bugs”
Reviews.Author: heatheribabble
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Sydney is in a very convenient location, it is only a few blocks from Museum Train station and numerous bus stops. I would recommend this hotel for people that realize theyâ€™re not staying in a fabulous 5star quality hotel- theyâ€™re staying at a relatively inexpensive (for Sydney) hotel that nicely provides a (very) small kitchenette, a pull-out sofabed, and a coffee table. They even provide a small container of milk in your fridge! I'm not sure what happened with other reviewers, but the room we stayed in was a standard queen and we not only had towels (that were replaced every day if you put them on the floor) but also a hand towel (but no washcloths) was in the bathroom as well as a bathmat towel. The bathmat towel came in handy because, as others have said, the shower doesn't have a splash guard at the bottom, but folding that towel in half saved the floor from getting too wet. Like I said, these (as well as the shampoo/cond & soap) were all replaced whenever we needed them to be, without us even asking. Oh, they also provide tissues and handy little plastic sanitary bags. As for the laundry, well, I didn't have any problems with it. The washer/dryer were located on 3 floors, and they required A$8 to do 1 load of laundry. Washer= A$2 coins x2, and dryer= A$2 coins x2 for a total of A$8. Laundry detergent is available as well for $2coin, and 1 pack is enough for 2 loads. If you don't have change you can get it from the reception/desk, they're very nice and always willing to give the necessary change. I thought at first that $8 was expensive for laundry, and while it is for where I live in the USA, it isn't actually expensive for Sydney. We checked out some laundromats on our journey around Sydney and they were all at least $8, so it was the same price as the hotel + we didn't have to go through the hassle of carrying it to the laundromat and wasting a day there, we just did it at night or early morning in the hotel. There were some negatives- the kitchen sink water smelled horrible, the hot water in the shower tended to surge, there were tiny fruit-fly-like bugs that came out of the shower, there isnâ€™t a balcony and the windows donâ€™t open so you cannot have fresh air unless you go outside, and the bed was a little too firm for my liking (on nights when I could not stand the bed, I slept on the sofa part of the sofa-bed (I didn't unfold it to sleep) which was very comfy if you don't mind your feet being curled up or sticking over the edge). All that being said, I would go back to this hotel. I stayed for 26 nights, and the tiny incidents I mentioned above were made up for with the cleanliness (the cleaners were amazing fast & thorough, they even washed my dishes and dusted! If I didn't want housekeeping that day but required toilet paper, I just left a note on the door and requested them to leave TP, and they did. Very nice people.), hospitality (they immediately replaced a glass I broke & didnâ€™t charge me for it), safety (swipe card required for floor access), and location of this hotel. Tips: Buy a TravelPass for the length of your stay (1day, 3, or weekly) and then use it to take a train to the store (many stores are found at bigger train stations, ie Town Hall, Wynard, etc) to buy groceries, its MUCH cheaper than the convenience store. Also, make sure you go to Manly, they have the absolute BEST ice cream place called Royale Copenhagan. It's slightly expensive ($6) but you get a lot of ice cream + free self-serve toppings and it was so amazing we went 4x in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Different.”
Reviews.Author: trafdlo
Reviews.Content: Other reviews reflect the character of this hotel. Its popular as a starting point with the itinerant backpacker crowd. Lots of young single people milling around all of the time. One very odd thing about this facility, towels are the only bath option supplied: no face cloth, hand towels or other items that are standard in other hotels we have stayed in around the world. The clothes washers and/or dryers seem to be perpetually unserviceable. Also steer clear of the breakfast. Its expensive, self seve and not very good quality for price.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, value for money, great service!”
Reviews.Author: lepetitz
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the reviews found here that i made Travelodge Sydney my choice! The room was exactly as described. I took a Standard Room at 9th storey for 5 nights. It was spacious, clean and comfortable. Not too cold, and hot water for bath was rather easy to adjust. Although it was just next to the lift, there was no noise at all. And guess what, the menu screen on the TV was personalised with a greeting and my name! Was hoping for more channels though, perhaps a movie channel will be good! Staff was polite and helpful. We checked with one of them on the booking of day tour and she picked up the phone and called to make a booking even without our request! There's a city map at the recept, do grab one.. there's many brochures on day tours and attractions just in front of the lift, so do grab some! (I recommend Activity Tours for Hunter Valley, the tour was good and the guide was humorous and fun. Grayline is also good, though price a little on the high side!) Location is great, i could reach many destinations within my targetted time. To help those planning a f&e trip, here's the walking time frm hotel to some of the places: 1. Sydney Opera House: 2 hrs (along Elizabeth St, cut across Hyde Park, St Mary's Cathedral, along Macquerie St. includes looking at the places along the way) 2. World Square monorail station: 5min (world square station to darling park: <10min; darling park to city centre: 10min) 3. Chinatown: 10min 4. Aust Museum: 5min 5. St Mary's Cathedral: 10min 6. Mrs Macquerie's Chair: 35-40min 7. Darling Harbour: 25-30min Some nice food near the hotel: 1. Flo Kitchen Cafe: Reservoir St 2. BBQ King: Chinatown, along Goulburn St 3. The Falconer: Oxford St 4. Take A Break Cafe: Castlereagh St Nearest Coles is at World Square - drinking water here is cheaper than any other convenient stores! Not promoting for any of the places above, just providing some tips for those going on f&e. Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great place overall!”
Reviews.Author: medic8
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed in a Travelodge and knowing it's reputation as a budget chain, I was a little dubious as to whether the quality would be good enough. However, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the furnishings were modern and comfortable with air-conditioning that didn't wake me up by rattling in the middle of the night. There were tea and coffee making facilities, a microwave and a small sink in the room. Unexpected but actually turned out to be quite useful during our stay! The bathroom was of sufficient size and it was more of a wetroom, which was fine but the water could spread a little too far so that you had to manoeuvre round the puddle when opening the door. There was also a hairdrier in the bathroom. Great location - close to Central railway station, from which you can travel to Bondi beach easily, easy to find from the station and within walking distance of the main part of Sydney (that is, if you don't mind walking but you can walk through the botanic gardens to reach Sydney Harbour). There are a few convenience shops and pizza places nearby but I wouldn't recommend the convenience store just opposite - no prices on display and extortionately expensive! Extremely good value for money. We later found out that the price we had paid for our twin room was the same as some other guy staying in the nearby youth hostel in a 10 bed dormitory! Reception staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. There is an airport shuttle service available, which I would totally recommend. At A$12, it's cheaper than the train and also more convenient, especially if you have heavy bags.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Casey100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, 5 minutes walk from Museum station, (beware, there were no lifts or escalators in operation at the station), and close to Hyde Park. Check-in time is stated as 2pm, but we arrived at around 9am after a long flight and were able to check in straight away. I was slightly disappointed on arrival after reading some excellent hotel reviews, as our room was rather shabby, small and dark. The room we were allocated was adapted for disabled use and so the bathroom was large, fully tiled with a walk in shower, however, the camber on the floor was obviously wrong as whenever you took a shower the water ran out under the door and into the tiled corridor beyond. The small kitchenette in the room was useful and clean, with the maid even washing some of the dishes, which was unexpected. However, the small table in the corner was dirty when we arrived and wasnâ€™t cleaned the whole time, nor was the bathroom floor. The heating / air con in our room was broken throughout our stay. We returned late on our second night to a note saying the unit could not be repaired, and were offered a room change or extra blankets. Staff were friendly and there were a multitude of brochures on tourist attractions available in the lobby. Many sightseeing tours also pick up from the hotel. Wireless internet access at the hotel was a bit expensive and slow, but many of the shops in the area offer internet access at a reasonable rate. Overall, a good no frills, budget option in a good location, and notices in the hotel did say that a programme of refurbishment was due to start at the end of April 09.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: skiingsue
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel at the start of our 3 week trip to Australia. The hotel is in a good location, only 2 minutes walk from Museum station, 5 minutes from Chinatown and approximately 15 minutes walk to Darling Harbour which we loved. The hotel rooms are average size and the kitchenette is very useful for breakfasts and cold drinks. As long as you don't set your expectations too high, the hotel is good value for money given its position. The only negative really is the lack of storage space available for those on a long trip. We stayed on the 12th floor and weren't affected by noise except on one night when there was an unfortunate incident on our floor.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Zangtoi
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake you need to set your expectations with this hotel. It is a budget hotel for self catering. Nothing more, nothing less. Service was clearly forced from the young staffing who try to be as patient as they can muster. Rooms are clean, small and microwave does help. Best part - the coin laundry service if you manage to wait for one. Be prepared for a walk if you live here. Closes thing is Chinatown and Museum Station. Operahouse is 45 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ArindamDas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge Sydney while attending a conference in Sydney. Pros: 1. Good location and access 2. Good facilities for a budget hotel Cons: 1. Appeared expensive in rates

Reviews.Title: “Great for Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Baileybum
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference on recommendation of the conference organisers. It's a pretty straightforward 3 - 3.5 star hotel with all the basics as covered by previous reviewers. Rooms are older but clean though refurbishment is due to commence soon which should update some of the wear and tear. Breakfast is the usual scrambled eggs, bacon, beans, suasages, toast, cereal, fruit buffet. Nothing fancy but it'll get you through to lunchtime. The hotel is full of 'package deal' tourists and other group bookings so expect a noisy breakfast when it's busy. The location is fabulous, close to good pubs and other dining. So, if you're on a budget, it's good value as long as you're not expecting the Hyatt in disguise. But watch out for the convenience store right nearby - they charge like a wounded bull! And I don't recommend it if you're on business - a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for value and location”
Reviews.Author: chelsearoy
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for value and location. I read the reviews on here, and decided to book the travel lodge, because of its cheap price, and great location, being so near to the centre of Sydney. I was not disappointed. After reading the reviews on here, I telephoned and booked the hotel, and asked the booking staff for two things. 1st that my room was on one of the top floors, as they are in better condition, having recently been updated. 2nd that my room was well away from the lifts, as some people had complained that they heard a lot of noise, when they had rooms near to the lifts. When I arrived, I found the reception staff very young, but very nice and helpful. I was pleased to find that they had given me a room on the 18th floor, which was the top floor (normally these rooms are a little more expensive, but I was not charged extra), and also away from the lift. The room was very nice, and for the amount of money I paid, $105 bucks a night, for a hotel in the centre of a major city like Sydney, it was great value for money. The room was really clean, and very modern. It had air-conditioning that worked fine, a TV with limited channels, a modern bathroom, with everything working fine, including the hairdryer. Everyday, the room was cleaned, towels replaced, and impressively, all the sugar, tea bags, milk and coffee was replaced too. Just wished I never spent the money in the corner shop opposite the hotel, when I first arrived in Sydney, buying tea bags and milk which were expensive, (so avoid the late night grocery shop opposite the hotel, it was a rip off) The staff at the reception were as I said rather young, (teenagers mainly) but they were always very helpful, and polite to me. I tend to find people as they are, and if you are polite to them, they will be the same to you. I asked for a safe-deposit box, to put in my money and passport etc, and this was kept in the main office, and provided for free. So I never had to worry about my valuables being stolen or lost. Only one complaint, you get a swipe card, which you must use in the lifts (elevators) and to open the door of your room. Sometimes this card would not work first time, but did work after a few extra swipes. I canâ€™t understand why some people have written certain bad things about this Hotel, lets be honest you get what you pay for in life, and for the money this hotel cost for a night, you will not find better value in Sydney. One tip about eating out. I often used an Irish pub called Murphyâ€™s, which is only minutes walk from the Hotel, and bought a pod of beer, and steak and chips, all for $12 bucksâ€¦and enjoyed the friendly atmosphere that you find in an Irish pubâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Good 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the budget hotel. The room was basic, but clean and comfortable. It is only a short walk to Central Station. You know it's a budget hotel if you look at the cheap blanket. Overall there was no major issue during my stay. You can expect a clean and comfortable room at an reasonable price. You can probably find much better hotels in the similar price range (due to deep discounts at Sydney's 4 and 5 star hotels) during low season. However when those options are not available because of special events or weekends, travelodge sydney is a "safe" option.

Reviews.Title: “Self Catering at its best.”
Reviews.Author: JoeJourneys
Reviews.Content: Described as a self catering hotel it offers everything one needs make it feel more like a little flat away from home, with a small seating area in each room along with microwave, fridge, sink, cups, dishes, cutlery, milk, coffee and tea. Its location is perfect, near Hyde Park and withing walking distance to most attractions or access to public transport such as trains and buses to Bondi Beach, and lively parts of town. Keep in mind this is self catering, aside from having your room cleaned daily there is little else but offers superb value as a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Locked in elevator over an hour - manager didn't care”
Reviews.Author: GR8T2BAGTR
Reviews.Content: If you risk your health, or that of your loved ones at this hotel, you might ask assistant manager, Mr. Elmer Samonte, why he doesn't seem surprised when one of his 90-year-old guests is locked in an elevator for 80 minutes, or why he doesn't seem concerned that the elevator alarm system doesn't work. Then you might ask him why he won't call doctors upon request when the 90-year-old guest and his wife request one to check on his heart condition after being deprived of oxygen in an elevator. This incident occurred to one of our family members on February 1, 2009. The management was absolutely no concerned abou this incident - refused to call a physician, couldn't say when the elevator had been inspected last, and to add insult to injury - refused to provide a room to let the 90-year-old guest rest and try to recoup from the harrowing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Grassy23
Reviews.Content: A fairly standard Travelodge. Great view on the 11th floor, In a great location and for a reasonable price in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “location and value shine”
Reviews.Author: Clyde E
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at the Travelodge wyngard, but it had electrical problems so we were reassigned to Travelodge Sydney. Good value, rate under $100/night, location fair. Virtually no lounge area at reception area. Big complaint was trying to use clothes washers and dryers. Five floors had units, but machines on 3 floors were functioning. Had to wait for machines and made several trips to the other floors to find machines available. This was an experience but a hassle. We wanted a fitness center but alas, there was none.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times, worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: C0bra_Kai
Reviews.Content: Great location! Minutes walk to Hyde Park, shopping, restaurants. About a 30-45 min walk to Sydney Opera House, Darling Harbour, the Rocks, Kings Cross. Coles grocery store a few minutes just down the road. The room was very clean and very nice, but a tad on the small side. We were on one of the top floors, which looked like it had been recently renovated, compared to the other floors.We had a mini kitchenette, which helped keep food costs down. The service was good, except for the fact that we had left some change out to do laundry, and one day after room service had been in our room, noticed it was gone. It was only a few dollars, but still. We needed to check out a few days earlier, and they had no problem changing our reservation at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value close to central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kraftychick
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night with my mother as part of a night out including dinner and drinks in the Surry Hills area. There is really nothing negative about our experience at this hotel, except maybe the lady we saw on checkout was a bit grumpy! We had 2 requests, to have a room with 2 single beds, and to check in at midday instead of 2pm, and both were met with no problem. The room was clean and quiet, the cost was great for the location, and we especially liked the small kitchenette and table set up in the room which meant we were able to comfortably make a few snacks and breakfast in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, generally comfortable, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Qupnicely
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 5-night promo for $100pn. Rooms are clean with basic kitchenette, restocked daily tea, coffee, milk and washing up stuff. A few minutes walk to Museum Station on Airport line/city circle. Be advised there's no lift at this station, though, so a bit awkward with luggage/pushchair. A weekly bus/rail/ferry card for $46 is good option but you need to pay an $15+ for a 'gate pass' to access the airport line - still works out well. See the harbour by using the ferries. Hotel entrance itself is just around the corner from the main roads on a side street going up to Hyde Park (and quickest way to station). Bus connections to shopping district there. Darling Harbour about 20 mins walk. Hotel has swipe card room keys that double to 'unlock' the lift floor buttons - good idea but only one swipe needed so you could be unwittingly letting non-guests in with you, I suppose. Booked through their website - settle bill upon arrival and a $50 returnable deposit will be required. Local phone calls from room were just 80c a go which I thought was cheap compared to the $14 I got stung for in a Gold Coast apartment, for one short mobile call. Walk in shower lacks any step or enclosure so expect wet floors and the extractor fan is permanently on - could disturb a very light sleeper. On your last night you may need to prompt them to restock some items - I did and they did. Overall, housekeeping was very good. We had one night when the neighbours from hell moved in down the corridor but security was despatched to quieten them. Still they returned drunk in the early hours and we had to endure their mobile phone conversations in the corridor. Complaints were made and apologies received from the management and the offenders didn't stay on. Would have been better if they had never been admitted in the first place, though. So 4 out of 5 for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Lacam
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in total and thought it was great value for money. Rooms are quite large and comfy and have fridge/microwave for breakfast or even dinner. A reasonable walk to the Harbour but we did it several times and found a different route each time. Very close to Hyde Park for events.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: scott24
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the category of you get what you pay for. We stayed for 14 nights in this hotel and were pleased. This hotel is located in Downtown sydney within walking distance of everything you need. If you be realistic and realize that your not staying at the Four Seasons you will be happy. this hotel is clean with with a friendly staff that comes with a microwave, couch, and table. It's got a great location close to downtown, hyde park, major bus-lines and the train station. If you and your partner ( or alone ) are busy travelers and really just need a place to shower and sleep, this will work great. If you are someone that enjoys luxury on their vacation i would look elsewhere. the only complaint i would have is that the bed's are rather stiff. This would not be a good hotel for business travelers. the WiFi in the hotel is ridiculously expensive. They do offer computers located down in the lobby for a fee of $2 AUD for 20 minutes. However, there is an over abundance of internet cafe's so finding access wont be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “New years in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mariaspain
Reviews.Content: Singapore, Port Douglas, Ayers Rock and Sydney. Our final destination of a trip of a life time was coming to and end. But what an end!! NEW YEARS EVE!!! When we went looking for a hotel, they were all looking for ridiculous prices and a minimum of 7 nights!! We came across this hotel and, to be honest, we thought it would be a lot worse. It is a quite nice 3 star hotel. Good breakfast and very helpful staff. The internet signal only works in reception, where there are 3 computers as well. Our room was quite nice. With a kitchenette (that we didnt use) and an iron. The bathroom was wheelchair accesible, so when we were having a shower some water would go around the bathroom floor (but only a little, really) A big problem for me was that there is no wardrobe. There was a tiny area where you could hang a jacket and a few shirts. The MUSEUM underground stop is around the corner and so is Oxford street, where there are a lot of bars, restaurants and supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: RozKiwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wi-fi (with a fee for a password). However if you are hoping to use your laptop from your room make sure you stay on the 14th floor or above. I had a room on the 11th floor and could see the wi-fi signal with my computer. The staff however would not or could not sell me a password to use the wi-fi since I was not staying on the 14th floor (or higher). wi-fi (again for a fee) was available in the lobby. However the furniture available in the lobby was not designed for business use so I ended up spending my time perched in uncomfortable/unsuitable spots. So if you need/want to get online with your laptop while at this hotel make sure you have a room on the 14th floor (or higher).

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to a travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot75
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel when checking into it's sister hotel Travelodge Wynyard and so this stay didn't get off to a good start! Convenient location but not as convenient for us as the hotel we originally booked into and paid for. The first room we were put in didn't have internet access as booked and so we were moved to an "executive room". The room was exactly the same as the non-executive which we found very disappointing. The room hadn't been thoroughly cleaned since the previous guest either. Found the hotel noisey at night. Our neighbouring guests were drinking in the corridors and coming in at 4am and continuing to party in the room. We got the impression that a lot of travelling groups of young people use this hotel as part of a large organised touring group. Breakfast OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great loaction”
Reviews.Author: BristolTris
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights between 14-18 December 2008. Had a corner room on the 13th floor and was pleased with the size of the room - good size double bed, sofa, table and chairs, microwave, etc and an adequate sized bathroom with a nice, powerful shower. Though it could be busy, the front desk were always polite and helpful and could not be faulted. Th breakfast was fairly pricey but was good enough to set you up for the day especially as we had an early start that day. Othewise there's plenty of places to eat in every direction within 5 mins walk. It was about a 30 min walk to the Opera House otherwise the Museum Line was 5 mins from the hotel which was 2 stops to Circular Quay - about 5 bucks for a day return. Our main reason for being in Sydney was to see the city and explore the area. The Travelodge gave us a great base to do this and at a great price. Definatley recommended as long as you accept it's a Travelodge and not the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kristophoros
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2007 and fondly remember the experience. The location was central- it was a couple miles to walk to the Opera House and Bridge, Hyde Park is close, and a Bus going to Bondai Beach is nearby. The staff was friendly- they greeted and treated me respectfully, and put me in the room I requested. They also were glad to help w/ directions, but were a bit busy at times. The quality of the room was good- I did not have a problem with anything- all was clean, and the amenities in the room (fridge, bathtub) were great. Overall, for the price, quality and location, this hotel is above average, and I would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “not returning”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDuoPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Lodge for 4 days and really it was 4 days too long. We booked a double room with a queen bed and ended up with two single beds. The showers dribbled out water which was sort of warm but sought of cold as well and the staff were not friendly or helpful. We spent as little time as possible at the hotel. The rest of my family spend their 4 days at the Menzies Hotel, so we ended up spending a lot of time there and the change was unbelievable (for the same price). The staff were great, always helpful and cheerful, the rooms were so much nicer than the Travel Lodge and it just had a much nicer vibe going on. I will never stay at the drab and depressing Travel Lodge again

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: skydiverbrian
Reviews.Content: An older building that's received attention of late. Public areas and rooms are remodeled with an urban flair. Front desk is small and crowded, particularly at checkin/checkout times. Staff seems to be able to handle the volume without making guests feel like individuals. Bathrooms are adequate and clean, you have to really look to find mildew and the occasional stray hair. Shower stalls are smaller, and hot water was erratic. Convenient kitchenette includes sink, coffeemaker, microwave, and fridge. Iron and ironing board included in room. Wi-fi on higher levels of hotel. Coin-operated guest laundry on 5 different floors, but usually too busy to be of any use. I booked an Expedia special rate and received my special requests (queen bed, high floor, away from elevator) without any problems. The hotel refused a late checkout unless I paid 120% of the single-night rate. They did offer complimentary luggage storage instead, which was not ideal, but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: smithersNz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Aug 08 with my teenage daughter. Good value for money and easy walking distance to everything we did. Great restaurants nearby. Loved the atmosphere of the Irish pub Murphys just down the road. Good food for a very cheap price and excellent service. The staff at this hotel were very helpful and only too happy to oblige with anything. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittyra1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights. It took about 15mins on foot to the hotel from Central station, we would probably take a cab next time. As we arrived quite early in the morning, we left our luggage in the secure luggage area behind the reception. At 3pm we went back to the hotel and checked in with ease. We were given a room on the 18th floor. Very quiet, except for hearing the occasional plumbing noise whenever the other rooms used their showers/ taps. The room was clean and the view was quite good from that height. Location wise, it was easy to catch buses from there into the city centre. Although it was a little bit of a walk to the nearest light rail station, as we had to take it to get to Starcity casino, where we watched "Pricilla the queen of the dessert" - the main reason for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: fozzyontour
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 5 nights, clean comfortable and excellent value for money especially in Sydney. Good location within walking distance of most things. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: harlan8
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Near to Oxford St., Bus and Subway (to airport), Chinatown. Walkable to Darling Harbor, business area. Quick bus to Harbor, Bondi Beach.
