Decent, simple rooms, a step or two above Travelodges in the US. Internet access is $6/ hour, but there are many internet places in the area ( I used the one in Oxford St. Mall, 63 Oxford). Nice views from upper floors. Bathroom is all-in-one, shower is not in separate fixture, which seems to be the way things are designed now. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: stuart011
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the travelodge for two weeks and after reading the reviews I must say I was surprised at the standard of the hotel. On arrival and opening the door to the room I found that they had given us two single beds and this was for a two week stay. I went back down to the check in desk and the very helpfull staff agreed to swap us over the next day so that was OK by me. We ended up on the 15th Floor and found the hotel very clean and very quiet not the same as some other reviews it is in a good location and is about 10 to 15 minutes walk to Darling harbour. The transport system in Sydney is fantastic with the nearest train station apprx 5 min walk away (Museum stn). We purchased a one week travel card which cost us $43 each and this covered the buses, trains and ferry system. This ticket is a must for any traveller without a car. If I were to recommend a trip it would be without doubt the Port Stephens day trip operated by Grey Line tours, a fantastic day out with an very knowedgeable driver. A trip to miss out on would be the dolphin watching tour operated by Surfing Knagaroo bookable at tour operators on Darling Harbour. This trip was very poor with the so called guide who said about 20 words in the whole 12 hours we were out very dissapointing. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “High rise version of an extended stay motel in US”
Reviews.Author: TokyoBob1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 14-17 Oct during my second visit to Sydney. It reminds me of an extended stay motel in US except this is a high rise version. I was on the 10th floor with a view of an office building. It is a 5 minute walk from Museum station (Liverpool exit). Turn left when you exit the station. Around the corner there is a small IGA grocery store with the basics, Subway, Hungry Jack's (Burger King), and a few small coffee shops. I did not see any nicer sit down restaurants, and I noticed as many homeless panhandlers as there are in King's Cross. I tried to use my Wyndam rewards number which works with Travelodges in US, but this one would not accept it. They have an Australian program which does me no good as a tourist. There are pay Internet kiosks for a fee in the lobby. There is an Internet Everywhere ($AD 2 per hour) about a 5 minute walk away. Turn right when exiting Museum station (Liverpool exit). The room was very basic. They could do a better job of cleaning the floor and carpet. I noticed long hair on the floor, on the carpet, on the bed spread, and the smell of "wet dog" was strong on my first few hours in the room. The matress was pretty firm because there was no box spring. The pillow were pretty flat. There is a fridge, microwave, hot water pot, plates, bowls, and utensils in the room. I would only stay here again , but only by myself. Only stayed because of the cheap price, good location, and belief that I could collect Wydham points.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: puntrd
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, only a five-minute walk from Central Station. The rooms are you typical 3-star stuff. If you don't need to spend much time in your room and use it as a place to sleep, you'll be fine. The bathrooms are need of a spruce up. They are old and weatherbeaten. I set the air-con on the lowest temp it could go as my room was hot and stuffy, but the air-con didn't work very well. Fortunately it wasn't a hot day in Sydney, so it wasn't too much of an inconvenience. The Tv has Foxtel channels, there's a small fridge and a microwave and overall, the hotel's prices are excellent and I'd stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonJanetC
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 17th floor and it was fine (apparently the rooms at the top of the hotel have been renovated). The room was small and not much space to put things, but it was good to have crockery, fridge, kettle, microwave etc. Very easy to get to. We got the train from the airport direct to Museum station and then it was only a 5 minute walk, even with luggage. Museum station is just 2 stops from Circular Quay for the harbour bridge and opera house. I felt the breakfast was a rip off at $17, especially as there was no fresh fruit, only tinned.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stop.”
Reviews.Author: CallumandLara
Reviews.Content: This was our first stopoff in Australia, and we were pleasantly suprised. We were paying $99AUD per night, which compared to many other Sydney hotels was really good. Although the hotel doesn't have a restaurant, it is literally in the city centre, within easy walking distance to anything in the town. The rooms were not huge, but big enough to fit a double bed and sofa, and kitchenette. The rooms were cleaned really well, and the staff were really helpful too, especially Lisa. If you didn't fancy walking too far, there is a tube station (Museum Station I think) within about 2 minutes of the hotel. The internet cafe was really useful, and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ilive2roam
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Travelodge early after a long flight from Auckland for a overnight stop before heading out. Since we arrived early, we were able to check in early. Once we arrived up to our room, they gave us twin beds instead of a queen bed like we had booked. Since there were loads of people downstairs and they did let us check-in early, we confirmed that our reservation was in deed for a queen, but they did not have one available that time so we let it go. The hotel was fairly clean, but the shower had no bottom. It was only a tile floor with a drain. It is in pretty good location as it is within walking distance to Circular Quay, but it is a pretty good walk. There were a ton of younger people here, probably because a reasonable price, so I would rate it as one step above staying at a backpacker hotel. Would probably consider other options before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing for this place is a wrecking ball”
Reviews.Author: rallyman1122
Reviews.Content: Funnily enough felt just like a bad hotel experience in the U.K. Our room was not been cleaned correctly, nor was it vacuumed for the first 5 nights of our stay. The bed was simply pulled together, never properly made. We were having to make the bed when we come back to the room each evening. Behind the bathroom door, there was former occupants hair on the floor. We asked for a room with two beds for our daughters at time of booking but that was not provided. The room issue is not a major one and we could have had the girls room changed but that meant a different floor. We decided against that. I was happy about that decision as when we went to use the laundry facilities on another floor, the floor closest to us was filthy. The hallways carpets are stained and the walls dirty, very nasty! The laundry facilities are a joke as well. Besides being expensive at $4 for a wash and the same for a short dry cycle, we had to wash our clothes on one floor but use a dryer elsewhere because the dryer has gum all over the inside. Just one more example of the filth in this hotel. When the issues of lack of proper cleaning of the hotel are brought up with hotel staff, no one seemed to care about the issue I asked for the air conditioning to be looked at as the hallways and common areas are all MUCH cooler than our room. We came back to the hotel, turned on the A/C and were covered in dust blowing from the A/C vent. At least they looked at it, didn't fix it, but they looked at it. From the start we have had difficulty with Internet service. The hotel is happy to charge our account for Internet service, however they continually refer us to a third party vendor when the service does not work. Given the cost of the Internet service here, we could have stayed at a much nicer hotel that included free Internet in the room charges. As we had two laptops, we are paying an additional $40/day, $20 for each laptop. For all that extra cost, I could not upload pictures to an online photo sharing site due to the slow connection and data restrictions. I especially loved the fact that there are endless tour groups of young American teenagers roaming about the hotel. Loud and rude, this is really what I wanted for the start of my vacation in Australia. The location was nice, at the south end of Hyde Park and the breakfast buffet was decent. However, at $22 it was fairly expensive by even Sydney standards. To give the hotel credit, after contacting my travel agents local representative, the hotel offered to credit back all internet charges. Alas, not so easy as at check out we had to present the letter provided from the hotel manager stating this. The internet charges were still on the bill. That was a 15 minute delay on a day when we had to get to the airport for a early flight. Just another sign of poor service

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: McGalio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for Sydney. Its still walking distance to everything (although moreso for younger legs.) Its clean, modern and close to transit. Sydney can be very expensive. This hotel is a great choice at a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Single Beds Are Terrible”
Reviews.Author: travelagent9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for work training with another colleague. We were booked into a twin room with twin beds for 3 nights. The beds are tiny, reception say they are 2 feet 6 inches wide but this does not allow for the tapering at the side of the bed. On the second night I came back to the room to find the bed just pulled up. Sheets not tucked in (because they were too small) and the blanket still as I had left it that morning. I changed rooms that night to a queen room with sofa bed. Much better. Whatever you do don't book the rooms with 2 single beds if you are an adult!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Ram_Returns
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and you can't be bothered to walk for miles or get public transport then I doubt you can get much better value! I really can't fault the location. The hotel however wasn't as good. It looked really tired and in need of some serious upgrading. The rooms were adequate but hardly impressive. It's just a good, cheap(ish) hotel. But let's be honest, you're hardly going to Sydney to enjoy sitting around in a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: gypsy1604
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel i use the word hotel lightly . what a dump to arrive at midnight ,it was filthy ,but due to the late hour we stopped but never again would i stop at one of these places there ok if your a chav .dirty bed lined a truly awful room at the top ,no bar nothing we had to go out and find a shop to get somting to eat ,the bathroom was a disgrace .not to be recomended

Reviews.Title: “It was nice.”
Reviews.Author: Aussiechaser
Reviews.Content: I was just at the Travelodge a few days ago and it was very good. Average hotel, nothing magnificent, but definitely good for traveling. A small " complaint" would be the keys for the rooms. Whenever they came into contact with metal, they would de-activate. So if you are intending on staying there and if you want to avoid unecessary trips to reception, keep the key seperate from metals or keys. Also, the breakfast wasn't exactly ideal, but the hashbrowns made up for that. Overall, a pretty decent place to stay while in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel; Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: JonathanOKC
Reviews.Content: While all the reviews seem to give this hotel a horrible rating, my wife and I really enjoyed it. We stayed at the hotel for three days. In our opinion, we would rank this hotel similar to a Best Western or Holiday Inn Express (Without the 'free' breakfast). There is no such thing as a 'free breakfast' in Sydney. A cup of coffee will cost you anywhere from $2.50-$3.50. Do not believe all the negative reviews. They are FAR from the truth. When we arrived, around 11 AM, we were informed that our room would not be ready until after lunchtime (2 PM). They offered to hold our luggage and check it in should we wish to go find something to eat. Since we were obviously tired, we choose to sit in the hotel lobby for a few minutes. We were quickly greeted by the front desk staff who informed us our room was ready. They also stated they would give us a room on the top floor that would be quieter and less crowded from traveling groups. A few things to keep in mind when staying at this location: 1. You are south of all the attractions, but within walking distance of everything. 2. Try to stay on the top floor of the hotel (we stayed on 18) as it seemed to be less noisy than the other floors. 3. Internet is much cheaper just a few blocks away at place called â€œInternet Everywhereâ€�. It has an orange sign and was suggested by the hotel staff. For $2, you can get a full hour rather than 20 minutes for the same price in the hotel lobby. 4. The breakfast is NOT included in the Travellodge rate. If you want a hot breakfast, be prepared for a $17/person rate. If you can get it included in your rate...do so...it is a fairly nice breakfast! 5. Travellodges frequently, in Australia, host larger groups. This means that when you book a room, you want to make SURE you communicate with the front desk to not be on those floors. This will get you in a better part of the hotel and you will enjoy it more. PROS - Good Location (If you are able to walk) - Safe Location (Police Station Sits Right Beside Hotel) - Friendly Front Desk Staff - Excellent Hot Breakfast CONS - Elevator Was Sometimes Slow; Especially During "Peak" Times (8 AM & 5 PM)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Claire9947
Reviews.Content: Was lucky to find this hotel, got a really good deal. It was just like the travelodges in the UK, basic, clean and you know what you are getting. About a 15 brisk walk to darling harbour. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WelshWedge
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money. Much like UK Travelodges the hotels was no frills but clean and tidy with a good size room and bathroom. There was also a microwave, good size fridge and dishes that allowed for basic catering. Also there was a iron and ironing board, as well as all other comforts that you'd expect in a hotel room. The hotel was a 10 minute walk from Central station and a 25 minute walk to Circular Quay. All the main attractions were in easy walking distance. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel ok but”
Reviews.Author: cartoonp
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the Edge of C B D district of Sydney.Well placed .But the hotel has problems the room was ok had small fridge and micowave oven and one small Chest Of Drawers with 2 Drawers and one wardrobe ok for short stay but if staying over a week then not enough room. The carpet in the room was quite stained and never semed to be cleaned the room did have a maid that did ok (allways clean towls emptyed bins did the bed ect ) but did not seem to clean the carpet.All so the toilet roll holder was near enough off the wall no one seemed to care and left it as it was the shower was poor you had to put a towel on the floor as it was all on one level so the water world go every where without the towl . The lift you had to use your room key in to go up to your room this seemed to be a hit and miss thing did not matter how slow or fast you pasted the key sometimes it did no work and you spend 5 to 10 minutes trying to get it to work.The staff where ok but I think do need a bit of training.If you looking for top rate hotel with everything perfect look else where.But if you looking for A quite cheap hotel .Where you can sleep and spend more time doing othe things seeing the sites ect.Then this hotel passes the test Here A few tips that I hope will help if you decided to stay here Getting to Darling Harbour from hotel Walk along Wentworth Avenue to Elizabeth street then along Elizabeth street to Liverpool street .If you walk along liverpool street into the centre of Town then if you carry on along Liverpool street you will be in Darling Harbour. I know there are other ways to get to Darling Harbour this is just one from the hotel TIP Woolwoths is on Park street to get here Walk along Wentworth Avenue to Elizabeth street then along Elizabeth street Park st is the 3rd or 4fh street off Elizabeth street Hope these help some of you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Sadm705
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews for this hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised by the superb location and comfort of the Travelodge. It is twenty minutes brisk walk from the Opera House, and you can walk via Hyde Park and the Botanical Gardens without hardly touching the city itself in one direction, and fifteen minutes to Darling Harbour in the other. Both destinations are beathtaking with plenty of things to do and see. We stayed a total of fifteen nights with an 'Autumn Special' rate of 99 dollars a night, and we would have stayed longer if it had been possible. The staff were always helpful, the rooms clean, very comfortable, well made-up each day, with good showers, coffee making facilities and microwave, ironing facilities and laundries on two or three of the eighteen floors. This is a popular hotel and hence there are often groups arriving or departing from the reception area. Broadband was expensive for one hour (10 Au dollars) but only 20 dollars for 24 hours over 90 days. This was far more than we needed but very handy to have if you take your own laptop. There are internet PCs available also - and the broadband only works on this ground floor level. There are no restaurant facilities except for breakfast, but there is a vast range of eating places close by, with Darling Harbour offering a range of places and prices and views that would be hard to beat, especially at night. There are also pubs close by that offer bar meals and bistro options. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you have a modest budget and its central position would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “adequate but some irritations.”
Reviews.Author: Nellie119
Reviews.Content: It was cheap, clean and quite comfortable and that should have been adequate, except for a few issues. There were 6 of us in 3 rooms, each one of us with a card key. Over 2 days, we had to traipse back to Reception on average twice each to have the card rekeyed as it would no longer open our doors. It became frustrating. 4 of us had arrived at 10am, too early for 2pm checkin, but were pleased to store our bags and explore. At 12:30, the last couple arrived at the hotel and were able to check in immediately. Good for them. Us 4 traipsed back to the hotel at about 1:30, still early, yet one couple were accommodated immediately. Husband and I were asked to wait 10 mins. No problem. We sat and waited 50 mins until it became evident they had completely forgotten about us. It happens everywhere, but it's annoying when the 6 of us were itching to get out and about again. The service was not offensive, but not friendly either. It's a very busy hotel on the edge of the CBD, in a not particularly attractive area. However, taxis seem to drop off guests at about 5 min intervals so it's easy to catch one. Museum Train Station is just around the corner, the monorail is a short walk away. We had an easy walk down the hill to Chinatown and Darling Harbour... coming home uphill needs more exertion. There is no lounge area for a quiet drink. You must go out for lunch and dinner, or order in from a number of local eateries. Breakfast is particularly ordinary, but totally adequate (muesli, yoghurt, corn flakes, toast, baked beans, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages). The hotel seems to have a large patronage of Asians, so one would have thought a noodle dish at least would have been offered. As a previous reviewer said, there is a great little spot for breakfast around the corner called "Two Good Eggs".

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Kaz&Marty
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel although the breakfast was expensive for what it was. We found a lovely cafe, Two Good Eggs, just a short walk from the hotel which served great breakfasts from 7am and was much better value. Hotel was about a 10 minute walk from Central Station and about 15 minutes from Darling Harbour. Beds comfortable, facilities OK and internet costs good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SFiti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge Sydney for six days from 8 May 2008. I booked via Wotif website and confirmed my booking by calling the Travelodge helpdesk and advised them of my preference for a Queen room. It was my first vist to Sydney and my flight arrived early morning and as check in isn't till 2pm the front desk happily kept my luggage in their luggage room. I wandered the city for most of the day until check in and ended up soaking up the sun in Hyde park which is literally a five minute walk from the front door. Unfortunately when I eventually checked in there were no Queen rooms available and when I informed the front desk that I had already advised them of my preference for a Queen room they aplogised and assured me of a Queen room for the remainder of my stay. I was upgraded to a King room the next day. I have stayed at Travelodges in the U.K. and this was by far the best experience I have had. All the people on the front desk were extremely helpful and always cheery, especially the young women. My room was on the 17th floor and had great morning sun and virtually no street noise. It was modern, clean and exactly what I expected and more. After a long day touring around Sydney it was always a great place to return to. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great base to explore the city and its environs. I will definitely return to the Travelodge Sydney in the future.

Reviews.Title: “not that good.”
Reviews.Author: steelpulse
Reviews.Content: fairly well equipt clean room,but beds were on huge wheels and if you moved too quickly they skated across the room,we were on the 7th floor at the front overlooking the road junction,lovely view in to a block of flats to one side of us. !!..we were only here for 2 nights so it was ample for our needs which was basically a bed and shower really,3 of us shared a room so it was cheaper. there is a lovely hotel/pub about 500 yards away that did lovely food and they were really friendly,there is a shop just across the junction but they have no prices on the produts or shelves so beware they could charge over the top if they dislike you.we walked from our hotel to the harbour bridge and opera house a distance of about 2.5 kms one way! ( we would have gone by bus if we had realised but there was lots to look at in the CBD(central business district)so it was a gentle stroll.it was a good stoll in the rain too.we probably would'nt stay here again,but it was ok at the time.we were on a stop over from nz to the uk,they have a shuttle bus to take you to the airport and it goes through chinatown which was amazing.if you like ice in your drinks ask for a room on the 9th floor cos there is an ice machine there,you can buy most things in the hotel from various vending machines but beware they don't give change,the reception desk has very helpful staff and they can direct you and give you a map to wherever you want to go.there is a lift to all floors,although one night we ran down the fire escape stairs cos the lifts were very busy,(you can use these stairs if you don't like lifts)none of the windows open in the rooms so they all have air-conditioning,which is fairly quiet,room has a tv and direct dial phone,overall not too bad,bus stops to more or less anywhere in sydney are about 200 metres from front of hotel.bondi is about a 25 minute bus journey which was well worth the effort.in fact bondi made the whole trip worthwhile!!

Reviews.Title: “Wentworth avenue - ok functional”
Reviews.Author: Jay33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge in Sydney as the last point on our tour of Oz. It was ok, the beds were comfortable and seemed clean, the bathroom worked and was large enough. The room itself was the smallest on our tour but we did have a nice view of the city from our 16th floor window. Reception was ok, nothing special and when we asked for some information on where the restuarants were she sent us down Oxford Street. Which was mainly gay bars, not sure why she sent us down there. It was an ok hotel nothing special but equally nothing wrong. It was really close to Hyde Park and about half an hour walk to the Opera House or 15 minutes to the harbour resturants, so location was pretty central. Once we got our bearings we found getting around really easy. Sydney is a lovely place, warm and friendly with lots to do. Must do the Gardens, Opera House, Aquirium and if you like a drink try the Hunter Valley wine tours. The tour operators are on Pier 26 at the Harbour and easy to do business with, if you are going later in the year or Spring then leave it until the day before and you can get a deal rather than pay full price. We couldn't get to see anything in the opera house but if you go to Star city they have two theaters and generally tickets available. We didn't do the harbour bridge walk as it was 3.5 hours and Â£90 each but looked interesting, we went up the sky tower instead which is higher than the bridge and gives wonderfull 360 degree views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: OrangeBlueCrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge Sydney on Wentworth Ave for 2 nights. The room was smaller than average for a room in the USA, but it was nice. The view from our room on the 13th floor was another building across the street, but to the sides you could see more of the city. The staff was very good about setting us up early in a room because we arrived from our 14 hr flight at 10am. The location was the best feature as it was within walking distance to a nice cafe, the ANZAC memorial park (Hyde Park) and the train station. A good place for people looking to save a buck and dont mind the size of the rooms. My wife, who is deaf, was not pleased that the television did not have the closed caption/teletext options. In USA just about all hotels/motels televisions have closed caption/teletext options. She wanted to be able to watch the Australian news on TV but couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great, very affordable hotel. If only all Travelodges were like this...”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP26
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal online from the Travelodge website, and was expecting this hotel to be a pretty basic Travelodge, along the lines we get in the UK. I was very pleasantly surprised to find that it exceeded all my expectations. Location is excellent - it's right in the CBD, just two minutes walk to Museum train/subway station and Hyde Park; five minutes walk to Central train station; or about 30 minutes walk all the way down to Circular Quay and the harbour area. There are a number of 24-hour convenience stores within a few metres of the hotel. Room was clean and modern, with good twin beds, a table and chairs, a TV with a good selection of satellite channels, air-conditioning, a microwave, a selection of local takeaway menus who would deliver to your room, and a well furnished bathroom. Hotel also provided a bar; restaurant; several guest laundries with coin operated washers, driers and laundry powder dispensers; and four coin-operated internet computers in the lobby. There are elevators to all floors. Only down sides were that the room was initially made up as a double when we'd requested a twin (this was quickly remedied); and the key-swipes in the lift seem a little unreliable (my key needed to be 're-programmed' twice). Would definitely recommend this place though - the location is just perfect for exploring the city on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ozzietripper
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Travelodge.. The room was clean and regularly serviced. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only fault that I found was the single bed that I slept in was on wheels and it occasionally banged against the wall during the night. The location is very good and central to Sydney and the buffet breakfast was very tasty but a little overpriced at $17. We will stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronandshe
Reviews.Content: Just had a week in Sydney and I must say the hotel surpassed all of our expectations. It is just round the corner from the station and also from the Park. The room was very clean and there is nothing to criticise, a bit basic maybe but a bargain. We had breakfast every day and it was ok. I paid for the breakfast when checking in and it was $5 a day cheaper than ordering on a daily basis. I would recommend this hotel to any visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevehw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay in the wentworth travelodge. The location is very central and makes a good base to see the city of Sidney. Booking on line allowed us an offer price for a 5 night stay so worth playing around on their website. The hotel is relatively new but in a little run down area as the taxis trip in was interesting. From thehotel, underground stations are near by or a 30 or so minute walk gets you to the habour area. The room had good sized walk in bathroom. Small kitchen area (fridge/microwave/sink) and 3 place settings were available. A nice touch was the guide to local take aways for ordering in. In our room two single beds, a sofa bed and a table finished the room off. The room was also air conditioned. An ashtray was also provided and the room smelt heavily of smoke - no one asked at checkin about smoking preference. A quick airfresnher from the local supermarket resolved this - not a major deal but worthnoting. Self service buffet breakfast was available alhtough not on our room rate so an extra cost there - but worthit. Vending machines available on some floors and the laundry (washing machine/ dryer) was a god sendfor refreshing clothes. A good solid cheap end hotel with reaosable facilities. The location is good as a base to travel around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hausl
Reviews.Content: Great price for the location and room accommodations. Walking distance to Chinatown and harbour area.The room was clean, comfortable and air conditioned. Shuttle service to airport was available. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “help for the weary traveler”
Reviews.Author: Lori876
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before i set out on a Contiki tour and I also stayed here before catching a flight home. When I checked in the first time, it seemed a standard hotel. However, when I checked in the second time, that's when it was a great experience. I was deathly ill when I checked in the second time. I had been to the hospital in the outback and they gave me antibiotics. Well, I had a very bad reaction on the plane to sydney. I got to the hotel and the desk clerk knew I was sick and made sure I got to the hospital and made sure I got to the nearest pharmacy to fill my prescription before closing time. When I came back from the hospital later in the day, the staff had already taken care of my luggage that I had basically left in the lobby and had plenty of water and the like there. The beds are incredibly comfortable. However, if you are looking for incredible staff and clean rooms, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: DanLondon
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I booked - I needed somewhere to stay for a week and thought Id made a mistake staying in a Travelodge. However, from the moment I arrived I was impressed. I asked to stay on the top floor as the reviews on here said it was noisy lower down. So I was put on the 18th floor. The room was small, but spotlessly clean, modern and quite well designed. The bathroom was very clean and quite cleverly arranged. One review said water went everywhere, but we didnt have this problem. The kitchenette was useful - but you really cant cook anything substantial here - it is tiny. The lifts were quick, staff really helpful, the room didnt seem to be cleaned every day but we didnt mind too much. The location is great. 5 min walk to Hyde Park and near some good restaurants. nly slight bit of ad vice - we were put in room next to the lifts and the doors arent very soundproofed. We were awoken a few times by people coming out of the lifts. Id ask to be placed along the corridoors. Minor problem though. Would definately stay here again if I got a good deal. We paid 99 AUD a night!

Reviews.Title: “hairs in the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: VincentWindle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for nights in early Feb after getting a special deal of $99 per night for staying 5 nights. The hotel room was a decent size with a well-maintained kitchenette, however the quality of cleaning left much to be desired. There were hairs all over the bathroom floor when we arrived. After three days of waiting, we had to ask for them to be cleaned. Don't expect the check-in staff to be too helpful either, they put us in a twin, considering we also had a cot to fit in, it was a tight squeeze. Overall good price, poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Lee008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Travelodge for a weekend getaway. We were on a budget so at AUD $135 a night it suited us perfectly. Its location is great and its an easy walk (i.e. no hills)to darling harbour, city centre and circular quay. We requested a double bed but were given two singles which we were a bit disappointed by but couldnâ€™t change. If i was expected something really nice I would have been disappointed but i had realistic expectations and the Travelodge met those. Overall, a good budget hotel in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jacki_1981
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying for 5 nights at the Travelodge Sydney and I would definately stay there again. The staff were friendly and efficient, the room was clean and very quiet and the location is perfect, close to everything. Also the rates are cheap for Sydney accommodation. I will stay again next time I visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Why?”
Reviews.Author: Mmmarie
Reviews.Content: We asked on phone for a non smoking room and one bed cause we'are a couple and when we arrived the queue in the reception was that long so we waited 15 minutes just to talk to someone. The girl in the reception gave us a discusting smoke- room with two single beds and told us that the room was the only they had left!(??) Ok? The room wasnt even cleaned. The bathroom had dirt everywhere and the bottles of shampos in the shower were empty. Two bath-towels was the only towels to use. Not even one for the floor or hands. Not professional at all! We went down to the reception again and told them that we couldnt stay in that smell. The girl told us that they were nothing she could do about it. Not even move the two beds together.. Not even let US do that... Where is the service?!? She told us to talk to the manager if we had problems, who was out at the moment. Anyway the manager told us that we could get another room next day... So we checked out from the smelly room and left our bags behind the reception at 09.30 when cleaning staff knocked on out door and asked if we were going to check out. What?(!!) The new room wasnt ready so we must wait till 2pm to move in in out new nonsmoking room. A better smell but still dirty carpet and bathroom. We didnt want to take out shoes of. And one more wierd thing; In out fridge there was a wet discusting used bath- towel with hair on!? Do the cleaning staff just make the beds or what?! We paid for breakfast a day before to save som money. ($12 witch is pretty ok I think) The breakfast was ok, not more, with hot and cold to choose from, no one cared if someting was empty. There MUST be som much better hotels in the area for a price like this! Do not waste your money and time here.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for price”
Reviews.Author: Isle 'n Sun
Reviews.Content: First: Selecting which Travelodge to write about not perfectly clear using TripAdisor website. So, this review is for the Travelodge at 27 33 Wentworth Ave, Sydney. There is a Travelodge located in the central/business district of Sydney and it looks better than on on Wentworth. Second: For the price paid it was a weak ok. Having spent nearly 6 weeks traveling New Zealand and some Australia this particular lodging was the lowest in value for price paid. I would stay there again, but only after checking out more options. Not to say the place is bad. I did 'farm-stays', 'youth hostels', and '5 star hotels' on this trip. All had charm, character, and/or something unique to offer. This hotel was just that, a plain hotel. When I was there the place had loads of tourist buses/and tourists. Good location, so if you are out and about most of the day. This will work. Just know that you are not likely going to impress your evening guest, if you get lucky! About two blocks away in an 'alternative' district. Certainly worth a walk to see those who 'walk-on-the-wild-side.'

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but staff were unfriendly and rude”
Reviews.Author: ichifeet
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights at the beginning of the month. Chose hotel for location and price. When I arrived (after an early morning flight), the staff member that checked me in didn't greet me, and appeared to be in a bad mood and proceeded to rable off their policies, procedures, etc with no eye contact, just a blank stare. Room wasn't ready and when I asked when one would be, she just shrugged her shoulders and said come back in a couple of hours to see if one would be ready. (OK I arrived in the morning and check -in was at 2pm, however she could have made more of an effort to see if there was any empty rooms). Coming back, my intended room wasn't ready and so I had to settle for one on a smoking floor (I'm a non smoker). Room was adequate and comfortable. Checking out, again I experienced the inhospitable attitude of the staff, my checkout was done as if it was an inconvenience to the staff member, Overall the hotel is OK, however having stayed at Travelodge Southbank in Melbourne, I experienced far better service there, then I did here. I wil not be using the hotel again when I travel to Sydney in the future

Reviews.Title: “Stolen mobile phone.”
Reviews.Author: RICHAUk
Reviews.Content: Many people will continue to stay at this hotel because of its convenient location and cheap price, however if you can possibly avoid it please pay a bit more and stay at a nicer hotel. As an experienced traveller i chose this hotel for its location and based on stays in TL in Melbourne. Upon arrival the reception staff were unable to find my booking (which i made on expedia) and told me that they had no rooms available even though I had confirmation from Expedia. They then managed to find the booking but however had only 1 room left which was a smoking room and with twin beds.. The room is dark and on the second day a mobile phone which was inside a suitcase but unfortunately unlocked went missing... All in all not the best of experiences and if you do choose to stay here then take your chances and make sure you take all your belongings with you.

Reviews.Title: “stolen handbag from room - Travelodge Hotel Sydney Wentworth Ave”
Reviews.Author: happyKazu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had our handbag stolen from inside the room. (Nov 24th) The swipe card wasn't working and it was changed at reception early that morning. handbag is stolen in the next 3-4 hours.(between 5am and 9am) After reporting the incident to the hotel they were not very helpful except to tell us to go to the local police station to report the incident. ( Surry Hills police station.) The hotel staff said the room must not have been locked properly but they couldn't demonstrate how the door could be left unlocked without someone holding it open or placing an object between the door and the door frame. (door is designed to close automatically due to its weight) They wouldnt even come up to the room with us to show us how this is possible. there was even implications from staff (not all) members that we might have misplaced the handbag. Some staff even implied that unless we can prove it was stolen then we could just be making it up. (BTW we had no travel insurance so we took the loss) i asked the duty manager if this sort of thing has happened before at this hotel. He replied he was not authorised to comment on that.(what does that mean???) We reported it to the poilce but they were no help. They just gave us a police report number and told us they were quite busy and couldn't come to the hotel. We hope it wasn't an inside job but we had no help from the hotel to explain how anyone can get access to inside a locked room. We were very disappointed with the unwillingness of staff to investigate the stolen handbag and explain to us how a handbag can be stolen from inside a locked room. the security at this hotel is very poor. there is no security cameras on the floors, card access to the elevator is possible to all floors and not restricted to just ones own room floor. there is one security camera at the front entrance and they were not going to review the footage anyway. it would be possible for anyone to walk in and ride the elevator to any floor they desire. but how anyone can get access to a locked room is what has me most worried. we advise people to be cautious when staying here and when things go bad you will not get too much help. only sharing these experiences will hopefully force hotels like this to upgrade security and also to not brush off incidences like this. i hope no one has to go through the nightmare we had to go through which included organising a new passport and cancelling credit cards. i know that these things do happen but the way the staff handled this situation and their attitude and unwillingness to help is what really left a bad impression and disappointed us we can provide the room number where the thief stole the handbag from on request

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RediKnight
Reviews.Content: Really clean room. Very good location. Excellent value for money. I can't believe some folks have rated this place badly. I'm here with my girlfriend and we knew that this hotel offered good cheap accomodation which leaves you plenty of time and money to enjoy Sydney. Staff friendly just don't expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have EVER STAYED in in the entire world”
Reviews.Author: Cyradiz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com.au and it was a mystery hotel. As I have previously booked using lastminute and had a pleasant experience, i was expecting to find similar quality hotels or at least a reasonable room with a reasonable shower facility. We had no HOT water (and it was cold then in Australia) and the room can't be locked from the adjoining room next door. YET, we were not able to change to another room. It was worse than the backpackers I had stayed in in remote China. The service was rude and extreme patronising especially from the duty manager. We had to wait for more than 2 hours for the hot water to come through before we could take a shower at around 2 am after we came back from visiting some mates, and was told by the duty manager very rudely the next morning that it was normal. He was extremely rude and did not trust our words nor the report of his own staff the night who filed a report. I find his manner extremely condescending towards Asians and he treated my partner better after realising he was white. I didn't expect to find racism in a hotel that services overseas clients and it was shocking the way I was treated. I will not be recommending anyone to stay there ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, stay here”
Reviews.Author: ritzta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Sydney in November. It's very close to the Central Train Station, which was nice because you can just walk up the street. The hotel is at the base of Hyde Park, and very central to anything you want to do in Sydney. The hotel was modern and seemed business-oriented. It had a nice restaurant, and internet kiosks, which was very convenient. The staff was fast and friendly. They also happily stored my luggage. The room was clean, tidy and of a generous size. There was also a kitchenette, powerful show and cable television. I really thought for $85 USD / night, this was an excellent value. I would absolutely stay here again. Me: Single traveler, mid 20s traveling for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Central”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastandrew
Reviews.Content: Clean and fresh hotel located in a good position in central sydney. Easy access to CBD and main shopping areas aswell as Hyde park. Rooms are fresh and staff helpful. Good run of the mill hotels.

Reviews.Title: “New renovated cheap hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Pluttan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in october 2007. It was a perfect choise. The rooms where beautiful new renovated and fresh and the staff was very servicemined and nice. The hotel is close to all shopping, restaurants and to the train station. The hotel was very fresh and felt very new. This hotel is perfect for every trourist!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Dawn_MK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Quantas holidays and it was fantastic, the rooms were clean and spacious and the staff friendly and polite. The hotel itself is on a main road but the rear view rooms faced a quieter street. The hotel is literally less than 5 minutes walk from circular quays which is where you have access to all the ferries that take you round the harbour. It is near to hundreds of shops and restaurants and the nearest tube station is over the road, really was a great base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Its cheap for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: happydaysManchester
Reviews.Content: Please only stay here if you want a very basic hotel thats quite close to all the sights, shopping etc. Be aware that your bed will be on wheels?!, the rooms are very basic ie the shower is a hole in the floor with a shower curtain so EVERYTHING gets wet. The restaurant has dirty crockery and the window ledges need cleaning. I think they also need to spend some money on soundproofing, you can hear doors slamming all hours of the day and night. On the plus side the staff are pleasant enough and are happy to book trips etc for you. We also got a good deal by booking online direct with them but I wouldnt want to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Large, Comfortable, Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: SF_Thommo
Reviews.Content: I stay in Sydney quite often for work and this is the best place I have found. The rates for more than five days are realy reasonable and the rooms are quite good. I think the kitchenette is a great bonus for a longer stay. The pictures on the website are quite accurate. I have no problem recomending this to anyone looking for a great location to stay in Sydney. It is only a short walk to central station and there are lots of restaurants, pubs and shopping within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient place in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Andraz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge Wentworth Ave for a week in July during my business visit to Sydney. My choice of Travelodge was more a constrain than a deliberation, as I decided to attend a conference in the last minute and this hotel was they only available place with free single rooms within a range of accommodation options identified by local organizators. Nevertheless, the hotel is nice, and overall I was happy with my accommodation. Although I visited Sydney in low season, I would agree with earlier reviews that the hotel is "a good value for money". Moreover, I should mention the kindness of the reservations coordinator, who promptly replied to all emails, while I was organizing my trip to Australia. As I had some problems with the confirmation of the flight booking, I changed my arrival and departure dates twice. However, he didn't make any complaints and changed the reservation dates as I requested. Maybe this is the reason why, I was to some extent disappointed with the general attitude of the reception staff when I actually got to Travelodge. Although, the check-in procedure was straightforward, they were not very friendly and helpful. After a 30 hours journey from Europe I expected at least a little smile on receptionist's face or maybe a hint for a restaurant with decent food. However, all these little deficiencies were soon forgotten, when they emailed (in less than 3 hours) me a copy of the invoice that I lost on my way home. They did a fantastic job and without their help I would certainly missed the deadline for submitting my reimbursement application.

Reviews.Title: “Good no frills base”
Reviews.Author: hal9341
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights in early September. We found the hotel to be above average for a Travelodge. It's not luxury, but it is perfectly comfortable. The room was spacious, and had a small sofa. It also had a little kitchenette area. This was a small sink unit, plus a fridge and microwave. Crockery and cutlery are also supplied. We found that made it easy to eat our breakfasts in the room most mornings (and save money). The location is also very good. It's just a block or so away from Hyde Park.Oxford St is also on your doorstep. Circular Quay is about 20 minutes walk away, but the walk is past parks and shops so is nice. If you prefer to let the train take the strain, then the underground staion is also very close by. It's only two stops to the Quay. My only gripe with the hotel was the check out time - 10am. That's earlier than I am used to, and they don't tell you this when you check in. Make sure you are aware of this, and plan your last day accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: fluminese
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel! When we arrived after 32 hours of travelling we were informed that our room would be ready at 2pm ready for check in. That was 7 hours after when we arrived. I accept that we were at fault for not booking the room from the night before, but the lack of help from the receptionist was staggering. He had to be prompted to let us leave our luggage in a safe room. He was completely unhelpful when asked if there was anyway we could check in earlier. He also refused to give me any documentation to prove that we were at the hotel at 6:30am so that I could complain to our travel agent. We were basically told come back in 7 hours. We didnâ€™t even get a map. Even though there being a pad full of maps behind the desk. When finally checking in we were given no information regarding breakfast times or the fact that your key would only work when swiped in the lift. On our return after our first night our room key didnâ€™t work. Whilst travelling in the lift there were two prostitutes (sorry escort girls) with security passes issued. There appeared to be a high demand for these â€˜escort girlsâ€™ with several brochures advertising the different agencies. The hotel was only about two minutes away from the sex district so I suppose that it was logical that this hotel was used. The double glazing in the room was none existent which for a city is unforgivable and given the fact that the bottle banks were emptied every morning at 5am this provided an unwelcome wake up call. The reception was very punctual also ringing our room at 6am with a wake up call even though we didnâ€™t request one. All in all downstairs was clean and the breakfast was above average, but the staff were poor. The room was reasonable, but I agree with previous comments in that the carpet was stained. I personally would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: samiez
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and booked 2 rooms that interconnected which was great, we only were in Sydney for 4 days so just wanted somewhere cheap to stay that was clean and comfortable. Front desk staff where friendly and willing to help with any requests. The rooms are small but are your typical hotel style room, decor was modern and the rooms where clean and fresh. This hotel is not right in the hart of the shops but its not far to walk to the shops and there is a mono rail that circles the city, and Darling Harbour. There is a restaurant on site however they only serve breakfast which is hot and cold buffett and worth the price. There are about 4 internet desks and cost around $2 for 15 mins if i remember right. Would stay here again for short term stay, would not recommend for more than 4 nights max.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: yaddayadda77
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have felt the need to complain about a hotel but I was so disappointed with the Travelodge Wentworth Avenue that I'd like to warn people! Having booked through Wotif.com, I was in a twin room on the 4th floor (had requested a double room when I booked but when I got here I was told that, as I had booked through Wotif, I didn't get any choice). The room was not clean by any reasonable standard, especially the bathroom. The carpet was stained in a number of places and just generally looked filthy. The fridge had a number of unidentified stains both inside and out. The bathroom floor didn't look like it had been cleaned for some time and, perhaps worst of all, someone had picked their nose and wiped it onto the wall by the sink (ironically, right next to the tissue dispenser). The outside of the toilet bowl had something on it which I dare not even venture a guess as to what it was. The two air vents were caked in dust. The grouting around the tiles was yellow and the tiles themselves were dirty. To top it all off, flies were getting into the room somewhere, either via the filthy vents or the ageing aircon unit that looms over the door. I killed about 15 of them during my fun-filled 6 night stay. The hotel is clearly popular with the Asian tourist market and I often found myself queuing for one of the three small lifts each time a bus load had just checked in. For a 17 floor building, 3 small lifts is clearly not enough. The doors are loud and squeaky so if, as I was, you're next door to some apparently restless people, the incessant squeaking and slamming will be very annoying. In the spirit of diplomacy, I would say that the hotel is in a good central location and, for the $99 per night I paid, it was cheap for somewhere in the central business district. But these points are hugely outweighed by the state of the room. Pay more to stay at a better quality of hotel or stay further out of the city where you'll get much better quality for the same price or less.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value City Centre Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Piglet-Leeds
Reviews.Content: We chose the Travelodge because it offers good value accommodation in an excellent location. Situated 2 minutes from Museum station by foot and a 15 AUS $ shuttle bus ride from the airport, the hotel has excellent transport links. All major local tour operators offer pick ups from the hotel for a wide range of day trips, and the hotel offers a good information service with plenty of leaflets, brochures and maps available. The hotel is a ten minute walk from Darling Harbour which houses a number of tourist attractions including Sydney Aquarium and the Imax Cinema as well as a wide range of shops and restaurants to suit every budget and taste. There are plenty of dining options even closer to the hotel in China Town and on Oxford Street, which is, as suggested by the array of rainbow flags, one of the main gay social districts of the city and also home to a range of cosmopolitan restaurants. The Rocks, Opera House and Harbour Bridge are all within 20-30mins leisurely walking distance or can be reached by public transport. In keeping with most Travelodge properties the hotel has relatively basic facilities with no restaurant or bar, although breakfast is available. There are plenty of food and drink vending machines and coin operated laundry facilities, and microwaves and basic crockery provided in bedrooms. We found that our room smelt a bit, probably due to the previous occupants having used the microwave, but it was clean and comfortable in spite of relatively basic furnishings. Being high up in the hotel our window did not open, but the room had adjustable air conditioning which made for a comfortable nightâ€™s sleep. The hotel was always busy and seemed to be popular with organised coach tours which meant the reception area could get very crowded, but the staff seemed to be very polite and quick to help. There are no leisure facilities on site but being right in the heart of Sydney you do not have to venture far to find a wealth of different activities. If you are looking for a luxury hotel experience then this is not the hotel for you, but if you simply want a comfortable base from which you can explore all that Sydney has to offer then the Travelodge is an ideal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: BEEPfromPARIS
Reviews.Content: About 135 AUD a night right from their website Althought a bit small, the room is very comfortable, well appointed with a kitchenette on one side of of the entrance and even a table in one corner of the room. The view from the room over the city was pleasant. Small but fully equipped bathroom. In fact everything was small, but everything was there and fully functionnal. Just south of Hyde park, a few block from Oxford. Very convenient. The price was correct for central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Rick10
Reviews.Content: The travelodge wentworth is a nice hotel for people on a budget. We booked through last minute.com australia and got a good rate. The rooms are average size for Australia and were more than enough for my wife and I. You are w/in walking distance of most everything...my wife and I walked to Darling Harbour, The Rocks, the Opera House, Central Station, and Circular Quay. We are young and don't mind walking though, so keep in mind that it's about 1km to the Opera House. To save some money, we went to Woolworth's (a few blocks from the hotel) and bought some cereal and milk and used the refridgerator in the hotel room; there is also a microwave in the hotel, which allows you to heat food up if you want to save money that way. Overall, it was a good stay for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: chris_from_singapore
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after a short 5 night holiday in Sydney. Stayed at the Travelodge, after going through some rigorous hotel hunting online. They offered a very attractive price for a minimum 5 night stay. The hotel looks relatively new from the outside. Check-in at the reception was a speedy affair, with just one queue for the reception which handled check-ins, check-outs, concierge, airport shuttle bookings, luggage storage (I would imagine a long queue if the hotel was full or if there was a big group at the hotel). The rooms were simple and well-appointed. We had a 12th floor room and this came with 2 single beds, a mini-kitchenette/corner with microwave, fridge and additional sink. While the furnishings were relatively sparse throughout the room, we felt this was more than sufficient for a very comfortable sleep. The bathrooms were relatively small, with only a shower area/corner. This was a little problemmatic because it shares the same flooring as the rest of the bathroom, and hence, water from the shower would tend to seep out and wet the whole bathroom, making for a wet floor! Location-wise, the hotel is slightly south of Hyde Park. We walked a fair bit in Sydney. Average timings from the hotel to Circular Quay/Sydney Opera House/The Rocks - 20-25mins, Darling Harbour - 20mins, Chinatown - 5mins, MYER/Pitt Street Mall - 15mins, Star City Casino - 30-35mins. Taxi to the Hotel from the Domestic Terminal at Sydney Airport came up to $26.50 including Airport tolls. The shuttle bus service that runs every half hour from the hotel cost $12 per person and is convenient if travelling alone. Otherwise, a taxi wouldn't cost much more and you would save a good 20mins spent picking passengers from the other hotels. Overall, the Travelodge Sydney offered good value for money for the price that they were charging. This was also evidenced by the popularity of the hotel, which almost always seem full of people in the mornings at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: GarryndKirsten
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during a three week holiday. Probably the least stylish/spectacular of all the accomodations we stayed at during our time in Oz. Its clean and tidy, rooms are quite small, but nothing wrong with them. Wasn't upset by the hotel, except the bar/restaurant wasn't open the whole time we were there. Location wise its not bad, considering the average price it was quite acceptable, not too far from anywhere, though we are young and very willing to walk. Nothing wrong with the hoel at all, bit bland and ordinary! We found this hotel by booking it through the tourist information centre in Melbourne, which is a very helpful place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tassie78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge for four nights. We found the hotel to be close to all major attractions (10min walk to Darling Harbour, Patty's Markets, Centre point etc). The Rooms were very clean, House keeping was excellent and very friendly. Would highly recommend, would definitley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “can't complain”
Reviews.Author: buds79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after booking it through "mystery hotel" from lastminute.com. And I have to say that I really can't complain. The hotel is clean, rooms are cleaned daily, with kitchenette and ensuite bathroom (which is important for me), and staff are quite friendly. It's close to the train station and cbd. my only comment was that the hotel can feel a bit crowded due to group bookings, but in general, it's relatively quiet for a peaceful sleep. for budget accommodation, this hotel is a gem. i stayed for 5 nights and most likely will return for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, No complaints for $100 a day”
Reviews.Author: myreview2007
Reviews.Content: Paid $100 a day for a twin room. Room was very spacious compared to the previous hotel i was in near capitol square. The room was very clean, furniture was new, beds were comfortable. Good location, less than 5 minute walk to chinatown,darling harbour. There are pubs just across the street. Overall, the hotel is clean, staff are friendly, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathyaf
Reviews.Content: We booked this as the reviews and the price were good and as such weren't expecting too much. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was large enough and the facilities were great. There was guest laundry on a number of floors (handy if your away for a long time like us) and the room was cleaned daily. The nearest tube was less than a 5 min walk and only took 5 mins to get to harbour. The hotel had a good bank of leaflets on all the attractions and tours etc and when we requested a late check out they obliged at no additional cost. Only slight issue was the internet use which is dial up speed but thats being really picky.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: divingdiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days on arrival in Sydney. Flight landed 6a.m. but can't check in till 2pm so this could be a problem for some. Luckily we could leave our cases at our son's flat. Check in was quick and painless - had booked from the UK and no problems with this. The room was large enough, as was the bathroom, although as other people have said, the whole bathroom floor gets wet when you use the shower as it is not in a cubicle, it just has a curtain. I liked the fact that there was an iron and ironing board available in the room. Towels were changed every day even if we had not left them on the floor which was meant to be the sign that you wanted them changed. The location of the hotel was good, close to Hyde Park and a pleasant walk to the city and harbour. All in all we felt it was good value for money - a clean and comfortable place to sleep after a long day's sigtseeing in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good value”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is close to Hyde Park where the Australia Day celebrations were being held. Check-in was very quick. My room was small, but adequate. I asked for a quiet room and was placed on the 16th floor, with a side view, but away from the busy intersection and noisy traffic. The room contained a microwave, fridge, kettle & iron. The bathroom had shower, but no bath. The hotel has its own shuttle bus to the airport. The hotel only serves breakfast, not dinner, but I prefer to eat out. There are plenty of cafes & restaurants close by. Be wary of Oxford Street area with night clubs, bars, poor cafes - looks dubious. Go towards Liverpool Street & Elizabeth Street - much better. About 10 mins walk to monorail or subway. Walk to harbour is a 30 min stroll. I would describe this hotel as clean and basic - nothing special, but nothing wrong either.

Reviews.Title: “Location Fantastic, Facilities not so great but all in all ok”
Reviews.Author: sparkymarky79
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week trip to Sydney and we stayed the full 2 weeks in the Travelodge in Wentworth Avenue. After the flight from hell we arrived and to be honest i was dreading it after reading the reviews on here before we left, but because of the location we thought we would grin and bear it. The check-in was quick and painless the booking was there and the lady behind the desk was polite and nice. She explained all about the Key card needed to access the lifts which i thought was good, thin gs like breakfast information and suck like. We arrived in our room and i was so surprised yes it was small but infact it wasn't that small for 2 of us, there was a another pull out bed in there if there were 3 of you but then it would have been to cramped. There was a little kitchenette thing with fridge, microwave and sink. They provided an iron, ironing board all the cuttelery we needed and a kettle, also there was washing up cloths and teatowel also provided. We could not fault the facilities they were clean and useable and not chipped or broken or anything. There was 2 single beds which were fine with sheets not quilts which were clean and smelt ok mainlly of bleach but not horrible like some hotels., the room was air conditioned which was nice and helped in the heat of the day. We had a nice window view windows didn't open but for obvious reasons. The room was basic but fine and to be honest we couldn't fault it. The came in and cleaned up everyday and occasionally when we hadn't washed up they also did that for us. All in all it was ok, the staff were helpful and gave us good advice of where to eat out and places to visit that were off the tourist list. The breakfast in the hotel i agree wasn't worth it and if there is a large number of coach parties in the breakfast in the morning can be really busy and noisey.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive For Location”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Good location for the money. Within about 15 minutes walk to many central Sydney locations and about 5 minutes to the closest train station. While the building is fairly modern, it is definately a budget hotel with a bit of a youth hostel feel about it and you need to consider this before booking in. The rooms are clean, smallish but most if not all have TV and bar fridges. Our room had minor problems with the TV and water taps although not enough to cause anything more than a bit of inconvenience. I have heard it can be a bit loud at times but did not find that to be the case when we stayed. The hotel has limited facilities Ie; a breakfast only restaurant (very uninspiring and overpriced) and inconvenient off site parking. There is a pretty reasonable Thai restaurant (Alice's) across the street in one of the old hotels and some restaurants will deliver to your room if you dont feel like a short walk to Oxford Street for a meal. Anyone who wishes a bit of luxury (or anything more than a low frills place to stay) will probably be unimpressed with this hotel. It is definately nothing fancy and lacks some of the basic ammenities that many (more expensive) hotels have. As far as a budget hotel is concerned I pretty well got what I was expecting; a decent place to lay my head at the end of a long day seeing and experiencing Sydney. The money I saved staying at the Travelodge I spend sightseeing. That is what I came to Sydney for.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghMan
Reviews.Content: Right, it seems safe to assume that if you are looking at a review of this hotel you are looking for budget accommodation in Sydney that is clean, safe and near to the heart of things? Does the Travelodge fit the bill? Well, maybe. Be under no illusions, this is not a hotel in the normal sense. In truth it is a safe place to sleep, wash and really little more. Apart from the breakfast there are no restaurant facilities. Speaking of breakfast, do yourself a favour and eat somewhere in town as the breakfast here is not really worth the money. Cereals, fruit juice, ham, cheese and some sterile mhot items make up the list but they don't amount to much, so if you can eat elsewhere. The reception staff are by and large frazzled and really do't mind much if you stay or not. It is like a low cost airline, another punter will be along soon, so perhaps because they are so busy they have no real interest in you. When I booked onnthe hotel website I asked if I could be given an early check in as I was coming on a flight from the UK. When I arrived we were told check-in was 2pm and no room coulod be released until then. OK perhaps they were full, but the provision of shower facilities might have been considered as I suspect that many guests arrive after long travel. The room was a good size and almost acceptably clean. The wall in the bathroom had stains on it and this could and should have been cleaned. This was a minor issue and for the money I thought the room was actually quite good. Although some people have said the rooms can be noisey, I heard nothing at all. Yes the hotel can be over-run with school kids, but what do you expect, it's that kind of place. To be honest you can get noisy guests in the most expensive hotels. I thought the area around the hotel was very uninspiring and there were no real restaurants worth speaking of. Take a 10 dollar taxi ride to the Sydney Harbour area or to downtown and you will get your fill of restaurants. Walking to downtown will take about 30 minutes so factor that in when deciding where to stay In short, the Travelodge is basic so expect no frills. the breakfast is expensive and not worth it and there is no restaurant. However if you get the price right and want clean and warm accommodation then this might be the place for you. One last point, they do have a very security conscious left luggage facility, especially if you have a laptop computer - full marks on that regard. 5 star it isn't, basic but acceptable it is. Pay your money and make your choice, the Travelodge is proof that you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: privers78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in December 2006. The only thing going for this hotel is the location. Close to everything.... train, bus, shops, Darling Harbour, Oxford Street. Upon check in, we found our bathroom was infested with fleas. We then changed rooms and then had a fridge that didn't chill properly. The beds were uncomfortable, the bathroom floor gets saturated when you take a shower and the front doors to the hotel are blocked by smokers and clouds of cigarette smoke. This is nothing more than a youth hostel. You get what you pay for in this case.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gempul83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the travelodge for 7 days in Sydney, best thing is the location - Sydney is massive but you can walk to most places from here, if not there is a good bus link at the top of the road - reception staff help out with which bus to catch where. The hotel was average, the rooms had own fridge, microwave and T.V. They were clean enough, the maid came everyday to change bedding, towels etc they were just basic which is what you'd expect from a travelodge. The safe at reception is free and is also manned 24 hours so they can let you in after a night out! The breakfast was expensive so didn't try but plenty of places to eat in sydney. Overall would stay again purely on location, and for what we paid cant really complain for a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accomodation with good location”
Reviews.Author: loftmeister
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, appox a 10 min walk from the train station (museum). It has a very youth hostel feel about it. It was packed full of young travellers and was very noisey, even in the early hours there were doors being open and closed all the time. I didnt find the staff that helpful, I was kept waiting for 4 hours in the reception area until my room came avaliable. It was a Sunday morning and there was nowhere open, so i opted to wait until my room had been cleaned. I am sure i caught them on a bad day but it didnt leave a good impression on me.

Reviews.Title: “only the b/fast was a let down”
Reviews.Author: royindiana
Reviews.Content: Location is good, room was great but not the view from room. reception staff was pathetic didn't want to borrow the adaptor instead asking me to pay 15 dollar to buy from them (but in melbourne the same hotel you can borrow with just paying 20 dollar deposit). B/fast was dissapointing except the hot chocolate. security in the lugage room was lacking (self service). other than this grouses, the hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Travelodge Wentworth in Sydney was on the night of November 12, 2006, for one night in room 1423 and it was my second stay at this hotel in a year and 1/2. I chose this hotel because of its convenient location to the Oxford Street area, Chinatown, and Darling harbor. The room was booked on the hotel's websight and included tax, but, not breakfast. I took the city train from the conveniently located airport station to the nearby Museum Station near the hotel (A$12.30) As my flight arrived early in the a.m. the room wasn't ready and I stored my luggage in the luggage storage room and headed for the gym. Other posts mentioning the lack of security are true, I stored my own luggage in the room and picked it up by myself 4 hours later. There appeared to be nobody on duty for assistance in this room directly adjacent to the Front Desk. My room was small with 2 twin beds, table, chairs, small bathroom with shower only, and small kitchen with silverware, plates, microwave, coffee/tea pot, and coffee/tea. The deadbolt on the door was half missing, leaving it unusable. Noise from groups arriving/departing in the hallways was an annoyance. There was, however, no noise from adjacent rooms and little hallway noise during the evening/night hours. Check-out time of 10am was rather early, but, I was given an extra hour with no problem. All of my dealings with the front desk staff were pleasant. I would select this hotel in the future because of its great location and fair price. If you are looking for luxury and special services, you may wish to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: KGTravels
Reviews.Content: Not too bad a hotel. Good location, room ok, but breakfast was pretty ropey, and if you have not got breakfast included in your stay, it's a pretty expensive option considering there is an abundance of good eating places on and nearby Oxford Street. Check in was painless, although soon after a big coach-load arrived, which may have been a bit distressing! Reception staff were fine and efficient. Not sure I would race back there again, but it was fine for our three-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nonexistent service”
Reviews.Author: dompac
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be called "Backpackers Wentworth "not Travelodge. Though the rooms themselves are adequate there is no sevice to be had for any price. The harassed staff at reception is unable to offer any local knowledge or information to visitors. When asked to call a taxi we were advised to stand on the corner of the street and flag one down. We left our room at 10 a.m. and left a card to have it serviced. On our return at 4 p.m. we found it exactly as we left it. It took two phone calls to reception and 45 minutes to have fresh towels and other supplies delivered and the service person who finally turned up told us that it is "hotel strategy" not to make up occupied rooms until late afternoon and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at great prices”
Reviews.Author: Spliff
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel great value for money. Very central with everything within walking distance. The rooms have a small kitchen area with fridge, microwave and table so you can buy bread etc and have breakfast in your room. We did this most mornings as we have 3 children and thought breakfast in a lot of Sydney cafes was quite expensive. If you stay at travelodges in th UK you'll know what to expect, but as I've said the location is great. Really good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Travelodge Wentworth Sydney. The hotel is decorated in Scandinavian modern. The room was comfortable and clean and included a kitchenette with a sink, refrigerator, microwave and utensils. We ate breakfast in the room to save money. (We got such a good rate, that breakfast was not included!) We utilized the laundry twice. Some staff were accommodating; others not so. My only criticism is that the hotel is located at the edge of the central business district. So, unfortunately there are few places to eat close by once business hours are done. But it is near a train station that helps you get around Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Meet all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: FPL10
Reviews.Content: Had heard about the a few bad experiences before we arrived such as not been allowed early check-in and poor security in the luggage store room.
