Upon our arrival on an early flight we requested an early check-in (we got there at about 9.30am) and the staff member (Rochelle) enthusiastically said "No problem!" She also briefed us on things to do etc and where local shops were for eating (their restaurant only serves breakfast). We also requested a late check out at 12pm - again no problem. The room we got fully met our expectations, clean and spacious for a budget hotel. Location was handy to so many things, Museum rail station less than 5 minutes walk away, CBD 10-15 minutes across Hyde Park, and Chinatown & Oxford St also close by. For those with little luggage the close proximity of Museum Station means you have an alternative way to get to & from the Airport as this line connects directly into the international & domestic terminals. Cost was AUD13 pp one way. Upon checkout we stored our luggage in the store room which a staff member unlocked and supervised us while we stored our stuff. Obviously listened to complaints about previous security concerns and addressed them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sydneygal85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel for two nights last week, and found it to be fantastic value for money. Staff were friendly, facilities were great, the motel was modern and clean, and my room was spacious, clean, modern, with everything I could possibly need. I will be returning to this motel in the near future, and would recommend it to anyone else. Absolutely brilliant value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Room fine..neighbours not!”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: Overall a good no frill hotel. Clean room and bathroom. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Location great, near Hyde Park and Oxford Street. Not that far to walk to any other attractions. My only misfortune was that an american teenage convention also stayed at this hotel at the same time. This meant lots of door slamming , excited high pitched voices, noise through the walls etc. However, I have stayed before and it was fine. Teenagers just being teenagers, but at 2am....i prefer to be asleep and not woken up by excited loud teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay - Would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there May 19-May 24. Their check-in time is 2:00 pm, but they will allow you to store your luggage in the meantime. This is a very nice service, especially if you arrive at Sydney in the early morning, as most international flights do. Since we were traveling during the less busy season, the staff at the front desk were so courteous to allow us to check-in immediately upon our arrival (about 8:00 am), once it was determined that a room was indeed available that far in advance. This was an unexpectedly nice gesture on their part! We found the location very convenient to all our points of interest. Additionally, the hotel is close to two supermarkets, and a movie theater. Travelodge Wentworth also has coin-operated laundy facilities. Our room was spacious, and equipped with a microwave, fridge, kitchen sink, countertop, cable TV, iron, ironing board, tea/coffee maker, work table, and sofa bed. The room was very clean, and towels as well as toiletries were replenished daily. Our room was located on the 8th floor, and we found it to be very comfortable and quiet. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for those on a budget, ideally situated for the main tourist spots of Sydney. Rooms clean and well proportioned with good facilities for those staying for an extended period of time - we had a microwave and fridge, and there were washing machines available for use further along the landing. Staff were very helpful when it came to requests for extra pillows etc, and we managed to avoid any unpleasant early morning wake-up calls from the cleaners (they seem to wait until a reasonable hour before starting their rounds!). Didn't have any problems with noise from our fellow guests when we were there, even though the hotel was busy. The only downside really was the small reception area which got crowded from a relatively small amount of people, and also that the 'left luggage' room wasn't as secure as I would have liked it to be - it was behind reception but otherwise was unlocked and unmanned, with guests able to walk in and out without let or hinderance

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good enough”
Reviews.Author: Drezh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a fair distance from the city centre but very close to Hyde Park. The hotel provides a basic service. Breakfast is the only meal served and guests are encouraged to eat out or order take-away [directory provided in the room of various restaurants]. Each room has a microwave, kitchen area and laundry rooms are available on various floors. So it is very much a self-serve hotel. In general the hotel is clean and rooms are cleaned daily.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Price! - Will Definitely Come Back”
Reviews.Author: blue1wave
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2/22-2/25 2006. Lobby is rather small, with front desk of 3 people only. Read in others' reviews that queues for check-in/check-out do get very long, but I did not (fortunately for me) experience all those. However, they really are inflexible as to their check-in policy of 2pm, reasoning that they are fully booked (really?) and that they have no room to give you when you arrive for example around 8am from the early morning flights to Sydney. They do have a baggage storage area, but I don't think it's secure enough, especially since they cannot check your tag and bag tag if they are busy with those people lining up in the front desk. Location is admittedly not that central, but it is quite accessible within a 10 minute walk either to the main streets (Elizabeth St., Pitt St., George St., Liverpool St., Oxford St.) or to train and bus stations. So location is still good, considering that hotels in the main streets are priced a lot more expensive. The room is quite spacious, for the price. It has a microwave, fridge, a kitchen sink and countertop, ironing board, iron, sofa bed, working table, tv, and a double bed for me! Cleanliness has never been a problem for me, and towels and the other reusables are replenished each day. It's funny that the elevator says guests should swipe their cards for the car to stop in your floor, but even without doing so, it stops in your floor nevertheless. The breakfast is basic for $16.50. Luckily, my package already included breakfast vouchers. All in all, I'd rate my stay a 7 or 8 over 10, and I'd definitely stay in this hotel again if I do get to go back to Sydney on a budget trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomgem_lond
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, one minutes walk from hyde park, 15 from darling harbour, and 30 to circular quay. A cab from the airport is around $25. The hotel is used by large groups, although other than some congestion in the lobby of a morning there is little sign of us. The rooms themsleves offer all you need (mini bar, microwave, crockery, iron etc), they aren't the biggest ever, but we had 3 adults in one with no problems. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel, as there is a range of places to eat nearby for less, and teh hotel bar was always closed. However the hotel over the road has a good bar, and a very good and cheap Thai restaurant above it (Â£4 for a main course). If you have a car there is no street parking near the hotel, but they have an agreement with an underground car park not far away, and you can get 24hrs parking for $19, half the going rate, you just need to buy your ticket from the hotel reception. I would come back to this hotel if staying in sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent facilities at the price”
Reviews.Author: 02102010a
Reviews.Content: This is a decent budget hotel in Sydney just south of Hyde Park. The room was quite large and clean, if a bit stark, but I expected some 'starkness' at this price. There are useful items in the room such as small fridge, microwave, plates, cutlery, iron, ironing board. There was also a coin operated laundry on the same floor, very useful if like me you are on an extended trip. Breakfast was overpriced at around $16.50, but offered a reasonable choice. I tended to have breakfast elsewhere, but then you could keep milk and cereal in your room if you wanted to. There are convenience stores near the hotel and there is a large internet/coffee shop just west of the southern end of Hyde park. A few coin operated internet points are also available in the hotel. Darling harbour is about a 15 minute walk and the Circular Quay/Opera House area is 30+ minutes, and you could meander through Hyde Park and the Botanic Gardens on the way there. The 'Museum' metro stop is quite close to the hotel and is only 2 stops from Circular Quay. I did an 'eco' Blue Mountains Canyon day tour (leaflet picked up in the hotel lobby), worth doing for the views (if you can take the pace) and we ended the day taking coffee and tea next to some sleepy looking Kangaroos which live wild in a valley park, so worth doing if you want to escape from the city for a day.

Reviews.Title: “As recommended by others”
Reviews.Author: Chorizogolf
Reviews.Content: Other Tripadvisor reviewers pointed us towards this hotel and we are grateful. For a bargain price, we enjoyed a big room (with fridge, microwave and sink) where everything worked - plus a great view of downtown Sydney in a location very handy for the city's excellent public tranport system.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Reim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the travelodge for a few nights in the beginning of January and found it to be a great choice. It is conveniently located, but most importantly the rooms were quite spacious and clean. The decor was modern. The bathroom was lovely, and there was even an ironing board + iron, microwave , fridge (which you were encouraged to fill with your own food etc), tea and coffee making facilities. These little extras were really a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel to explore Sydney from”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, clean, conveniently located, very reasonably priced, the staff were incrediably helpful, they really couldn't do anymore to help. Would defiantley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ya_sweetie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Travelodge during Oct 2005. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff were very helpful. I didn't try the breakfast there because there are so many places where you can eat. The hotel is situated near Hyde Park and you can walk to nearly all the major attractions within Sydney like Center Point, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay. The trains are very reliable too, and the nearest train station to the Travelodge (which is just round the corner) is Museum, from this station you can take a train to Sydney International or Domestic terminal airports which is about $12 oz dollars single. If you get the chance to stay in Sydney I would definitely stay at the Travelodge. You can make cheap bookings by going direct to their website: -----. I found booking via their own website cheaper than booking through other websites on the Internet.
